Reviews.Title: “High expectations.... met!”
Reviews.Author: cvcrna
Reviews.Content: Disney is known for their customer services, so expectations were high. For the rates of this hotel, I expected exceptional services. WOW! The staff went above and beyond to accommodate or young family of five with two grandparents. From the moment we arrived to MCO to check out, we were really stress-free! I did not even lift my luggage until I arrived back home.

Reviews.Title: “Conference at Disney...”
Reviews.Author: mhbarker
Reviews.Content: I attended a 5 day conference held at the Disney Dolphin hotel in the same "park" as the Yacht club (there are 4 hotels and a "Boardwalk" scattered around a central lake a few hundred metres from Epcot). I wouldn't normally consider a Disney hotel, but the conference was there, so there wasn't much alternative. There are water buses running between the four resort hotels, The Boardwalk and Epcot. For proximity to the Boardwalk, the Swan hotel is much better, unfortunately it was already booked out by the time I was able to register for the conference. The greeting / check-in was a painfully protracted experience, compared e.g. with IHG / Hilton group check-in. American style service - friendly but soooo slow. Staff in reception are all dressed in kitsch naval outfits (the whole hotel is nautically themed), can´t see that it'd appeal to kids - possibly they are targeting retirees, but not really suitable for a conference hotel. The room was spacious, two huge comfortable beds, decent sized mini-fridge. Having the sinks in a carpeted area was odd as was the teeny-tiny little bathroom. Toiletries were pretty good quality - a decent sized bath to use them in would be even better. WiFi was very slow, I was often kicked off and even received an error message that there are too many people trying to log on. They perhaps need to upgrade their bandwidth? The hotel has a huge Disney shop just off the lobby which sells a wide variety of junk food but the nearest place to grab a quick sandwich is a 10 minute walk away on the other side of the lake :-/. The Boardwalk has a variety of restaurants, I used the Greek restaurant (edible) but they took about 20 minutes to seat us even *with a reservation time*, the Pizza Window was pretty good, the bakery does good cakes, but $12+ for a small sandwich and a diet coke is a rip off. The Boardwalk is hellishly expensive for what you get, and with the exception of a gas station, there is absolutely nothing else close to the resort, so without a car you'll have to pay Disney prices. After the conference finished I moved on to the Crowne Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Too much mouse...”
Reviews.Author: emgTX
Reviews.Content: Squeaky voices and too many ears! Hotel would be okay if they'd just realize that adults come here, too! We had no choice ... our conference was held here. TV sucked ... all disney and cartoons, incl ESPN x 5, and foreign language. NO movie channels and NO PPV movie choices. We asked to rent a movie for the DVD player one night and had our choices of Disney or Disney. Shower was a fine mist, and not adjustable. Food was mediocre at best. Even shopping offered everything in the world ... with ears or rat faces on it. Prices were exhorbitant including $90 admission to Epcot. Will go out of our way to miss this place EVER again! (I have never given a bad review before; prefer being positive, but couldn't hold back this time.)

Reviews.Title: “Say Yes to the Yacht Club”
Reviews.Author: JoanieO
Reviews.Content: Top notch hotel. Staff couldn't be more friendly and more helpful. The room was great, clean, bright! Location was wonderful - we could walk to Epcot. We ate at the Yachtsman Steakhouse - which was fabulous! Pricey - but possibly the best steak I ever had! The parks were surprisingly very crowded, which was not too big of a deal for us, we just went back to the poolside and ordered delicious mudslides. Great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for a Disneyworld vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Tinsman5
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Saturday for an 8 day stay and was greeted at the door by staff from the Yacht Club. The service here is much better than the service we received at other Disney properties (such as Riverside, Port Orleans, or All-Star Resorts). I had requested 1st floor rooms and close to transportation since my father is blind, but they did mess that up. They had my parents on the 1st floor and us on the 3rd floor. I had requested the rooms be by each other so that we could assist my parents if needed. I had checked on our room requests a couple of times before arriving, so it was a little frustrating that it wasn't accurate, but they fixed it right away. We got ajoining rooms on the 1st floor. The rooms were nice and spacious, but certainly not fancy or elaborate. We had a family of 5 in one room and my parents in the other room. The beds were really comfortable and my 5 year old daughter loved sleeping on the day bed. We didn't have any problems with noise or anything. I liked this resort because we were really close to both the bus and the boat transportation, not to mention the pool and the restaurants. We were in rooms 1085 and 1087. The property itself was nice enough; they did add tons of flowers during the week we were there and it brightened up everything so much more! I think they were getting ready for spring :) I think the hotel was very high priced, so that would be my only complaint...not totally sure it was worth twice as much as the cost of Riverside resort or another value resort. There was some construction on the resort outside, but I didn't hear any noise and had no problems getting around. The had a very nice gift shop and good restaurants and this resort. The Captain's Grill dinner was fabulous. We had ribeyes and cheese and bacon mashed potatoes. Everyone loved it! Everyone also loved their meal at the Yachtsmen Steakhouse. I liked the Captain's Grill better, however, and the prices were cheaper. The menus at the restaurants are not extensive, so look in advance to make sure there is something you like. We also ate at Cape May's Seafood Buffet; that was delicious as well! Even the food at the Hurrican Hanna's pool restuarant was good. I like the location of this resort! You can take a boat just right outside your room to MGM studios or Epcot. It was so easy. It does take a little extra time, but is worth it if your feet are tired. We always took to boat to MGM because the bus doesn't go there or to Epcot. Epcot is definitely within walking distance. We ate there several nights and easily walked there each night. My parents took the boat and we met them there. We could even see the Epcot fireworks from the patio off of our room! I think we will stay there again since the location is so convenient. Check-in and check-out was easy and simple. I highly recommend making all dinner or breakfast reservations in advance or you might be out of luck at the resort! One day the breakfast wait for a sit down meal was almost 1 hour. We had our dinner reservations way in advance, but weren't sure about breakfast. We were easily able to make breakfast reservations while we were there that week. We did also do the Cape May Character breakfast. The food was good and my daughter loved all the Disney Characters that came through. The pool was awesome at this resort for my 5 year old! She could go anywhere in the sand bottom pool and could touch the bottom. One day she skipped the theme parks all together to just stay back with me and play in the pool while the older kids went on the rides at the theme parks. The older kids did not really use one of the other deeper pools very much, so I don't know how they liked them. They thought the waterslide was fun. The do give out buckets and shovels with the kids meal at hurricane hannas, so your young child will have something to use in the sand. Overall, great trip. The Disney crowd at this time of the year was HUGE though. It was somewhat tiring to deal with the crowds for 8 days, but I still think it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Yacht Club March 2012”
Reviews.Author: momoftwinsOntario
Reviews.Content: The Disney Yacht Club is a beautiful resort. The room we were given was very spacious and had a view of the quiet pool. The main pool is spectacular, although there are renovations until May which made moving about the area very inconvenient. Although the staff was friendly, they did not go out of there way to make it a magical experience for our children. On one rainy day, the concierge had no idea of any activities for the children to do. The other inconvenience is the location of the nearest quick-serve. It is located at the Beach Club and from our location, it would have been closer to walk to the Swan and Dolphin. The location to Epcot and Hollywood studios was great. It was a five minute walk to the back entrance of Epcot which was great because there was never a line to enter the park. Hollywood Studios was about a 15 minute boat ride. Overall, the location and beauty of the area is a real bonus for staying at the Yacht Club. However, given the option, I think we would choose the Wilderness Lodge based on the attention given to children, location to Magic Kingdom and the ease at which to access the quick-serve restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Deluxe Hotel Resort - Disney Style”
Reviews.Author: Lorax001
Reviews.Content: Disney's Yacht Club is the sister resort to Disneyâ€™s Beach Club and shares amenities. Superb location to Epcot, a short walk to the rear entrance between the France and UK pavilions. The combined properties of the Yacht club and Beach club are quite large and have share a mini water park which is only accessible to guests of the two properties. The pools have sandy beaches, short lazy rivers, and a waterslide. You will need to get a bracelet from the pool attendants in order to access the pools. The only drawback to these pools is that they tend to close fairly early, not surprising due to lifeguard staff needed. The properties do have a few other standard pools which are open later and are rarely crowded (and much quieter!). This upscale resort property continues its New England yacht club theme at every opportunity, we truly felt like were we at a lakeside turn or the century hotel. Standard room sizes are hotel rooms, while immaculate they are not overly large and the maximum occupancy is 4 per room. Chances are you will not be spending much time in your room, but do not expect to end your day in your own private oasis. If you are looking for the best value, this is not the place but the location makes it easy to get to most places. Because the neighbouring resorts are all Deluxe the Disney busses are not usually crowded, making getting around less stressful than the value resorts.

Reviews.Title: “First stay at Disney....”
Reviews.Author: islandlovers_8
Reviews.Content: My company recenlty sent us to the Yacht Club for a meeting. My first excperince at the hotel was lunch with a beautiful view. Our company provided a buffet which was hosted by the Yacht Club. I have to say that for buffet food (sitting out in 82 degree weather ) it was delicious! The waitstaff was very attentive to the tables and there was never a dirty plate laying around. They would come in and wisk them away immediatley. Check in went very smooth, especially considering over 300 people were checking in at once!!!! The room was a bit small, but the decor was cute in its nautical theme. The beds were VERY comfortable. I would say it may actually have been more comfortable than my own bed. Pillows, mattress, and comforter are avaliable for sale if you like them that much!!!However, getting luggage was an issue!!! I was aware that there was 300 people checking in at once....I waited over an hour for my luggage and almost missed the bus with my group for Disney World. After being told several times it was on its way, I headed down stairs and got it myself. Checking out for others was quick and painless. I however, received someone elses room charges on my room. After about 30 min. and three employees later someone figured out how to get the charges off my room. I was only frustrated for the 30 min. I was dealing with the front desk, after all your in Disney World!!! Everything is magical and happy there. The other little perk!!!! They have an airport kiosk right at the hotel. I was able to check in and get my boarding pass ...they did all the work!! Overall, it was a good experince. I plan on returning to Orlando in the future with my family. I will defiantly consider Yacht Club for my stay.

Reviews.Title: “THIS is a Disney resort?”
Reviews.Author: Kimquita
Reviews.Content: The room itself was clean and served it's purpose. The hotel itself was nicely decorated and not too loud. The restaurants on property were chain quality. The staff here is iffy. Some are very loud and abrubt and some are kind and accomodating but they are all forgetful. I called the front desk one morning to ask for an disposible razor. It was never brought up to the room. Also, I was there for a business conference and all the employees rooms were being paid through a master account. I was asked for my credit card for incidentals. I complied but confirmed with the front desk associate that the stay was being paid by the master account. When I received my expense report an additional night was charged to my card. This happened to another one of my co-workers. We are in the process of having it corrected. The hotel was undergoing construction during my stay. One evening around 6pm when I returned to my hotel room there was a construction worker on my balcony and my sliding glass door was ajar. A little warning would have been nice. I was scared half to death. This is not what I would have expected from a Disney hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location, Great Access to Epcot and Hollywood Studios”
Reviews.Author: MaryBeth5150
Reviews.Content: Recently stated at the Yacht Club and truly enjoyed it. The room was a bit small, but comfortable. We were asked what time we would like our room made up. This was honored the first day, but not the second. I did call the concierge and it was corrected promptly. The room also had a coffee maker, but somewhat antiquated. Could have really used a Keurig!!! We used up the only two caffeinated coffee packets and housekeeping replaced them with decaff!! If there is one thing you need in Disney, it's caffeine. Once again I had to call and the coffee packets were brought up promptly. The Concierge Level was outstanding and the level of service was exceptional. I was assisted with boarding passes as well. The food choices were terrific and those homemade potato chips with red pepper dip were delicious!!!! The servers ware always friendly and attentive - whatever your need - they were on it. I would highly recommend this hotel. We have stayed in Disney multiple times but had never stayed at an Epcot Resort - this one was wonderful. Our most recent Disney vacation was several years ago at the Wilderness Lodge and we were all very disappointed with the level of service. We also had a marvelous meal at the Yachtsman Steakhouse with exceptional service and meal quality. We all enjoyed our steaks and they were cooked to perfection. It was also nice to see that a cast member was checking hotel cards for guests attempting to use the pool facilities at the Yacht Club. This was one of my complaints at the Wilderness. Many people would stay at a "Value Resort" then get dropped off at the Wilderness and use the pool. Many times, I would not be able to find a beach chair - very frustrating to those who pay top dollar to stay close to the park. If you are thinking of Disney - consider the Yacht Club but spring for a suite if you have a family - it's pricey, but if you spend time in the room you will be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: NewfoundlandDorie
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay in Disney's Yacht Club and my first say at the club level on the 5th floor. Earl and I needed a break after a difficult Dec - Jan during which time Earl's father passed away after weeks of intense illness. We opted for Disney World because of the ability to relax or be active - do nothing or walk around and ride 'til you drop. The Yacht Club was a great choice - a little more on the adult side theme wise, luxurious, and walking distance to 2 theme parks. I had stayed in Yacht Club rooms already and the Club level rooms were identical to the rooms that I had stayed in on former visits. No surprises there. The rooms are spacious with 2 queen size beds, a sofa, desk, double sink and separate toilet / tub.The rooms are bright with lots of white furniture and a large flat screen TV. Free wifi internet works easily and is quite fast. The air conditioning is excellent and quiet. Maid service in club level can be requested for a specific time that is convenient for you. The rooms are, of course, immaculately clean. There is a lounge available at club level that offers a decent continental breakfast. Typically you have all the usual beverages (coffee, tea juices, milk) some pastries, hard boiled eggs, homemade oatmeal and fresh fruit. This is available from 7-10:30 am. Then snacks are available from 12-4 pm. Hors d'oeuvres are available from 5-7 pm and desserts are from 8-10 pm. From 5 - 7 you also have some beer wine and drinks available. From 8-10 there are some liqueurs available. Offerings are substantial, fresh and plentiful. Most hors d'oeuvres include a seafood item such as lobster, scallops or shrimp. Very delicious!! This is perhaps my very favourite hotel in all of WDW for convenience. If you go out the front it is a very short walk to the single bus stop which is covered and has some seating. This is the first stop for buses going from the yacht and beach club to any theme park except Epcot or the studios. Alternatively, if you go out the back door you are directly in line for the dock for the boats to Epcot and Studios. Very quick and easy. Note: The boat dock is often a quiet place to watch the higher fireworks from Illuminations (if you want to watch from outside). Stormalong bay is right next door and is a great pool with a lovely setting and a water slide. The main entrance seems to be closer to the Beach Club entrance. There may be another way in for Yacht \club guests, but we didn't look for one. It is only a short walk. You have to have a room key to enter because this pool is reserved for Y & B resort guests only. This is a great place to stay if relaxing is the main point of your visit. The dining options surrounding the yc are bountiful. There are all the restaurants on the Boardwalk, at the Yacht and Beach Club and at the swan and Dolphin hotels. These restaurants alone are amazing ranging from great steakhouses, to Todd Englishes Blue, Fresh, to the fabulous Beaches and Cream soda shop and an all you can eat buffet at Cap May Cafe . Then, inside Epcot you have all the World Showcase restaurants awaiting. Dining options just don`t get much better than this Bottom line, this is a great option for business, couples, or solo travellers. Families may find the Beach Club next door to be a little more relaxed, have easier access to the fabulous pool, shorter walk to Epcot and just overall have a more family friendly atmosphere. we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Best All-Around Hotel on Disney Property for Adults”
Reviews.Author: Liz C
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a number of Disney properties over the years with over 30+ visits during my lifetime. After staying at others, I now stay exclusively at the Yacht Club. The three main draws for me are its location, pool facilities and decor. The Yacht Club, Beach Club and Boardwalk all have access to the back of Epcot (the countries, right between France and England) through a walkway which is about a 1/4-1/2 mile long. As an adult traveler, it is nice to be able to shower up after the pool and simply stroll to dinner and drinks at one of the Epcot countries then stroll back after the Illuminations fireworks - no running to fight the crowd out to catch a bus. The Beach Club and Boardwalk are slightly closer to Epcot, but the Yacht Club makes up for the extra steps in other ways. These three hotels also share a boat that takes you to Hollywood Studios. The Yacht and Beach club share a pool which is much bigger and sprawled out than all of the other pools I have seen on Disney property. On a hot day in the afternoon, it can be a challenge to find a lounge chair, or at least one in a spot of your liking. In that case, just find a chair to throw your clothes and hop in the water! Part of the pool (near Hurricane Hannah's grill) is deeper with a current and makes for nice floating and relaxed swimming. Since the water is deep, this area is quieter because there are less kids! The pool bar has Hurricane Reef Lager on tap, which I had never had before Disney, but discovered I love! The Beach Club is very comparable to the Yacht Club in terms of rooms (same size and layout) and facilities (they share the pool, fitness center, restaurants etc). The Yacht Club lobby is a little more upscale and quiet; the beach club's is usually noisier and more hectic. The Beach Club may be better if traveling with younger children as it seems less formal. The Beach Club also has quick serve food - egg sandwiches and pastries for breakfast, sandwiches and gelato for lunch/snack - right in their gift shop, whereas the Yacht Club doesn't. We usually walk all the way there for breakfast or across the lake to the Boardwalk Bakery. That is one downside to the YC. The rooms are nice and simple with clean white linens (other hotels have cheesy looking colorful bedspreads). A few times we have been put in rooms that were FAR FAR away from the lobby area. There are some rooms that overlook a swamp by the Swan/Dolphin hotels. The times when this happened to us, I called back from the room phone and asked to be switched to a different room and was usually accommodated (one time the new room was over the bus stop which wasn't ideal either, but better than a swamp!). Generally though, if you're not happy with your room and express that, Disney will work to make it better. If the cast member helping you is not actually helping (which has happened), just ask to speak to a manager- they always go above and beyond to fix anything you're not satisfied with.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Shirtisred
Reviews.Content: Very nice resort. Perfectly located on the boardwalk. Excellent service. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: Jenkinsons
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took our sons to Disney World last summer for their first time. Our stay at the Yacht Club could not have been any better. In addition to the room being exceptionally clean, we had a great view of the nightly Epcot fireworks display. The sand bottom pool is huge, and the water slide is fun for children and adults. My sons loved everything about the Yacht Club (game room, poolside activities, location, etc.). I know that all of the Disney Resorts are nice; however, after staying at the Yacht Club, I do not think we would stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Second time around - still pleased with results”
Reviews.Author: momsin212
Reviews.Content: They have every amenity and then some.... Wonderfully comfy beds, well lit rooms...flat screen tv and tiny fridge...toliet/tub is a tad small but nothin we couldn't put up with! Best swimming pool (sandy beaches!!!!)

Reviews.Title: “It was ok”
Reviews.Author: travisanti
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our recent trip to Disney. We originally had booked a 5 day stay. We started out at the Grand Floridian. Maybe that is what is tainting my review somewhat. We stayed in a standard room on the concierge level. Our room was not what we requested. I had made this reservation in August and this was a February stay so it was 6 months in advance. We requested two beds close to the lounge. We did get a room close to the lounge BUT we were given one QUEEN bed with a day bed and a sleeper chair. The room was clean and the view was fine (we could actually see the Magic Kingdom fireworks from the room) but a queen size bed is not big enough. I am sure we were given this room as there were just two of us but we always request two beds. If they are going to have a "one bed room" then it should be a King size bed - just saying. We asked about switching rooms but that is a big hassle and if you have the hotel help you get ready for a big tip.... They didn't have another room ready and when it was ready it was far away down a long hall so we did not change rooms that evening. The concierge offerings were basic - again at the Grand Floridian they were much more extensive. I think all of the lounges should have the same "amount" of choices - different choices as they are from the resorts restaurant but the same amount of food - not just a couple of little choices as we found here at the Yacht Club. The next morning we decided to go back to the Grand Floridian and requested a two bed room and moved. There wasn't anything wrong with it but the club lounge is very small. When they put the food out get ready for a line and it gets quite crowded. They also close the doors between offerings so you can't even get any water at off hours. At the Grand Floridian you can get beverages all day. It is an easy walk to the country area of Epcot or you can take a boat or a boat ride to Hollywood studios. I found the boat ride to Hollywood studios long as it makes a stop at the Swan/Dolphin before going. I would make sure you allow 45 minutes to an hour to get to the studios minimum especially if you have a restaurant reservation. We used the quiet pool but not the large theme pool. The staff were by far the most friendly in all 3 of the resorts we stayed at Disney. They went out of their way to help you and were always saying hi and willing to do anything you need. The bathroom has a double sink area and separate tub/toilet area but it is a very tight fit to close the door to that area. All in all a good stay overnight but I prefer the Magic Kingdom area resorts and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort for adults and kids!”
Reviews.Author: Julene S
Reviews.Content: Even if Epcot wasn't a short walk away, this would still be a great place to come for vacation. The decor is wonderful, the staff friendly and helpful, the atmosphere is relaxing and there is so much to do. The pool is fanatic, and there are activities for kids and adults. They often have games and contests being run by the staff, night time movies and great restaurants. Can't say enough about this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with our hotel choice in Disney”
Reviews.Author: josiegrammer
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Disney before and usually stay on the monorail near MK, but since my kids are a little older now (8 and 11) I thought we could try something different. I debated a lot between the yacht club and animal kingdom lodge and settled on the yacht club. I think the location and pool make it a great choice. We spent alot of time at Epcot and Hollywood studios and being able to walk to both parks was awesome. Epcot is 5 minutes to get to a back entrance near "France" and Hollywood Studios is about 15 minutes. Or you can take a boat to either. MK or Animal Kingdom you have to do the buses and personally I found them so slow that we alternated between the buses and taxis. Pool is awesome. Doing a little construction on it while we were there but my kids loved it. Also loved the whole boardwalk that was right there. People were jogging, you can rent bikes, and there are restaurants and shops to check out.... We could have spent a couple of days just hanging out around there. We paid for the lagoon view room which was a food size, but we were a little disappointed in the construction going on outside our window. They are refurbishing the outside of the hotel so if you are going to the hotel soon ask about that. It was a lovely view out to the water and of the boardwalk but not so much with cranes in the way. Also it was noisy starting at about 8am. Again, this doesn't seem like a big project that they are doing, just some painting and stuff, it was just kind of a bummer. It was nice to see the Epcot fireworks from the balcony, but I'm not sure I would pay for that view again because you are never in the room anyway. We had dinner at the Animal Kingdom Lodge and that hotel was really impressive in a grand, Disney kind of way. Very different from the lobby of the Yacht Club. But the location of the yacht club was just perfect for our family. I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: DH0lland
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a relative's birthday celebration. This hotel was chosen because it is extremely convenient to Epcot and is supposed to be one of Disney's best resorts. However, this hotel is just so-so. The staff was quite friendly and efficient, but the room was just average and not particularly clean. We ate dinner in the onsite steak house and it was terrible. This was my first stay at a Disney resort and since this is supposed to be one of their best, it's probably my last.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite Disney Resort”
Reviews.Author: stephanie b
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and our family loved the feel of the resort. We are a family of five with one preschooler, one in kindergarden and one in second grade. We stayed in the club level rooms. Our room was quiet, with a beautiful view of the Boardwalk. Our family enjoyed watching the fireworks from our balcony at night. The club room always had snacks for adults and kids. In the evening it was nice to grab a drink with my husband while our kids would get a snack before dinner. The service at the Yachtsman is wonderful. We had dinner reservations and we stayed in the club room upstairs having cocktails until our table was ready and the concierge came and got us. When we arrived at the restaurant and the waiter brought out a frost mug for my husbands beer, that he brought with him from the club room. The wait staff was very attentive to our children and we had a lovely time. The walk to Epcot was very nice and took about five minutes, the walk to MGM was little long but there was a boat that you could take if you were not up for the walk. My children loved the pool and the resort so much that we will be back the first week of november. This resort is quiet and low key and has a lot of appeal to those who appreciate quiet attentive service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice for Scooter-Bound Travelers/Not for Little Kids”
Reviews.Author: Supermom123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights with my children and elderly mother-in-law who is fragile and scooter-bound. We wanted a place that was convenient for getting to the parks on a scooter, so as to minimize the loading and unloading of the scooter from the park buses. Here is how to get around on a scooter without a bus: To Epcot - Scoot over to World Showcase Entrance. Very quick and convenient. To Hollywood Studios - Scoot to the boat loading dock. Ride scooter onto the boat. Or, scoot down the walking path to Hollywood Studios, but make sure your battery is charged! To Magic Kingdom - Scoot through Epcot to Monorail, ride Monorail to Magic Kingdom. Park Hopper needed for this route. Takes a little while, but easier than bus. To Animal Kingdom - Sorry, you need to load scooter onto a bus. Three out of four is not bad! The Yacht Club is a resort for travelers who enjoy comfort and luxury, and want to linger at mealtimes. The rooms are spacious enough for a family of four or five. The rooms are also comfortable and bright. The bathroom counter has plenty of space for toiletries. There is a spacious closet, dresser and drawers for clothes. The two queen beds are comfortable, and the couch is also a day bed, large enough for a 10 year old child. There are two sit-down restaurants here, and the Beaches & Cream soda pop shop near the pool. This is not a great set-up for families that want to eat and run to the parks. If you walk through the corridor to the connecting Beach Club resort, you will find a small counter service restaurant inside of the gift shop. Again, this is not very convenient for families who want a quick and convenient meal. The pool area is beautiful. It is a warm, saltwater pool. There is a sand bottom section for little kids, and a lazy river for stronger swimmers. However, beware of the slide which empties into a 5 foot deep section of the pool. Not for little ones, or weak swimmers. Also, it is easy to "lose" your kids at this pool. The pool is large and winding, and the deck areas can't always follow the path of the pool. I had to run over bridges, and up and down stairs to keep up with the movement of my kids. It is also easy for kids to end up in deeper waters. Be vigilant. Overall, this is a great resort for scooter-bound travelers, and families with kids over 7. I don't feel this resort is convenient enough for families with very young kids due to the lack of a counter service restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Still and Excellent Choice after 15 years”
Reviews.Author: broadbeachboy
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Yacht Club at Disneyworld for NYE and had not been there for nearly 15 years but it really was as comfortable for our family as the previous visit so many years prior. From a location point of view it really is such a convenient venue as we were able to always travel around the to the varoius parks at Disneyworld and also walk easily to to reataurants at the Boardwalk, the Doplhin Hotel, the Swan Hotel & Epcot. We stayed on the Concierge Level and thoroughly enjoyed the breakfast & evening drinks. All the staff were extremely helpful and nothing was too much trouble & they always had recommendations for extra things to see & do.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite Disney Resort”
Reviews.Author: KrystenMejia
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Yacht club. We spent several days at Epcot and the location is ideal. Entrance to the world showcase is a 10 min walk or boat ride away. Since Epcot has the best restaurants, we ended most of our days there and strolled back to the Yacht Club taking a detour around the boardwalk to take in the street performers. Yacht Club has a more grown up feel but still offers the kids the best pool at Disney. I think it's the perfect compromise!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location - Great Service”
Reviews.Author: cabjohnson
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed at the Yacht Club on vacation and to me it's the best of the Disney resorts because of the location. You can walk 5 minutes into Epcot, take the boat (or walk 15 minutes) to Hollywood Studios or take the monorail in Epcot to th Magic Kingdom. The rooms are nice size and in very good shape. The service was great. My only gripe was that the pool was way too hot, almost like a spa. Would have bene much nicer if it was about 10 - 15 degrees cooler to cool off after a day in the parks. Casual restaurant was nice. Ice cream parlor was good. Water park by the pool is good for small kids. Teens will be bored but it's still nice. One suggestion is to use one of the grocery services to stock up the small frige in the room and on non-parisahables. I used "We go shop". They were very nice and bought everything we asked, and even shopped for sales. They met us at the room when we checked in and even loaded the frige for us.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sandra B
Reviews.Content: We as a family have stayed at this hotel 3 times, it is a very comfortable hotel and is located within walking distance of Epcot. I like this hotel because the beds are very comfortable and the rooms are well equipped. The staff are friendly, it has excellent dining, and it has a fantastic Ice Cream Palour. Because it is so near Epcot, it is quite nice to take a leisurely stroll into the park, and if you arrange your day accordingly. you can walk back at night, The World Showcase is the part nearest the hotel, and that is useful if you want to eat in the park in any of the international restaurants. The Beach Club Hotel is part of the complex, but we always state on our booking forms that we want the Yacht Club. Our last visit was October 2011 and our stay was fantastic. It has the Boardwalk nearby with Shops and Restaurants. The prices in the Restaurants can be on the high side but it is a 4/5 star and you do pay for the privilege.

Reviews.Title: “Smooth sailing all the way”
Reviews.Author: CooterCat
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the amenities and location of this Disney hotel. One big advantage is that is located within walking distance of Epcot, so by using our Park Hopper passes we were able to end two days with dinner and fireworks followed by a leisurely walk along the water to the hotel. The layout of the room works well when everyone is trying to get ready at the same time. There are double sinks located outside the shower/toilet room. The balcony was small but at least had two chairs for sitting. We used the online checking option, but since January is pretty off season, we probably wouldn't have needed it. However it was nice to have someone greet us and then personally pick up our packet, they even let us check in early. We were here during the Marathon weekend, and we were warned of traffic issues, but since we were participating in the 1/2 marathon, we really appreciated the transportation from/to the hotel for the race. We also used the Disney transportation to get to the Magic Kingdom on the Marathon day, but I think we we must have left late enough to miss the traffic, because everything went smoothly. Hotel lobby, pools and rooms are all nicely appointed. There is a nautical theme, but it is not too overdone. Staff is very friendly and efficient, and very welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Club Level Mostly Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: wallywanna
Reviews.Content: Others have focused on the plusses ... Service is attentive, fast and personal. A few negative changes I have noticed since our last stay. A) When we were checking in, a supervisor was "observing" and making notes. I found this a bit intimidating as did the person checking us in I am sure. If you need to do this, explain to the guest what is hapenning. I overheard discussion about efficiencies that could be had .... B) mousekeeping no longer leaves extra soap daily in the rooms. I am sure a "cost reduction.". Same thing at the Contemp. C) How about more than 2 trays / selections for dessert. ? Another cost reduction? D) How about bottled water for guests in addition to sodas. I promise not to fill my cooler. Another cost reduction? Is there a theme here??

Reviews.Title: “Club level rules!!”
Reviews.Author: ljhudsonHudson_Ohio
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, great pool, great device and as expensive as it is if you stay at the Club Level (great free food and drinks) you can actually spend much less than at a much less lovely hotel. Outstanding service. My kids loved the pool - best at Disney. Only issue is the lines at the restaurants...but lines are a part of Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Disney Hotel - very charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: zum_fettigen_joe
Reviews.Content: I stayed there twice and I'm sure I will return! The hotel has its own charm. It does not feel like this other huge anonymous complex. The rooms are clean and spacious. The pool is very nice! The hotel restaurant are good and provide different kind of food - I love the steakhouse! Of course the hotel has its price, but you get better value for your money as for example in many other Disney hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay at the Yacht Club”
Reviews.Author: C5254
Reviews.Content: First time staying at the Yacht Club, the week before Christmas. First, as others have said, location is great, with a short boat ride or walk to Epcot and also a boat to the Hollywood Studios. The decor is very subtle Disney, in fact nothing was in your face Disney at all. It's a very pretty, elegant hotel. We didn't use the pool area but it looked like it would be a lot of fun. The rooms were very nicely decorated in a nautical style. We had requested one with a day bed and it was available. It was not a huge room, but big enough for 4 people. It did have a small refrigerator and a small table, plus a balcony. The bathroom was small, double sinks were outside the tiny area where the commode and bathtub were at. It was a stretch to shut the door if anyone was in that area. We had a slow drain in the tub and a hairdryer that wasn't working properly but maintenance came very quickly after I had called and fixed the drain. A different hairdryer was delivered too. It was a bit of a hike from the lobby to our room. The hallways are quite long. The beds were very comfortable, good mattresses. When we arrived we used the valet parking. I found out later that it is free if you have a handicap placcard. We ate at the Yacht Club Steak House one evening, and although pricey, it was a very good meal. I also ordered room service one evening, which was good but really expensive. We took the boats to Epcot and the Hollywood Studios. We drove to the Animal Kingdom (free parking if you are staying in a Disney resort) and took the bus to the Magic Kingdom. I was able to get a pretty good rate by buying a Season pass and reserving at the Passholder's discount. Close by are the Beach Club, The Boardwalk and the Swan and Dolphin. Which means that you have quite a few choices for meals. We had a nice view of the fireworks from our balcony. I have stayed in quite a few different Disney resorts and this was one of the nicest, but my favorite is still the Polynesian.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Sailing!”
Reviews.Author: Chris S
Reviews.Content: If you want to enjoy Disney, try the Yacht Club! We have stayed at other Disney resorts, but the Yacht Club is the creme-de-la-creme. It's nautical and refined. It's always adorned with flowers and flower arrangements. As you walk in, the happy "skipper" greets you. This gentleman is a familiar face that we look forward to seeing year after year. The rooms are decorated with a nautical theme and are always perfect. If you stay on the fifth floor (concierge), you'll really experience Disney's first class attention to detail. We talked with Mike an awful lot and he really made sure we had the most important park information. If we needed a snack or a drink, he retrieved something no matter what time it was. The other staff was helpful too. The Yacht Club has THE BEST POOLS. You can easily spends days here instead of the park. Use the slide, the lazy river, or the sand filled swimming pools. The lifeguards are awesome and the staff engages children with pool games and prizes from opening to closing. When you're hungry, dine at the nearby Beaches and Cream for a consistently great burger. There are marshmallow roasts at a campfire and movies in the evening. We love the fact that the Yacht Club is a short walk to the United Kingdom part of EPCOT (about 5 - 10 minutes) and a 10 minute boat trip (with stops) to Hollywood Studios. This is a big plus for dining plans since EPCOT especially, has many great eating spots. That said, the best spot in Disney for a steak is located right in the Yacht Club...the Yachtsman Steak House! The best steak in or out of the park. Did I mention that the Boardwalk is across from the Yacht Club? Try Kouzinna's for Greek food and then enjoy the boardwalk attractions afterwards (rent bikes, arcades, clowns...) You can easily enjoy two days of family fun just at the resort itself. For example, we've rented mini-speed boats and small boats to explore the waterways to EPCOT and Hollywood Studios. We've played outdoor ping-pong and layed on the beach too. It's a break from the frenzy typically encountered while trying "to do" all the attractions at the parks. (My point is that you can relax and still have fun right at your resort.) If you want to go to other resorts like Magic Kingdom, Animal Kingdom, or Downtown Disney there's bus transportation right out front. Unlike some other resorts we stayed at, these buses are hardly ever crowded. I highly recommend this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Charming!”
Reviews.Author: luvgoofy4064
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Yacht Club from December 17-22. Check-in was quick, we were handed our "keys to the world" within minutes. The large Christmas tree was the first thing we noticed in the lobby and the second thing we noticed was all the beautiful hardwood throughout the lobby and up the corner stairs. Both lobby and grounds are charming. We had a wonderful room (room 2064 or 2164), it was a corner room that was quiet, off by itself and only a few minutes walk to the lobby and transportation areas. The room was very clean and I am picky about a clean room. We were there five nights and each day when we returned to our room it was well cleaned again. Since it was a corner room it had three large window which were wonderful for letting the Florida sun in. The staff was friendly (especially the front desk). When my son called for a wake-up call and asked for someone other than Stitch the front desk clerk told him that it would probably be Stitch because they can't keep him in bed. I thought that was a fun way for them to let my son know that only Stitch is available. The hotel is close to Hollywood Studios and EPCOT with ferry service to both parks. The pool is wonderful (one of the best on Disney property) but we would have used it more if we were there in the summer. The room was spacious with two queen beds. There is a double sink (helpful) and a separate SMALL bathroom. I would like to have seen a curtain to be able to pull across the separation from the sleeping area to the double sinks for some privacy getting dressed (traveling with a 16 year old daughter and 11 year old son, husband and myself). This is not unique to the Yacht Club though. It seems to be the norm for most hotels but for a luxury hotel it would be an easy thing to fix. Our only complaint was the bus service. We were told by the front desk staff that the buses run every 20 minutes from the hotel and from the parks. Our wait was more like 25-30 minutes. It seemed other resorts had buses picking up from the parks more frequently than the Yacht Club did. With it being a busy time of the year it would have been nice if they ran the buses as planned (every 20 minutes).

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: MaggieWhippet
Reviews.Content: The first garden view room we were assigned was a four minute walk from the lobby. The view was NOT GOOD. We were changed to a better view but absolutely nothing special. There was a pill on the floor and crumbs beside the bed. The pool is nice, but we heard it was fabulous. It's a pool. I've seen much prettier. We paid premium prices and felt it was way overpriced. Maybe if you book at the rates in the lower range you will get more value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort”
Reviews.Author: Rhonda R
Reviews.Content: This resort was part of the best vacation imaginable. The staff, from check-in to housekeeping, were all fabulous. The atmosphere was perfect for us. The location was so convenient- walking distance to Epcot and Hollywood Studios. The Christmas theme was everywhere and it was lovely. The pool and sand play areas are great for all ages. The fitness center was very nice. We hated to leave and plan to be back next December!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but a great Disney Experience”
Reviews.Author: Natalie788
Reviews.Content: My first trip to Disney World could not have been made any more perfect! This hotel was truly magical. The hotel has amazing attention to detail, and with the additional offering of the Beach Club next door, you can switch between a bit more fancy and a bit more casual depending on your mood. We were only walking distance from the Beach Club breakfast buffet which had character dining, but also had buffet breakfast at the Yacht Club, which attracted older families and couples and had less lines (even on labor day weekend!) The rooms were set up nicely, with the vanity separate from the bath/shower and toilet, making getting ready easy. The balcony was lovely, although as anyone would know staying in Florida in August/September, anything left out on the balcony got drenched the minute the afternoon rains came through, and we were in a relatively protected corner! The pool area is amazing, and being walking distance to Epcot (Hollywood studios is close too, but not close enough really to walk, the boats are quick and regular though), as well as being just across the lake from the Boardwalk, this is probably one of the best located Disney Hotels. Seeing the squirrels and hares wandering around near the smaller pool one night also made it that little bit more special - something straight out of a Disney movie! Can't really fault anything about this hotel, it was a wonderful experience and I can't wait to return someday!

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected upgrade to a suite”
Reviews.Author: familyof7_nj
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to Disney, I booked a Honeymoon Room at Disney's Grand Floridian for my husband and I. This was our first trip to Disneyworld without the children, unfortunately the Grand Floridian was overbooked. BUT we were driven to the Yacht Club and placed in an amazing 2 Bedroom King Suite. We were able to see Epcot fireworks from one of our balconies. I was in a wheelchair, and getting to Epcot and Hollywood studios was a breeze. Plus the resort is adjacent to the Boardwalk. We didn't get to check out the amazing pool, but it looks like fun. The decor was a little dark for our taste, and it can use some updating. All the staff were amazing. We had access to the concierge lounge, which was much smaller than others we have visiting. So we took the offerings back to our suite. This resort would be ideal for adults traveling without children.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in prime Disney Location”
Reviews.Author: countdown6
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review while relaxing at this great resort after a full day at Epcot. First of all I read quite a few positive reviews of this resort which influenced our decision to stay here. I absolutely love it here. the location can't be beat. It's literally a five minute walk from the international gateway at Epcot, steps away from the boat that takes you to Hollywood Studios and Epcot( don't know why you would take a boat to Epcot but if you choose it's there). As for the resort itself, the staff from concierge to housekeepers, everyone. They are all great. The room is quite a bit bigger than we expected. We are pleasantly surprised to see free wifi with excellent connectivity in the guest rooms. The room has an LG flat screen tv, two comfortable queen sized beds and a daybed. The bathroom is clean and well stocked with towels and nice Disney brand shampoo, soaps, and lotions. We are staying in room 4408, with a good view of the gardens and small pool. I notice some contributors mentioned balconies weren't private, ours is so that's a bonus. We are a family of five and find the room is plenty big with lots of closet and storage space. I have nothing negative to say about our stay here. The resort In my opinion is worth the extra money. We stayed at a moderate resort last yr and don't feel the extra money for this place was a waste. The whole family loves this place and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravelBH
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying at the Yacht Club. If you love Epcot and Hollywood Studios then this hotel is a perfect location. The rooms are updated and clean and hotel staff is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Epcot and Studios”
Reviews.Author: Irishlady5
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights at the Yacht Club Resort. It is a wonderful location for getting to Epcot and the Studios. It is considered one of Disney's Luxury resorts so the prices are high but everything at Disney is high. Some of the rooms are located very far from the lobby so you might want to inquire your rooms location when checking in. It could be a very far walk! The rooms are spacious and plenty of storage room to unpack. The mini bars are gone and have been replaced with a fridge and shelves for storing food items.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: catherine48628
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 4 day stay at the Yacht Club. My husband and I stayed at this hotel with my 5 month old baby girl and my 4 year old son. We also traveled with my parents who also stayed at the Yacht Club. This resort is an EXCELLENT place to stay while enjoying the Disney Experience. The customer service at this hotel was by far the best I have ever experienced (including trips to other destinations around the world). The hotel is classy, yet inviting to children. The staff is on their toes without an air of snooty-ness. We chose to stay on the 5th floor "club level" for an extra dose of customer care and it was well worth the extra money. I am glad we did the club level for the simple fact that babies have lots of needs and I leaned heavily on the personal concierge for help. Jean was of particular help in the club room. Robin was fabulous with helping us make reservations. The housekeeping staff was fabulous. I think they may have cleaned our room twice a day. If that wasn't the case, then they definitely provided us with extra towels and chocolates. You don't have to stay at the Club Level to get this kind of service. My parents booked with the regular rooms and they got the same type of customer service and with a slightly better room! We just wanted to have help at our finger tips because of the baby. The entire resort was dressed tastefully and beautifully for the holidays. The restaurants were great. The pools and hot-tubs were wonderful. Every inch of the hotel was clean, clean, clean. We will definitely be returning to the Yacht Club.

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad, and the ugly”
Reviews.Author: midliferDallas_Texas
Reviews.Content: Let me temper this by saying that if you are one of the stroller crowd who are here for the magic, this is not for you. The Stormalong Bay is beautiful and I "get" why those facilities would get glowing reviews. No, this review is for people who got booked here for either a convention/conference, and stay long hours being educated and want a relaxing experience between times. Maybe even a nice nap. The good: check in was orderly and the front desk staff friendly and efficient. We even got a complimentary upgrade but given the decibel level of our next door neighbors, not sure we wouldn't have enjoyed less garden view and more parking lot. The bad: after 10 hours in a conference room, honestly, is it too much to expect to enjoy a little evening channel surfing with some decent choices? There are almost 60 channels but I think about 54 of them are Disney related. Where's the HBO, TNT, TBS, movie channel, ANYTHING...even if you pay extra....relaxation is NOT listening to a promo for vacation stays, infomercials on what not to miss at Disney etc. We couldn't even rent a movie. The lack of insulation: we either had the world's flimsiest walls or the world's noisiest family next door with what sounded like an army of small children...after a day of hassling air travel my husband and I were anxious to unwind and relax. Obviously no tv of note but what we did have was a virtual family in our room...we heard it all: the sugar highs at 3 pm, the 6 pm Mickey meltdown and then the fight to go to bed and finally the 2 am tummy aches. We are not unsympathetic to the poor parents next door...we have done our time in the trenches but really, Disney, this is one show we would have liked to have missed. Ice machine: one per floor. Broken on Wednesday when we checked in. Still broken on check out. The ugly: bathroom had real issues. Our room had two sinks outside and a toilet and bath jammed into an extremely small space. There are marble like floors in the bath area which are an odd choice because all around the toilet was dried urine and areas when it wasn't dried, it had stained the floor around the toilet yellow which didn't come up with scrubbing (I tried). There were also black hairs on the floor and my husband and I are blonde.... In short, this is the second Disney property we have endured for a medical meeting and sincerely hoping it is the last.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Disney Resort”
Reviews.Author: FloridaSunsoaker
Reviews.Content: Living in Florida, I've visited Disney at least once or twice a year for the past 20 years. Every time we visit, we try to stay at a different Disney Resort. This year for our Thanksgiving visit, we stayed at Disney's Yacht Club. From the moment we arrived, we were in heaven. The decor, the atmosphere, the staff, the amenities, and especially the room, were above and beyond what we expected! We loved the Captain in the lobby and the holiday decorations. We were able to rent bikes and ride around the boardwalk. I didn't care if we even went to the parks, I wanted to enjoy every minute of the Yacht Club. The parks were insanely crowded due to the holiday, so we didn't get to ride much due to the lines. And our Thanksgiving dinner at the Grand Floridian Cafe left something to be desired. Our waiter was the worst and service was incredibly slow. But the trip was amazing and by far, this is my new favorite DIsney resort. Watching the lights over on the boardwalk at night and the fireworks from our balcony was Disney Magic!

Reviews.Title: “First Class”
Reviews.Author: EJMK
Reviews.Content: The Yacht Club is an excellent Disney hotel choice. It was first class in every way from the staff, rooms, steakhouse, gym, and activities. It is connected to the Beach Club which offers additional dining and shopping selections. The two resorts share a pool complex that is probably the best in all of Disney World. They have several connected pools including a zero entry and sand bottom pool. They have a shipwreck slide that the kids loved. Being on the Boardwalk was great for dining and entertainment. You can walk to the back entrance of Epcot or to Hollywood Studios in less than 15 minutes. They also provided boat service to Epcot. I enjoyed walking the boardwalk each night and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: smurfette64
Reviews.Content: This place is great, would highly recommend for anyone -with kids or without. No noise through walls

Reviews.Title: “Really Enjoyed Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: cranberry28p
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights at the Yacht Club. Our experience was similar to many of the reviews here. Yes the rooms are getting a tad dated and noise in the halls travels but the proximity to Epcot and the Boardwalk can't be beat. Staff was very accommodating with an early check-in and a late check-out. We enjoyed the pools and restaurants. Our visit was after the Thanksgiving crowds had left so we benefited from a considerable room rate discount.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay overall.”
Reviews.Author: chzhead2004
Reviews.Content: Disney is hands down our favorite vacation spot. We are attempting to stay at all resorts on property, so take this with a grain of salt as I can get a little opinionated about my rooms. We also had our children on this trip so it changes the scope of how you view a room as opposed to a couples trip. It is very convenient to the EPCOT park, which is our family favorite. +1. It is a very well-staffed hotel to accommodate your needs and has a friendly, knowledgeable staff, even though some reviews and some other sites said they were a little pretentious. +1. Bottom level with a small patio that led right to the sidewalk/pier area. +1. Room ready at 9AM check-in time the Saturday after Thanksgiving. +1 However, the bad: Room next to the guest laundry and a fan that blew loudly ALL night long and made the hallway freezing as well. -1. Hair in sinks and bathroom floor and rust on the hinges "bleeding" down the white door.-1 Online check-in did not show us as registered, even with a confirmation number.-1. It was a great trip overall. The staff was friendly, the weather beautiful, the crowds were lower than most times we have been. The view of the water and boardwalk area is what gave this the 4 circle rating- being able to see the fireworks at EPCOT from our room helped over ride some of the negatives. The beds were comfortable, the rooms were of usual size, the decor was soothing and "classy". Though, after a lengthy discussion of pros and cons, my husband and I have decided that we prefer the Boardwalk over the Yacht Club. We will be staying at the Beach Club next so we will see.

Reviews.Title: “Not So Concierge Level”
Reviews.Author: mooneynut
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at several Disney properties over the years, including the Concierge Level of Disney's Boardwalk Resort, I had moderately high hopes that Disney's Yacht Club Resort would provide a relaxing place to stay. It did not. The Yacht Club resort appears to have added a "Concierge Level" as an afterthought. The rooms are the same as any other room in the resort, no more, no less. The service is only average. The snacks and beverages provided were fairly standard. The biggest problem is that there is no "bang for the buck", and when paying a premium for a "Concierge Level", I expect something for premium paid. In addition, it seems that many parents have decided that the "Concierge Level" at a Disney resort is a good alternative to feeding and supervising their children. Just stay in a "Concierge Level" room and let the children come and go as they please (it usually pleases them to run, singing and yelling) and have them eat all their meals from the snacks provided. Next time my travel takes me to the Orlando area, I will stay anywhere except a Disney property.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Mini waterpark for a pool.”
Reviews.Author: SondraTexas
Reviews.Content: My family and I love the Yacht Club. We have been to DisneyWorld 7 times. The first two times we stayed at Port Orleans and the Animal Kingdom lodge. The Yacht Club is beautiful, centrally located with a huge pool and a sand bottom.

Reviews.Title: “Great attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: petersam
Reviews.Content: From the escort to the front desk, everything in this hotel was great with great touches, Disney and otherwise. The lobby was spacious, clean, and comfortable. The decor of the hotel and the rooms definitely evoked the maritime and cottage theme of the resort. Everyone on staff was helpful. The wifi was free and fast. Rooms were clean and everything worked. Elevators were super fast. The gym was a good size for the hotel and everything was in great condition there too. While excellent, I'd point out these areas of improvement for management: - the gift shop doesn't open until 9 AM; that might make it hard if you need a last minute personal item - the bar is a little small due to construction. Hopefully it will be complete soon. - no self-service boarding pass printer. You need to ask the concierge to print one for you or go to the bag check stand outside Overall, a great stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A great location for a stay in WDW. One of the nicer Disney properties.”
Reviews.Author: Limulus
Reviews.Content: When I called the Disney reservation line to make reservations for my wife's and my 35th anniversary trip I requested a king bed with a water view at the Disney Yacht Club Resort. I had done my homework and I liked the idea of a five minute stroll to Epcot's side entrance and a short boat ride to Hollywood Studios. Also the Yacht Club was a bit less "family" orientated, meaning a bit more sedate than the Beach Club Resort next door. However, the reservation specialist, who by the way was terrific, could not get me into the Yacht Club but could do it for the Beach Club. No big deal, we took the Beach Club. When it came time to check in, however, the king bedroom was not available and check in wanted to give me and my wife a two queen bedroom. Hmmmm, not for our anniversary. I held my ground and asked for the front desk manager, asking that if he could not meet our request for the king room at the Beach Club, perhaps he could check with one of the other deluxe rated properties for a king for us. It was important to us and I suggested he "make the magic happen!" After about a ten minute wait, he came through with a king room in the....wait for it... Yacht Club Resort, which is what we wanted originally. So, yes, I think the magic is still working at WDW. Our room was nicely appointed. The property was large but very beautifully kept and a pleasure to base our vacation from. We liked the towel animals that one associates with cruises. The two towel swans on our bed also forming a heart (see pic) added a nice romantic touch to coming back to the room at 2:30 am (Magic Disney hours had the Magic Kingdom open until 3:00am that Saturday night... we had a blast!). The weather was too cool to use the sand bottom pool, but I don't think we had time anyway. Deluxe at Disney doesn't come cheap, but if you can afford it, I think it is well worth the splurge. Only one little complaint, on Monday there must have been a large hotel turnover, because our room was not cleaned as nicely as on the other days. Otherwise, top marks for everything else, and the staff was wonderful. My wife and I came to DisneyWorld for our honeymoon, so we thought it was nice to come again for our 35th anniversary, before we start bring the grandchildren! We were right.

Reviews.Title: “Typically Good Disney Property”
Reviews.Author: kmjlhs
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for 2 nights on a business trip at the Disney Yacht Club. The room was spacious, clean and in good condition. There was a small balcony overlooking a garden area. Two double beds and a day bed provided enough room for up to 5 people. There was a small desk area and free wi-fi in the room. Bathroom had 2 sinks, so great for families. There was a coffee maker that included various teas as well. One thing missing was a safe for valuables while away from the room. A daily USA today newspaper was provided. Also enjoyed the Captain's Grille restaurant off the lobby. They had a special price that included a choice of appetizer, entree and dessert for $27. Front desk was very friendly as were porters and housekeepers. All well trained in typical Disney fashion. It was a short walk to the Convention Center next door for my business meeting. A Disney Express bus is available from the airport to the hotel. Otherwise, its free parking in the lot just across the bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay but didn't have enough time to enjoy amenities”
Reviews.Author: nccruiser4
Reviews.Content: If you have time to enjoy the pools, the spend the extra money and stay here! If you aren't going to be around except to sleep, save money and stay elsewhere! We liked staying here, but our kids, ages 10 and 11, kept us going until bedtime and we never got to enjoy the resort. It was very convienent to walk to Epcot and Hollywood Studios, but we feel like we missed out on enjoying the pools, which look awesome, because we were always at the parks. The staff at check in were great and a very nice employee came up and talked to us about the world globe in the lobby when he noticed we were talking about it. Rooms were nice, but the beds were not as comfortable as they were at the Loews Portifino near Universal. Disney also puts the sinks outside the bathrooms, which makes it hard to get up and out the door to workout while the rest of the family sleeps. It is also loud when someone gets up to use the restroom in the middle of the night and then has to wash their hands in the "bedroom". The only problem I encountered during our stay was a rude employee one morning (out of 3) in the little bar/coffee area where I went to get a quick breakfast for everyone. She didn't seem to enjoy her job and wasn't very nice. The other two days were fine - each day there was a different person working. If you have time to enjoy the resort, stay here!! It was really nice. If you just need a place to sleep, save your money and stay at the Dolphin or Swan - still easy to walk to HS and Epcot!

Reviews.Title: “Good...but it doesn't have the charm the others have.”
Reviews.Author: Kevin L
Reviews.Content: When i went to the Yacht I was expecting more of the grandeur that would remind me of the Titanic...however this was not the case. Like at Grand Floridian and Boardwalk the music provides a certain atmosphere....that old jazz really reminds me of Disney! But at this hotel they have new age guitar playing in the lobby and around the grounds! It's not fitting...though the gift shops did play more irish jig music...which was WAY more fitting....even a live string quartet playing music like they did on the Titanic would be so cool! Other then that it was a great hotel with a fabulous location!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool, Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: newflyer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel a few weeks ago and thought the customer service was great. I drink decaf hot tea and the folks in the Concierge beverage area on the 5th floor went out of their way to get me some. In addition I had a chance to sit by the pool for a little while between work sessions and found it to be clean and very well patrolled by life guards. The gift shop was very well stocked and the people that worked there helped me find exactly what I was looking for, even though it was not available in their shop. I ate room service dinner, lunch and breakfast in the hotel's restaurant (Captain's Grille) and all were great. My room was located on the first floor and was far enough away from the elevator to be nice and quiet and yet close enough to the front entrance that I could get out in a hurry to make my morning meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit - Another nice stay, but some improvements needed”
Reviews.Author: fluff_astrid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Yacht Club for our second time in October 2011, our first being in May of 2009. We had another relaxing time at Disney World and at the resort, but looking through the lens of a returning visitor, we could more easily see areas for improvement compared to our prior stay. I'll note that we stayed on the Club Level floor, which tends to provide a better level of service than the rest of the hotel, so take this into consideration when comparing to other reviews of service at this property. Warning! This is an especially long review! Our check-in experience was easy. When we arrived at the resort on a Saturday evening we were immediately greeted at the door and escorted to the desk. We had checked in online a few days before our arrival, so everything was ready to go and we got our packet with our keys within a few minutes. The interior of our room was the same as the one on our last stay: a small water closet, dual sinks, two queen beds and a flatscreen TV. It included bathrobes, an expresso/coffee maker, and a simple desk and lounge chair. We were a little surprised that, just like our older room, the bathroom door didnâ€™t really clear the toilet seat, but always bumped into it when opening. It just seems like something someone would test or fix (perhaps the toilet was refurbished after the bathroom was built?), and was a little off-Disney-style to see this flaw persist in more than one room. During our stay in 2009 we had had a private balcony, so this time around we were a little disappointed to get a balcony shared with 3 other rooms. We were unable to really keep our curtains open as much because our neighboring room had children, and they would go out on the patio and stare into our windows. Unfortunately this was a busy time at the hotel--there was a convention running almost every day we were there--so they were unable to move us. Speaking of the conventions, I will say this affected our stay in a few ways. First is the overall friendliness/politeness of other guests. When we stayed in 2009, there were no conventions happening, so most of the guests were vacationers. This made them happy and courteous, and us in return. This time, many of the guests were business reps who seemed less than enthusiastic to be there. We saw many of them shoving ahead in the breakfast lines, cutting people off at the elevators, yelling into cell phones to colleagues at the gym, lobby and patio areas, and so forth. Although it may not be fair to include guest behavior in a review of a property, when youâ€™re on vacation from work, itâ€™s sort of the last thing you want to be around :) The upside of it, though, was that the hotel staff was on their best behavior. Other ways that the convention affected us: We had a rental car, and it was often difficult to finding parking (the Yacht Club has a very small lot). Thankfully the property noticed this and within a few days restricted any on-site parking to hotel guests only. It also seemed to affect our wifi access, it was a lot slower during peak convention hours. Housekeeping, for us at least, was prompt, friendly and thorough. They always seemed to get to our room in quick order, even if we were only out for an hour or two. They even left us towel animals despite knowing that we had no kids with us. The concierge and Regatta Club staff were also helpful and friendly. They helped me make a lot of reservations (and changes to those reservations) before and during our stay. The lounge area of the Regatta Club, with snacks and wine/beverages, was once again welcome. We were happy to see that theyâ€™d changed many of their offerings, including canned sodas and cheese plates (which were great to take to-go), but keeping healthy staples like trail mix and oatmeal. It seemed like the hours of operation were improved, because they kept the lounge open all evening so guests could get coffee/snacks even at 3AM. The service was prompt--the moment your plate was empty, the staff would come by and clean it up. The staff were also gracious in allowing me to set up my watercolor paints in the lounge, helping me dispose of my wash waters in a safe manner. A special shout-out goes to a staff member named Chip, who was very conversational about my painting, even though he probably had a million other things to do. Aside from our room and floor level experiences, I will also provide a quick review of the other areas we utilized at the property: The Stormalong Bay Pool (shared with the Beach Club): Once again, this was awesome. During this trip we didnâ€™t purchase water park tickets because of it (something we had learned last time). They still restrict pool entry to Yacht/Beach Club guests and I hope they never open it up. The Gym: I used the gym during both our prior and recent stays, and while they upgraded a couple of the machines, I found it still a little tattered and worn. This area could use some heavy refurbishment. It easily feels crowded, the staff seem unhappy (many had open conversations about having long hours), and the weight machines still seem old. Ale and Compass Lounge: I wouldnâ€™t get breakfast here. Service staff were nice, but we were disappointed with the scant selection available when using a quick service meal credit. Elevators: These reallllllly need some refurbishment. They seem to have gotten worse since our last stay. They are slow, many of the floor indicators are broken, and there was an evening when all four were broken down at the same time. Also, we noticed a few groups of people trying to â€œhitch a rideâ€� up to the Club floor by waiting for guests with a Club Level key card, so the staff should perhaps check key cards upon exit from the elevators. Air Conditioning: In general, the building is freezing! There should be a bit better temp control. Distance to Epcot: One of the best pros of this resort, I love that we could hoof it to Epcot and the Food and Wine Festival in twenty minutes. I also took a few morning jogs to Hollywood Studios (also walkable, albeit a lot further). All in all, I recommend this hotel for more adult-oriented groups of people (Beach Club remains the best option if you have children, because the Yacht Club does not really cater to them) and those who can be a bit more independent with things. I hope that they address or refurbish some areas of the resort, and think we may hold off on revisiting it until some things get fixed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time. They made my daughters feel special.”
Reviews.Author: Hoosier7189
Reviews.Content: This was my girls first time to Disney so we wanted to go all out. We stayed club level at the Yacht Club. Let me first say that they deffinatly made us feel special when we checked in. Someone was waiting on us and took us straight to the 5th floor to check in. The supplied drinks and food mostly all day long was a great advantage having small children that love to snack. The resort itself was nice. Everyone was friendly and our girls asked us why everyone calls them princess. The pools was huge and my girls loved the sandy bottom. I will say one thing ;bad about this pool though. Its design makes it so you have a very hard time watching your kids if they want to explore everything. Not because it is so big, just because you have to get out of the pool to get to other parts of the pool. They waterslide is actually a little walk from the pool and the entrance to it is on the other side of a walkway out of your vision. So if your kids want to run to the entrance to the slide they will be gone for a while and they cross a public path that everyone uses from other resorts. Many a time I seen parents wondering what was taking the kids so long and having to jump up and run around a building to try and find their kids. Other than that it was very nice with very attentive life gaurds that kept everything uder control. There is another pool on the end of the resort that is very quiet and you can do laundry while you swim or watch your kids. Our room was huge. We actually thought hey made a mistake. If you are here for a long trip staying club level if you want to spend extra is the way to go. The four of us each had a bed to ourselves which was oh so nice for Mom and I. The staff on your private floor is wonderful. Many a time we walked up to get some drinks and they would send us back with full water, beers, pops or whatever you wanted, even if they were not open or getting stuff ready for the next meals. The location was great if you are going to be seeing all the parks. You can walk to Epcot from here and it only takes you maybe 10 min. at the most. The boardwalk only takes you about a 5 or 6 minute walk. If I was just going to visit Magic Kingdom I would not recommend this resort. Housekeeping was great. They even made little animal characters with our towels for the kids. They did a great job and make sure you tip them. I see complaints about housekeeping but they always went overboard for us. All in all we had a great time and would come back again but this was a once in a lifetime trip for us. Very expensive and we would only spend this much money once. Its crazy how much Disney can drag out of your pockets. They are great at marketing that is for sure. Have Fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Lovely Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: girlish_sista
Reviews.Content: The Yacht Club was a winner base solely on it's location. 5 minute walk to Epcot and the Boardwalk make it hard to beat.
