Pool area is stunning and we never had trouble finding a chair. We don't have kids but the ones at the resort seemed to go gaga over the water slide. Room was huge but getting a little tired. Nothing I wouldn't mind had I not been paying $500 a night. This was the only area I expected a little more. Service was impeccable! Everyone was lovely and so polite. I wouldn't hesitate in returning. Very happy with the service and location!

Reviews.Title: “a great relaxing place”
Reviews.Author: makan0960
Reviews.Content: great service and experience. have stayed here for the last five trips to epcot and everything has been consistently great overall.

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay, but not worth the cost”
Reviews.Author: corley05
Reviews.Content: We started our October 2011 Disney stay at the Polynesian which by far a better resort than the Yact Club (overall). There were some areas that the Yacht Club was better: the pool, options for dining (Epcot WS, Boardwalk Area, Beach Club). Beyond those things it was not good at all. Housekeeping was terrible! The first day I had to call a 4pm to see if they would clean our room and on the second (and last) day the came at 9a when we weren't checking out until 11. When they finally came to clean our room they basically gave us clean towels and made some of the beds and dumped a bunch of our stuff on the beds... It wasn't worth it at all. The checkin was not good. The castmember checking me in was unfriendly and seemed bothered by my being there... The rest of the castmember at the Yacht Club were stiff and not friendly at all. We found the staff at the Beach Club was much friendlier. And the staff at the Polynesian was absolutely delightful! Checking out should have been simple but it was a total disaster. And again the staff was rude and unsympathetic. If you have a choice pick the Beach Club over the Yacht Club. And if you are looking for a great Disney experience and convenience getting to the parks choose the Polynesian! The Poly is big and it is a long walk to get around the resort (but what Disney resort isn't big?) but it is next to the transportation and ticket center and that makes getting around a cinch!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Yacht but staff not so much!”
Reviews.Author: shampton50
Reviews.Content: The Yacht Club is a beautiful well-maintained Disney property. It is also extremely convenient to both Epcot and Hollywood Sudios and because of its location has an abundance of dining choices. We loved our room, the pool, and the grounds. We would especially recommend Beaches & Cream for ice cream treats, both the Captain's Grille and Cape May Cafe for breakfast, Hurricane Hannah's for a pool-side lunch, and Cape May for dinner. My complaint, and for me it is a serious one, is the attitude of much of the staff (aka cast-members) at the Yacht. Their attitude, especially at the front desk -especially the front desk manager, was one of "if a guest has a problem the guest needs to fix it". We had a serious billing problem upon checking-out - someone else had been linked by their system to our account and according to Stephen, the Front Desk Manager, it was up to us to rectify the problem (we had already spoken to two other Front Desk personnel and their attitude also was one of helplessness). I was not expecting this off-hand attitude - what I was expecting was an apology and to have my problem quickly remedied. It was only after I inquired as to both his name and job title that Stephen perked up and asked what could he do for us. Too little and too late. We also received incorrect information from the Concierge and Gift Shop staff as well - both times the mistakes were fixed by members of the College Program - and enthusiastically as well! Perhaps the senior staff have forgotten their Disney customer service training and need a refresher! For the rest of the trip when I needed help I looked for a nametag followed by a college and each time I received a positive, helpful interaction. Other than the College Program cast-members I was extremely disappointed by the staff at the Yacht Club!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay........ but WI-FI???”
Reviews.Author: SeattleLites6
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Yacht Club. The room was comfortable and well-appointed. The resort is walking distance to Epcot, Hollywood Studios and The Boardwalk, or you can take a free boat ride to any of these locations. There is also a free shuttle from the resort to all of the other Disney World Parks. The pool/beach is great for families, it almost feels like you're on a tropical island. The fitness room for hotel guest was nice, the steam room wasn't working during our stay:( The only thing that was a disappointment was the Internet service, you had to pay $9.95 per day for wired service in your room (no wi-fi in rooms) and $9.95 per day for wi-fi in the lobby and a few other designated areas:(

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place - more convention oriented than family oriented”
Reviews.Author: skydvr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in October. It's a beautiful hotel with a great location, but lacks some of the amenities that families might find helpful during their stay. The sand-bottom pool, and the other pools offered are great. The water slide was a lot of fun for my 8 year old. We did only spend a short half-day there though, due to a combination of not having a "pool day" on our schedule, and the rains that moved in. The kids did spend an evening there with their Nana, and enjoyed playing in the sand with other kids that were there. The location is great - walking distance to Epcot (don't take the boat unless you have to - much easier AND quicker to just walk), and a simple boat ride to Hollywood Studios. Walking to Hollywood Studios is an option, but it's much further than Epcot, so we didn't do that (well, we almost did when waiting for the boat ride home was taking forever, but we ended up on the boat). It's also close to the "Boardwalk" and "Beach Club" resorts (shares the pools with the Beach Club), which means that there's plenty of restuarants/shops within a short walk of the hotel. Unfortunately, those "short walks" are necessary, as there is not as much offered within the hotel itself. For example, no place to get a quick-serve meal unless you walk to the Beach Club. There's a sit-down (full service) restaurant, and a spot to get coffee and a bagel (IE: snacks), but no quick serve option. Being on the dining plan, sometimes you need a quick serve vs a sit-down, and sometimes you don't want to spend a long time on breakfast before heading to the park - it would be nice if that option was more convenient. Also, the arcade, gym, etc are all part of beach club - it's not a long walk, obviously, but it's just not as convenient as it would be were they part of the actual resort. The rooms were fine - a bit cramped for 5 people, but we expected that going in. They were comfortable and clean and quiet. It would have been nice if there was someplace to get changed or something and be able to shut a door - the bathroom itself was very tiny and cramped (shower was fine - just not much room to move around outside of the shower), and the sink area doesn't have a door, but again, we knew that going in. Beautiful resort - great time in Disney. But next time, if we stayed in the same area, we'd probably go for the Beach Club or the Boardwalk. This just felt more geared towards conventioneers, rather than family vacationers.

Reviews.Title: “Almost a ten . . .”
Reviews.Author: Slapschtick
Reviews.Content: The only thing letting down this truly fabulous resort is the shabbiness of the rooms. I don't understand the bed making system either, nothing is tucked in. the sheets are just draped over the bed. For the cost of the rooms the bedding should be changed every day, after a week they are just yucky. House keeping needs to sharpen up too because the rooms are often not cleaned until after three in the afternoon and that's just unacceptable. If Disney have the wherewith-all to do anything about the above The Yacht Club would be a wonderful experience . . .

Reviews.Title: “Disney Knows Service”
Reviews.Author: satxsptsfan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Disney Yacht Club for a business conference. The facility and grounds were extremely well maintained. The room was large and comfortable. It had all of the amenities that a business traveler needed. It was great to be able to walk to restaurants along the boardwalk. The service was excellent! When we arrived everyone was very pleasant and anticipated my needs. They also would engage a person if they looked like they needed assistance, but were not overbearing. The only minor negative is that they charge for internet service. For the cost of the room and desire to attract business conferences especially during off season, I would expect this to be included in the room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! But, some caveats”
Reviews.Author: mrvinotinto
Reviews.Content: We really loved the Yacht Club. Loved the 10-minute walk to Epcot's International Gateway. Loved the understated elegance of the lobby and grounds. Loved that it did not scream Disney, while still allowing us to be part of the Disney experience. We particularly loved all the great restaurants nearby in Epcot and at the Boardwalk. We were fortunate to have a daybed in our room (not all rooms have one) and this worked really well, so that my two kids did not have to share a bed. Epcot is by far our favorite park, and MK is my husband's least favorite so this worked out well. We spent 2 days at Epcot, one day at DHS, and one day at AK, so we were able to take advantage of the close proximity to Epcot and DHS. Now, some caveats that I mention just to make sure YC is a good choice for you: Caveat #1: Do not choose hotel because of the pool --- Say what? I thought the pool was great, why is this a caveat? The weather was pretty bad when we were there - not something the hotel can control - but many choose the YC because of the pool (Storm Along Bay). We only used the pool for 1 hour in our 5 days, and we still enjoyed our stay. Just do not choose the hotel because of the pool. You may have a tropical wave dumping 12 inches of rain, like we had. Also, the pool has some fixed hours. It opened at 10 am; I'm not sure what time it closed, but it was not open late in the evening. There's a closed fence around it, so there is no way to use the pool before/after hours. I'm sure its closure is to keep guests' safety in mind (very important), but if you are planning on an early morning swim or a late-evening swim at the pool, you will be out of luck. Caveat #2: Do not choose the hotel if you are expecting to spend most of your time outside Epcot/DHS --- While it's very easy to get to Epcot and DHS from the YC, the one area that needs improvement is the buses. Now, I've had this same criticism regarding other deluxe hotels at Disney. I think of the buses as an amenity and it baffles me that they do not have more buses for the hotels that are supposed to be the best that Disney offers. Our bus to the Magic Kingdom, 45 minutes prior to opening time (a very busy time), came from Swan and Dolphin resorts, then stopped at Yacht Club, then stopped at Beach Club and then stopped at the Bowardwalk Inn, and then went to MK. It was a packed, long ride, with many standing, and not the most pleasant way to start the day. I think picking up at 5 resorts is way too much at that time of the day. We are used to taking buses on vacation (for example, we take buses from hotels to ski resorts on our ski vacations), and for this level of hotel, I have never seen a hotel share its bus with so many other hotels/guests. Thankfully, we only went to MK one day. Caveat #3 Do not choose the hotel if you are a fan of the 'counter' service restaurants --- Counter-service restaurants in this area are extremely limited, especially before 11 am, when the World Showcase opens. There are many fabulous table-service restaurants in the area, and there is also room service (which is quite lovely and highly recommended - they set up the table for you, complete with white cloth). All in all, a great trip, just make sure you are not basing your decision on using the pool a lot, going to MK, and using counter-service erstaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Kids and Adults!”
Reviews.Author: pdr123
Reviews.Content: The trip started off wonderfully because our bags were delivered from the Airport right to the Yacht Club! No baggage claim for us! This is a great service for the return to the airport as well (you can check in at the hotel and they take your bags to the airport). The hotel itself was great. The room was spacious enough to accommodate 3 adults, 1 toddler, and an infant in a pack-n-play! The pool area is so nice. It is built for kids as a portion of the pool is only 2 feet in depth. They provide life jackets for the children as well as towels for everyone! The boat service to Epcot, Boardwalk, etc is wonderful as well. The bus service to the Magic Kingdom was great. We did not have to wait too long coming or going. As you would expect, the restaurants are a bit pricey; however, very good. I recommend the Yacht Club Steakhouse. There are 2 good bars in the hotel as well!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: coloradorudy
Reviews.Content: We're a couple in our early 50's and had planned a 20th anniversary trip and reserved a club level lagoon view room at the Disney Yacht Club. I had some concerns since I have a chronic illness that keeps my internal temperature too hot. I also have diabetes and am easily fatigued. We knew we had a nice room but wasn't sure of all the amenities. It was also our first time to use the Disney Magical Express. Once we were in Disney's hands, every thing went very smoothly. We found the bus line easily at the airport and didn't even have to wait, but was ushered straight to a waiting bus. The bus was magical having sparkly things on the floor and a pre-recorded video to watch as we traveled from resort to resort. We let Disney pick up our luggage, but we could have picked our luggage up from baggage claim and brought it right with us to the bus. Otherwise it takes about 3 hours or so to get your luggage. It was fun to see the different resorts as we traveled along. Upon arriving at the Yacht club, we were immediately greeted outside and taken right up to the prized 5th floor of the hotel to finish our check-in. We had performed the online check in, but were handed a package with hotel information, park information, and maps of the resort. This was reviewed with us as we sat comfortably on a sofa in the 5th floor lounge. It was so very nice and we felt very special with all the attention. Our room was dead center to the lagoon and opposite of the lighthouse. We could see the fireworks from Epcot in the evenings from our balcony. It was just gorgeous. The room was outfitted with a refrigerator (good for my insulin), iron, hair dryer, ipod alarm clock, 2 robes, and a small safe (uses a key). If you want internet as in all pricier hotels there is a fee. We have a wi-fi device so that did not affect us. We also avoided any parking charges by utilizing the free transportation of our feet (Epcot), boat (Boardwalk, Epcot, Hollywood Studios), and bus (Animal Kingdom, and Magic Kingdom). It was very convenient and just a 10 minute amble to Epcot where we usually spent our early evening hours. The room had a wonderfully powerful central air conditioner and a ceiling fan which kept me feeling nice and cool at all times. There was no air conditioner noise (nice). My internal temperature issues were no problem once we were in our room and I was able to sleep very well because of this. It was excellent. We had the resources of special concierges just for the 5th floor and they were always around to answer questions and help us with any issues we had. The lounge was great to have and had coffee, tea (hot and iced), fruit juice, milk, bottled water, and sodas. It did have odd hours as it closes for an hour every time the snacks are switched out. But once when I came in fatigued and needing a drink during the switching hour, a thoughtful hostess fetched me a water bottle from the storage room. The continental breakfast was fine for me. I had some good choices for diabetes as there was fruit, unsweetened oatmeal, bagels, and hard boiled eggs available. There also was a variety of cereals and pastries as well. I would stop by on my way in to get a drink and kept a sugared soda in our refrigerator for those hypoglycemic moments when my insulin worked too well. In the afternoon were snacks homemade chips and dip, cookies, yogurt pretzels, trail mix, and some gummy candies. I never made it to the 5-7pm session where they had beer and wine and very light appetizers. But I did make it in the evenings for an array of about 3 desserts and cordials. The desserts varied each day and were small portions so I could taste and it would fit in well with my diabetes allotment and helped me through several hypoglycemic episodes. The Disney transportation was efficient getting us to the parks early in the morning as we wanted and bringing us back before lunch sometimes. Even though most vacationers are traveling to the parks before lunch, we would travel back to the hotel to rest. They have vans to pick up us ones/twos going as they say 'upstream'. So it was very convenient. Our rooms was our refuge and during the heat of the day, we could return and rest before venturing out in the cooler evenings. We spent one afternoon at the quieter Admiral's Pool which also had a spa. The spa was good for my achy joints and the pool area was fairly quiet, with plenty of towels available. The day we went everyone was reading their e-books and just getting in the pool to cool off every now and then. It was an introverts paradise. This was our first time being so close to Epcot and it was great for us to walk there whenever we wanted. We had a grand time visiting all 4 parks. We utilized early opening hours and plotted what attractions we wanted to see. Since my strength is limited, we cut down on what we usually do, but we were able to make all of the popular attractions with ease. Check out was easy at 2:45am in the morning and we made our 6:30am flight handily via the Disney Magical Express. Everyone was courteous and kind. The staff in the hotel gift shop were very helpful in assisting us to find some reading glasses and other sundries we had forgotten. They pointed us to a shop in the Dolphin which is a short walk away. The staff was great from beginning to end and helped us have a very magical anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay at Disney!”
Reviews.Author: OLearysDaughter
Reviews.Content: We Have been lucky enough to stay at the Yacht Club twice, and of all of the Disney Deluxe resorts, this one remains our favorite. The location is superb - between Disney Studios (by boat) and within wlking distance to Epcot. The rooms at Yacht are clean, comfortable and quiet. We enjoy the view of the lake, and can see the Epcot fireworks from our balcony. The pool complex is really the best of all hotels: it boasts a sand beach, lazy river, and awesome pirate slide. It is excellent for little ones especially due to the sand and gently sloping beach, and lifeguards organize terrific games and treasure hunts for children. Try Beaches & Cream for a quick lunch or ice cream. We will return, and recommend this hotel above all other Deluxe Disney properties!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but Expensive”
Reviews.Author: MLS08
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a great location. It was really convenient being within walking distance of Epcot and the Disney Boardwalk. The hotel is massive and somewhat difficult to navigate -- my wife and I don't recall ever having as much trouble getting back to our room from different parts of the property. Our room was fine and clean, but very small bathroom (there is a dual sink vanity outside the bathroom). Pool areas were very nice with lots of activities. My wife especially enjoyed the quiet pool since we didn't have the kids with us. Her minor gripe is that it would have been nicento have food/beverage service at the quiet pool. We enjoyed the hotel, but thought the prices were too high. We've stayed at comparable hotels in Orlando that we've enjoyed more at lower prices (our favorite is the Portafino)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort”
Reviews.Author: melfc100
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving to the Yacht Club, we were immediately greeted by hotel staff who directed us to hotel check-in. While the check-in did take a little longer than normal, staff were very friendly and talked to us while we had to wait. To our surprise, we were upgraded to the Club/Concierge floor (5th floor). Our room was clean and spacious -- it was nice having 2 queen beds and 2 bathroom sinks for us. Our room also had a small balcony (2 chairs and a small table) overlooking a small garden. The nice benefit of being on the concierge floor was having access to food and drinks (soda, coffee, wine, beer, water, juice) in the morning, afternoon, and evening. Several times, we opted to eat breakfast and a have a light dinner instead of having to dine in a restaurant because of this. The beds in our room were comfy - though my husband was not fond of the pillows, too flat for his taste. We had a small refrigerator as well which came in handy when eating in our room and saving any food from our meals. Staff on the club level were always welcoming and helpful - even the housekeeping staff would speak to us on our walk through the halls. This was a nice change from your typical hotel! The pool area was our favorite thing about the resort! It's huge and nicely landscaped. We enjoyed using the waterslide and the sand bottom was very nice! There were plenty of lounge chairs and it was great having a towel service available (so we didn't have to bring our own towels). We took our time exploring the large pool area and testing out the hot tubs. Lifeguards are at different areas of the pool and were good about making sure kids were not running. We also liked the location of the hotel -- walking distance to Epcot and Disney Boardwalk and you can take a boat to Hollywood Studios. Since we wanted to take advantage of the extra Magic hours, we ended up driving our car instead of using Disney transportation. It took about 8 minutes to get into Magic Kingdom and 3 minutes for Hollywood Studios. *As an aside, it can be a little confusing to get to some of the other resorts if you're not paying attention. We didn't know that you had to take the road to Magic Kingdom to get to the resorts in that vicinity -- there were no road signs that indicated this.* Since we had food on our floor, we really didn't eat at the resort restaurants. However, we did have lunch at the Marketplace at the Beach Club and found the food was fine. (We used the dining plan so we weren't worried about price but, as most people know, Disney food prices are not cheap.) From our visits to the Grand Floridian, Polynesian, and the Beach Club, we would still choose the Yacht Club over all of these. The pool area can't be beat and the resort was a lot quieter than the others (that may not be a big deal to others but to us, we enjoy our quiet!). While the Yacht Club may not be as extensively decorated as say the Grand Floridian or the Polynesian, it's still a resort worth staying at.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT property, but VERY expensive!!”
Reviews.Author: TheREALgregma
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself spent 3 exhausting days at WDW and stayed at this resort at the club level. This was our first time at WDW and we loved it, however there were a few things that I would have expected from a high-end resort that was missing at Yacht Club. First is the extra cost for internet. Even low cheap hotels provide free internet! $12 per day here. Second is parking. IF you don't want to walk a long ways to/from your car, you have to valet park it. Another $15 per day! The room itself was I would say average for a hotel, and under-average for a $300+ per day resort hotel room! The saving grace is the personnel. They were for the most part awesome! I would highly recommend the Yacht club and we will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: jet055
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the yacht club in July this year,myself,wife and 3 boys,12,11 and 1.I could not fault the hotel as it is as good as you get but you pay for that.I would definitely go back but would probably downgrade to reduce the price. We used the Captains Grille several times with the food and service both excellent.The maids did a great job in our room,with fresh towels and linen when needed.The pool area is fantastic for myself and the kids,we were able to watch fireworks at Epcot every night at the pool.

Reviews.Title: “P.E.R.F.E.C.T”
Reviews.Author: Barrett-london
Reviews.Content: If you want the absolute best disney experience, then look no further. Walking distance from Epcot Centre, this is truly the best place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “I thought I was in heaven”
Reviews.Author: Vilix
Reviews.Content: It was my first time on Disney property and I LOVED IT!! The second we arrived to the front door, we were taken care of the way I never have experienced! Room was great though a little worn out but not too much. Beds are great and so comfy! We had a great GREAT view from our balcony towards Epcot. We could watch the Illuminations from our own balcony! The best thing is the walking distance to Epcot and Disney's Hollywood Studios. We went to the parks early in the morning, came back for a swim in the afternoon and headed back to the parks for the evening! The Disney transportation system makes everything soooo easy. Thank You everybody at Disney's Yacht Club! We WILL BE BACK!

Reviews.Title: “The best vacation I have ever had.”
Reviews.Author: Triper14
Reviews.Content: I have read some of the bad reviews left by other guests, and felt I needed to write about my trip back in May of 2011. This trip to DisneyWorld was the best trip I have ever been on. The hotel and staff are absolutely fantastic! The trip was a family vacation to celebrate my brother graduating high school and my graduating college. We had booked only the basic rooms (considering the high price tag per night), but when we arrived a cast member met us up front of the hotel right away and took us up to the top floor. Apparently we had been upgraded to club level suits! I don't why they upgraded us, maybe because when booking we told them we were celebrating or because the regular rooms were over-booked, either way this was an amazing surprise. The club level had SO many perks. They provide free breakfast, snacks, happy hour drinks with appetizers, and 24 hour access to snacks and beverages. The concierge that check us in was so wonderful, he even made my brother and I 'Celebration' badges. Besides the staff being out of this world, the facility itself is worth every single penny. I have never stayed somewhere so clean and beautiful. The beds were so comfortable, I have never slept better. The maids did an amazing job every day, and would always leave us little surprises like 'towel animals'. The pool at this hotel is also fantastic! It has a real sand bottom, water slide, and it's HUGE! I don't really enjoy being crammed in a pool with screaming kids, and seeing we were at DisneyWorld I figured this is what I would get, but not the case at all. The pool is so huge there is enough room for everyone to enjoy themselves. There are also various hot tubs spread around the pool. This hotel is in walking distance of Epcot which is a perk, and there is a river ferry that takes guests to Hollywood Studios and Epcot. If you are celebrating something special, I would highly recommend this hotel! They service and hotel itself are worth the high price tag. You really get the 'Disney' experience here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place but you have to Pay for EVERYTHING”
Reviews.Author: DCPRPRO
Reviews.Content: We just came back from an exhausting four days at Disney with our 5 year old daughter. The Yachtclub is a nice place with very friendly people to provide answers and to serve your needs. We ate breakfast at the Captain's Grill and had dinner one night at the Yachtsman Steak House (I would let the chef know if you have a low sodium diet). Also, keep in mind you're within walking distance of Epcot, but have to take a bus to Magic Kindgom, Animal Kingdom and a ferry to the Disney Studios. The buses don't come as regularly as one they should. Also, if you're going before November... get the tickets to Micky's Not so Scary Halloween Party. It was great! While I liked the place, I felt that I had to pay for every amenety: internet, tubes for the Lazy River, bottled water, etc. Would I go back? Maybe but not for a long time!

Reviews.Title: “Charming property, great pool, dated rooms”
Reviews.Author: CAN_in_AUS
Reviews.Content: The Yacht Club was quite a bit different from the Contemporary Resort where we stayed the previous two nights. No real wow factor to the property, but it did grow on us to the point that we felt it to be quite charming. The manicured grounds were quite nice (compared to the parking lot view at the Contemporary) and the Club's location adjacent to the lake and Boardwalk gave it a cozy feeling. They succeeded in achieving a New England ambiance which became a welcome respite after long days at the park. The room itself was very dated and showed signs of wear, but everything was working fine. Didn't care much for the decor and missed the clean lines of the Contemporary. The beds were more comfortable however. Didn't like the fact that you could not turn off the porch light at night - seems like a waste of energy and hated the light coming into the room at night. Stayed at a Club Level Room and the Club Lounge was sufficiently stocked with treats. Breakfast was good and the chocolate milk on tap was a real bonus - top marks! The staff were truly amazing. Checking in at the Club Level, they appeared to bend over backwards to ensure our trip was amazing (despite being given some minor incorrect information). The staff in the Lounge were super sweet and so nice. They were there first thing in the morning right to the end of the evening. The hotel's proximity to Epcot was super convenient, and we appreciated Disney Hollywood Studios being a boat ride away - avoid the buses at all possible when you can! The pools are said to be the best on property, and they did not disappoint. They water slide from the pirate ship looked really good, but kinda rips into your back while sliding down it, so we rode it only once. All in all, a very comfortable property. Can't say spectacular, but no major complaints. Well done.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: travelinggirl25610
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous rooms and view. A more mature setting than its sister hotel the Beach Club which share all the same amenities. In the heart of Epcot and Hollywood Studios. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to Stay1”
Reviews.Author: PeggyKate
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a 4 day cruise on the Dream and we enjoyed every minute of our stay. The hotel is beautiful and the staff is very nice & helpful. We had a beautiful room on the 3rd floor with a great view of the lake. We could enjoy the fireworks from Epcot at night from our balcony. We loved the pool - I think it is the best on Disney property. Beaches & Cream is a fun place to grab a hamburger and they have delicious ice cream too. If you want to stay in the Epcot/Disney Studios area, you can't beat the Yacht Club.

Reviews.Title: “So much fun!”
Reviews.Author: tmbmjo
Reviews.Content: This is one of the amazing Disney properties. If you have kids they will love the pool, adults will too. The way it's set up makes it easy to find secluded and quiet places allowing you to feel like you're the only one there, plus they have daily pool activities to entertain kids while the adults relax. Being joined with the Beach Club allows full use of both facilities. The Soda Shop is a must do, even if you don't attempt it, you can watch the "Kitchen Sink" sundae challenge being made. It's literally a less than 5 minute walk to Epcot's private International Gateway gate, which means no long security or ticket lines; or you can take the ferry which is approximately a 10 minute ride. The concierge in the lobby is dressed as a ships captain and full of all sorts of Disney trivia, make sure you stop and see him. Everyone is incredibly nice, the rooms are spotless and roomy, the service impeccable. I have not one complaint about the entire place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort, Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: LTML
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at this resort from August 22-29th 2011, everyone enjoyed the resort-even the 13 and 17 year old. The resort was clean, the restaurants were good and the pool area was great. The location was ideal for our family with teenagers, for us getting around to the different Disney parks was very easy. From this resort to get to Epcot and Hollywood Studios we had three options; walk (Epcot 5-7 minutes or Hollywood 20 minutes), take the boat or the bus. Connectivity to the other parks was by Motorcoach and Universal Studios was about a $35.00 cab ride each way. One of the features we enjoyed most was the pool area. We would get back from the park usually just after 9:00pm and then grab our bathing suits and head to the pool and lounge around in the lazy river until closing time at 11:00pm. In August the evenings were still very warm so it was very enjoyable. There are a selection of pools and hot tubs all at slightly different temperatures and even a sand bar for younger children to build sandcastles on and sand bottomed area in some of the pools. I have no idea what the pool area was like during daytine hours because we were out at the parks all day every day. From what we saw there were most definetly enough loungers and towels to accomodate everyone. There is also a waterslide that we saw alot of children enjoying. The multi-day Park Hopper Passes are worth the money if you are travelling with older kids and if you are on the Disney Meal Plan,it opens up many more dining options for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel but missing on some details”
Reviews.Author: MeatDJ
Reviews.Content: Our family has stayed at a few of the Disney resorts and we have always been pleased with the service. For the most part, all of the Disney resorts in Orlando are well kept with great ammenities and generally great staff. Yacht Club is a very nice resort, beautiful facilities, and well manicured grounds. The pool (shared with Beach Club) is outstanding with beautiful water, sand bottom, and a big slide for the kids. Rooms are very nice with the nautical them with very nice views of the lake (shared with Beach Club and Boardwalk). Restaurants were excellent and the Yacht Club, overall, has a "high end" feel and decor. Only two downsides - one, the resort is very large. If your room is at the end of the building, which ours was (towards Swan/Boardwalk), it is a very long walk to the lobby. If you get one of these rooms, I would recommend changing to something closer to the lobby/pool. Second, we found the Housekeeping to be a little "off" this trip. We stayed at Beach Club last year and had no issues - this year at Yacht Club we found that housekeeping was not as thorough (for example, there was a used tea bag on the floor outside of our door for two days). Our room wasn't set up as promised when we arrived and it took two phone calls to get our extra bed delivered (10 hours between the first call and second call). Little things but at $300 + per night, I expect better. Overall, it is a beautiful facility and very handy for exploring Disney World. I would recommend it - hopefully, we just had an "off week" with the housekeeping. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “I was so happy I was able to take my family to this resort due to a discounted price promotion in 8/11”
Reviews.Author: vacationhappy4
Reviews.Content: We loved it! One of our best trips ever and out of 3 Disney resorts we have stayed at this was the best.

Reviews.Title: “My first stay and it definitely won't be my last”
Reviews.Author: aavct90
Reviews.Content: My family has always stayed in the Beach Club Villas, but after this trip, we all agree the Yacht Club is a winner. It was very laid back and relaxed, whereas the Beach Club tends to be noisy even into the night. The lobby is beautiful. The staff are all very accommodating and nice, and attempted to help us in any way possible. The pool is worth the stay in itself and the view of the Boardwalk at night is stellar. The room was very clean and bed bug free! Every day, the maid service left us towels in the shape of different animals, which was a really nice touch. The amenities were great too - it was nice being able to make tea and coffee in the room and the H20 shampoo provided smells amazing. The location of the Yacht Club is killer - in walking distance of the Boardwalk, Epcot, and the boat to take to Hollywood Studios. The fitness room is really nice too. We also ate at the Captain's Grille for breakfast, which was pretty good. The only downside was that if you have the refillable mugs, there is no where to fill up except Hurricane Hannah's, which is in the pool area and is a pain to access. Your only other option is to walk all the way to the Beach Club Marketplace, which is a considerable walk from the Yacht Club. Overall, I look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stormalong Bay!”
Reviews.Author: brianz09
Reviews.Content: What an awesome pool- available only for guests staying at Beach Club or Yacht Club. Stayed for one night, but was able to use pool and fitness center lockers (at no charge) until my flight home. Counter service set up in the Beach Club Marketplace could be better, but the proximity to so many other dining options helps address that issue. Will return for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly Perfect”
Reviews.Author: SassieSue
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our 14 night stay at the Yacht Club. Was undecided about whether to book this resort or the neighbouring Beach Club instead, but I am glad I chose the Yacht Club. Prefered the atmosphere, more serene and elegant. The Beach Club was much busier and had more children running around, whereas the Yacht Club was more of an adult ambiance and was more peaceful of the two. Even though I have two children, the Beach Club was a bit mad for me. Having a balcony was important for me, so if this is important to you I would suggest you ring up a few days prior to your visit, because some rooms dont have balconies at all, some have sort of a step on balcony , then some small, and some larger balconies. Hotel was extremely well maintained, all staff, housekeeping excellent. Buses to the parks run frequently, never had to wait long. There are boat transfers to Epcot (although only a pleasant 10 minute walk anyway and quicker) and also Hollywood Studios. The boats stop running during a storm or even if one is expected. During this time buses are laid on instead. Although i loved the hotel I would like to give a 4.5 star review, this was due to the fact the coin laundry facilities were not as good as other hotels I have stayed in, and the main reason if you are on the Disney Dining Plan, you cannot get counter service meals at the Yacht Club - you have to trek over to the Beach Club. The Beach Club has the Marketplace whereby you can get counter service meals and use the Disney refillable mug service. Although The Ale and Compass Bar at the Yacht Club does have a couple of muffins and fruit, there is not much selection and they are only open limited hours. The Yacht club is seriously lacking in food selection/counter service/drinks and it is quite a walk each morning to the Beach Club and back. Loved the quiet pool. I have previously stayed at Disneys Animal Kingdom Lodge and this was the only thing lacking there. Loved having a nice quiet swim. The coin laundry is located next to the quiet pool, so enjoyed putting in my washing for 36 minutes $2 and $2 for drying whilst I had a swin. Overall the Yacht Club is an excellent hotel, in the perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “We have a new favorite!”
Reviews.Author: Durien
Reviews.Content: Our vacation was from 8/22 to 9/1 and we had a garden view room (2130) at the Yacht Club. This was our 3rd trip to WDW with our previous 2 stays at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. When we arrived around 12:00 am our room was ready, neat, and clean. Our room was very close to the lobby and it was less than a 5 minute walk to the bus stop. Our garden view was not so much of a garden as a view of the dense trees which blocked the view of the parking lot. Nothing can beat the convenience of this resort. Since we are from Seattle, my family (wife and 5 year old son) would tend to sleep in and I would wonder to get breakfast for them in the morning. There are SOOOOOOO many choices, some days I walked to Epcot to the bakery in Paris, some days I walked to the Boardwalk bakery. I could also walk down to the Market Place for quick service. The Pool My son loves to swim and there is no resort at Disney that has a better pool set up than this. The only days when he did not go in the pool was the day we arrived and the day we left. Even on the days when we went to the water parks, he came back and wanted to swim in the pool and play in the sand. One thing to note about the pool, if you need a life jacket, they have a new policy that allows you to check out a life jacket. This is both a good and bad thing. The bad is, if there is not one available, you will need to wait until one becomes available, the good is once you have one, you will have one for the rest of your stay. There are 2 water slides a long slide that starts at the top of a sunken pirate ship or a shorter slide for smaller children at the base of the ship. Both are manned by lifeguards. As a matter of fact, there were many lifeguards at the pool and there is a sense of safety here :) Dining at the resort: Yachtman Steakhouse was fantastic as always as was our server Oscar (who has been our server the previous 2 stays.) He actually remembered us and remebered where we had sat the last time we dined there. Steak was cooked perfect and my wife loved the Lobster Bisque. My son loved the mickey puzzle desert heh heh We did both a dinner and a character breakfast at Cape May Cafe. Both were very good and the characters were fantastic with not only my son but with the other kids as well. We also went to Beaches and Cream to get ice cream and it was great that they are open until late. I have no real complaints. The first 2 days we had no towel animals but since my son was looking forward to them, I left a note for the person who was our mousekeeper and she began to leave them for us. It can be very expensive but we were able to get a deal through the website which helped bring down the cost. Even for the cost my wife and I were already talking about planning another vacation here. You really can't beat the proximity to everything (walk to boardwalk and epcot, water taxi to epcot and Hollywood Studios, buses to MK, AK, and DD. If you have a park hopper (we always get this option) you can even go through Epcot and take the monorail to MK as well instead of waiting for the bus. AKL was our favorite but YC beats it hands down.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Trip”
Reviews.Author: Drums5150
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Yacht Club for 5 days and 4 nights for our honeymoon. The resort itself is very nice, and the staff friendly. We told check-in we were on our honeymoon and they gave us a complimentary room upgrade with a view of Crescent Lake. The hotel has two pools. The first one, Stormalong Bay, is shared with the Beach Club right next door. There is also a "quiet pool" on the side of the Yacht Club that's a little more secluded and "adult". The location is very convenient to Epcot and Hollywood Studios. You can walk to Epcot in about 5-7 minutes and a boat will take you to Hollywood Studios in about the same time. Now, for some things to consider while at the Yacht Club that were not the best. We had dinner reservations at their restaurant the "Captains Grille" for 7:20PM one night. We were seated relatively promptly, but then the trouble started. It took about 40 minutes to simply get drinks and bread for the table. Ultimately, it took us almost 2 hours to eat dinner, and it was just two of us. I did observe other patrons complaining to the restaurant manager for the lack of timely service. I highly suggest avoiding this restaurant. Another issue we had one night was simply finding a vending machine for bottled water. It was midnight, and no restaurant or room service was available, and evidently the Yacht Club only has 1 vending machine, which was out of order. We went to the front desk and were told the Beach Club next door had one, but it was on the opposite end of their property. It took us almost 10 minutes just to walk and find it. Who knew it would take almost 30 minutes just to get water on the property! Overall, it was a very good experience, but the room rates are pricey, and the rooms are not something you say "wow" over.

Reviews.Title: “Some Good, Some Bad”
Reviews.Author: Salem45122531
Reviews.Content: Me, my wife and three kids, ages 13, 10 and 8, stayed here in August. When we planned our trip we thought long and hard on where to stay and the Yacht club with their water park type pool and great location was the clear choice. The hotel was beautiful and you felt you were staying somewhere special as soon as you walked through the door. It was upscale without being stuffy. Kids were everywhere and the staff made you feel comfortable. They say "welcome home" when you return from the park and the "Captain" is always there to greet you. It's sister hotel , the Beach Club, is more casual and relaxed but did not have that special feel. If you are paying the same money you might as well feel pampered and special. Some reviews say that the pool is closer to the Beach Club but it was just a few feet from the back door of the Yacht Club. The pool is very nice. There are three separate pools in all. A play area pool for the little kids about two and a half feet deep ( you get kids meals in a bucket and shovel which the kids use to build sand castles). A lazy river pool and a regular pool with small water falls. Epcot is a short 10 minute walk to the left and is great for quick trips to the park, especially for all the world restaurants you can use on the meal plan. Hollywood studios is a one and a half mile walk to the right but take the ferry. It is quick and easy with the boat launch about 200 yards from the back door. The Boardwalk Hotel is across the water and is really beautiful lite up at night with many things to do as you stroll along the path. The Captains Grill for breakfast should not be missed. Dinner there however was just ok. With the good parts out of the way I will now tell you about the bad. Housekeeping was horrendous. They hardly vacuumed the room and with the sand from the pool being brought back with you to the room it needs to be done daily. Don't expect towel characters other then day one. One day my kids ran in to see what towel character was left and they found a bag of garbage left on the bed instead. My room issues did not end there. On day 5 my toilet overflowed soaking the rug. They did come and fix it quickly however when we returned from the park we discovered housekeeping never wiped up the water that was left behind from the overflow. We found that out after we stepped into the bathroom covered with water. There is no quick service meal area other then a cafeteria style sandwich shop placed in the back of the Beach Club's gift shop with no place to sit and eat or outside by the pool. Therefore there is really no need to purchases a resort mug unless you stay in the Beach Club. If you have little kids you really need a quick service restaurant in your hotel similar to the one at the Conrado Springs hotel. Since there is no quick place to go for breakfast you have to go the park and fend for yourself. Also the walk to the Beach club is a good 5 + minute walk and not worth it. for the drinks or sandwich shop. The pool is great but the sand is not beach sand. It is rough and grainy. Almost like fish tank sand. Okay to walk on, hard on the knees to play on. The slide which is cool has very rough expansion joints holding the slide together. It actually left red marks on your back from the bumps as you slide down to the pool. They also charge you $10 dollars a day for a tube to use in the lazy river. Way too much money for a $400 a night hotel. At night , if you decide to swim, there are always tubes left around in the pool area to use for free. Speaking of expensive $10 a day for internet access is a shame as well. It was cheaper to use my Droids wi-fi capability for $14 per month then spend the $10 per day. Lastly I got a garden room view. What a waste of money . My room overlooked the driveway to the hotel and covered car port and walking area. What made this a garden view room was a large tree right out side my balcony that only partially blocked these views. I look forward to going back to Disney but next time we will go back to Coronado Springs or the Grand Floridan.

Reviews.Title: “Met my expectations”
Reviews.Author: dmt117
Reviews.Content: I researched the Disney resorts before our vacation and decided on Yacht Club. In the event, Yacht Club met my expectations, both good and bad. First, don't expect the hotel to be comparable to other similarly priced hotels outside Disney. You pay a premium to stay Disney, so a Disney priced like a 5 star is really a 4 (or less) star. And the Yacht Club leaves a little to be desired as a high end hotel. My son tried to order room service at midnight and was told it would be 75 minutes; the "cast member" helpfully indicated the location of vending machines, which we visited, only to discover that they were empty. We eventually hunted down full vending machines in the neighboring Beach Club resort. Not exactly the magical food experience I was hoping for at 1 AM. Our shower also didn't get completely hot and they handed me the wrong tickets on arrival. There were a few other minor irritants as well; but like I say, I adjusted my expectations due to the Disney premium. On the positive side, the staff was uniformly pleasant and helpful and responded promptly when we had problems. The pool is as great as everyone says and the Yacht Club location is unbeatable. The rooms were plenty large enough for our family of five, including my six foot plus sons.

Reviews.Title: “Convention accommodations are nice”
Reviews.Author: tlcjunk
Reviews.Content: We had a meeting here and the catering and accommodations were nice. The rooms at the Yacht Club were basic - nothing fancy. It's proximity to the meeting rooms, Epcot, and the dueling piano bar was convenient. Lightning storms came in almost every evening, so we were unable to enjoy the great pool after our meetings at the Beach Club (connected). I checked out the day care center - they open at 4:30 PM and seemed to accommodate food allergies very professionally. There are no movie channels in the rooms - Disney wants you out spending money. Their bus/shuttle system was pretty convenient as well. We took it to Downtown Disney one night.

Reviews.Title: “Had to force myself to leave!”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoSP
Reviews.Content: My family took our summer vacation at Disney World, a place we had never been but always dreamed of. We stayed Regatta Club level at the Yacht Club and it exceeded every expectation. The concierge staff was incredibly helpful, particularly Barbara who really went the extra mile to accomodate our room preference (our 2 boys, aged 8 and 15, did not want to share a bed - Barbara arranged for us to have one of the few lagoon view rooms that had an extra daybed/couch). They made us feel appreciated and welcomed, although the resort was absoutely packed. The only thing I can come up with as a negative aspect is the club lounge really needs to be larger to accomodate everyone on club level. Out of the week we stayed, there was only 2 times we were able to get a table in the lounge. That being said, the offerings in the lounge were wonderful! We can't wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “Disney Trip”
Reviews.Author: fitznorton
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at the Yacht Club Resort with family. Checked in early and was told they would call when room was ready. They called with the wrong room info which had us walking all over the resort with heavy luggage. Finally straightened out and my garden view room was a view of scrub pines and the valet parking lot. What?? Could not go to the desk again so we settled in. Main pool was loud, (as it should be) with lots of family and children activities. The quiet pools not so quiet anymore. Coffee in the lobby not available until 7 AM so you see lots of early risers walking around. Overall room was clean and hotel is lovely. Charge for internet access and gym was free.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: pjhorton21
Reviews.Content: Our family of stayed for 5 nights at club level. The service we received was remarkable - from the moment of check-in until we left. We felt pampered at every turn. We decided to spring for the club level, which included the lounge with food and drinks. Probably wasn't worth the extra cost, but it was nice to drop in after time in the parks for a snack and something to drink. Our family did eat breakfast (oatmeal with toppings) each morning. As stated in other reviews, the pool was ginormous and our kids loved it! This is the first WDW resort we have stayed at where we opted to stay and enjoy the resort as opposed to going to the theme parks. Also, being able to walk to EPCOT (5 min) , Disney Studios (15 min) and the Boardwalk (10 min) was a big plus! One complaint - the Captain's Grill restaurant - food was so - so and the service was the worst I have ever experienced at WDW! Other than that a wonderful stay and highly recommended! Tip: Ping Pong and a Billiard Table are available in the pool area. Go the store (near the windmill) to check our the equipment.

Reviews.Title: “our favorite hotel in Disney world”
Reviews.Author: EBFK
Reviews.Content: fantastic pool with water slide, swim against the current, sandy bottom. lovely room overlooking the "lake" sofa, plenty of horizontal surfaces. can walk to Epcot or take the boat can walk to other resorts, such as Boardwalk which has evening entertainment. a good choice if you wish to have fewer children around.

Reviews.Title: “would be lovely with kids”
Reviews.Author: lee4447
Reviews.Content: I was here for 5 days accompanying my husband for a meeting. The rooms were a little small but well decorated and furnished. The only piece of furniture lacking, was a comfortable sofa-chair, because the only place you could sit on, was the bed or the chair near the work desk! The resort was ideal for kids with numerous pools and free shuttles to the other Disney resorts across the lake, and the parks. Even a shuttle to downtown Disney. [would have helped to have a shuttle to a non Disney shopping area like outlet- shopping] The service to and from the airport was EXCELLENT!! Th e airline check-in was available right at the hotel, and they even delivered your luggage from the airport to your room.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel loved it will defintly be back”
Reviews.Author: deb745
Reviews.Content: this was a great hotel.we had a bit of a problem the first day we lost our luggage and the staff was very helpful and they mangaed to find it.and even gave us a ride to walmart so we can buy stuff.and the rooms were clean.and the pool was gorgeous.and i like that they have a quiet pool .and it is right near the boardwalk.and you can either take a boat or walk to epcot.and a boat ride to hollywood studios.and the food is good.the only problem i had with this hotel is the gift shop was terrible.it needed a bigger selection of items.and for the bus you have to wait forever.other than that great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant but Fun”
Reviews.Author: m1tch4
Reviews.Content: Only stayed here for 1 night before are return flight to England, but as soon as we walked into the lobby wish we were able to stay for longer. Very welcoming and smart with attentive staff, who checked us in immediately. Walked over to the Beach Club and although it was also very nice we were glad we chose the Yacht Club as it felt more sophisticated. We loved our room, which was beautifully furnished in the nautical style, we had a standard room and had asked for a quiet location that overlooked the small pool and tennis court, this was very peaceful. Fantastic pool area, we were very impressed by the water slide and sand based pool with it's own lazy river and whirl pool, although it was exclusive it still got busy in the afternoon but it is a lot quieter in the morning. The smaller pool was also great for peaceful relaxation. We dined at Captains Grille which we were not impressed with, due to average food and poor service. We had met up with some friends and had to pay an extra service charge as we had a table for 8. Really enjoyed this hotel with a convenient location as we had the board-walk opposite and Epcot and Hollywood Studios within very easy reach. This is a good alternative to the Grand Floridian if you want elegance at a cheaper price, we would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, location, and all around good choice!”
Reviews.Author: TrvlGrl12
Reviews.Content: Disney really does their resorts right, and this resort was no exception. We stayed here for four nights, three of which were on business. Our room was a Standard, with two double beds on the 3rd floor. We stayed in 3225, overlooking a roof. While this provided no intriguing view, it DID ensure that no one was able to look into our room. The hallways in this resort are loooooooong, so take a shot of an energy drink before heading to your room or leaving your room for the elevator! The proximity to Epcot is wonderful! You can walk to Epcot, take the water taxi, or the shuttle bus. Walking is very easy, unless you're in the dead heat of the day. There is a shuttle from this resort that takes you directly to Magic Kingdom, where some Disney resorts' shuttles take you to the Disney Transportation Center where you must transfer to the monorail. So, location is wonderful! Three days of our stay were spent in the convention center area. It's an easy walk from the hotel, not like uber huge hotels. If you've ever stayed at the MGM or Mandalay Bay in Las Vegas, then you know that the convention center is a far walk from the hotel rooms. It's nothing like that at Disney Yacht Club. The convention center/meetings rooms are an easy walk from the hotel rooms, and provide spacious, accessible, and clean facilities for corporate meetings. It was very, very cold during our meetings, but that's usually true of most corporate meeting environments. We added on an extra day to our business stay for the purpose of visiting the theme parks. In one day, we went on our favorite rides at Magic Kingdom, Animal Kingdom, and Hollywood Studios -- all via Disney transportation from the Disney Yacht Club. If you're considering this resort at all, I can't think of any reason NOT to stay here. If you'd like to see our video of our room, you can check it out here -- http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RtIKPW4exNE

Reviews.Title: “I liked the Yacht Club but the rest of the family liked Boardwalk Hotel Better!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravel101
Reviews.Content: We took our 12 year old son to the Yacht Club prior to going on the Disney Dream. I really like this hotel. My husband and son preferred (just slightly) the Boardwalk Hotel. They like the outdoor activity of the boardwalk at night. The Yacht Club grounds were beautiful and they liked the pool area better at the Yacht Club - the lazy river and slide were great. They did movies on the beach at night but we were alway coming home from a late dinner so never were able to do. We loved our room. Disney upgraded us since it was my birthday to a lake view room, which we really appreciated. My husband did ask. Staff were all very friendly and asking if they could help. I think this Disney hotel is my favorite so far of the four that we have been at: Wilderness Lodge, Boardwalk and the Caribbean Beach Resort(pirate room).

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: honeycutt33
Reviews.Content: We love staying here! The hotel is amazing! My favorite is the pool! I could stay there the entire time! Staff is great and location to Hollywood Studios and Epcot is just perfect! Heading back on labor day! Monika Honeycutt

Reviews.Title: “Great time!”
Reviews.Author: Ilyngirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our anniversary weekend. The hotel is very nice with it's nautical theme. We enjoyed our towel animals and the room was comfortable. Our view faced the water and we had a nice view of the dock. The pool is shared with the Disney Beach Club and was great. Our kids had the best time and loved the sandy beach and slide. There is also a lazy river. Best pool ever at any of the Disney resorts. The boat transportation to Epcot and Hollywood Studios was efficient although some benches would be nice for when you are waiting and exhausted. We had a great time here and can't wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “Good but value?”
Reviews.Author: GT2TODO
Reviews.Content: Second time for my family at a Disney Resort Hotel, last time was the Beach Club, this time we decided to stay next door at the Yacht Club. We stayed here because of the Epcot location and the fantastic pool complex. The hotel itself is good, clean and the staff eager to please. The location opposite the Boardwalk is superb. The onsite restaurants are just OK, the menu choice limited (except breakfast) The cost of the food does not reflect good value for money, we ate away from the hotel on most occasions. My biggest dissapointment was the fact that after paying over Â£7000 for a 2 week stay the kids club is not included. Great holiday, but now the kids are a little older this will be our last holiday at a Disney Resort, yes we all know Disney is expensive they do make things easy but offer very little value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything but the THIN walls”
Reviews.Author: CDancel
Reviews.Content: Nearly every worker and amenity in this hotel was amazing. Pool was so awesome - it was hard to leave. View from standard, cheapo room was wonderful. Location was great. Only complaints 1. Housekeeping: tub had some dirt in it, coffee maker pot had old coffee grounds in the pot, one blanket had encrusted food on it - ewww. Room was very clean and nice other than that. 2. Captains' Grille: Greeters, chef and food was amazing but our waitress sucked. She never refilled our drinks, cleared our plates away or checked on us. 3. Noise and this one is the deal breaker: Could hear EVERYTHING - toilets flushing, conversations, doors opening and closing. Was only able to sleep from 11:30 - 5am as that was the only time people weren't up late talking or up early getting ready to leave. I've stayed in several Disney resorts and this is the ONLY hotel that this has happened at. Sad as this is the most expensive Disney hotel I have stayed at. If any Disney peeps are reading this, PLEASE insulate the walls with something. Otherwise, despite how amazing this hotel is in nearly every other respect, I just can't stay here again as sleep is one of the main highlights of a vacation to me. In summary, this is one of the most amazing hotels I have ever stayed in but sadly I wouldn't stay here again due to the noise level. If you are a heavy sleeper or can get a room on the top floor, you might be fine and in luck as otherwise, it really is an excellent resort.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and anxious to return”
Reviews.Author: Dick7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated my 65th birthday at the Yacht Club and Disney Parks. We were very pleased with our room on the Regatta Club floor . It was very clean. The staff was exceptional in all areas of the resort . We enjoyed the convenience of the resort to Epcot and Broadwalk. A wonderful resort to celebrate a birthday. Walt Disney World is a place where dreams come true at any age.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Radrev
Reviews.Content: My family joined me here while I was attending a conference. We had a tremendous time during our stay. We felt Disney every day we were here. I was able to pick up conference after hours tickets from the concierge desk and join my family at Hollywood Studios. You can take a boat from here to the Studios, other hotels, the boardwalk, and Epcot. We also were able to use Disney transportation to go to other resorts and restaurants. You should stay here at least once in a lifetime.

Reviews.Title: “Pool was great. Lots of fun for families.”
Reviews.Author: KLfromMCO
Reviews.Content: We choose the Yacht Club for its pool. It has several pool areas that appeal to all ages - from babies to adults. It has a beach area and a sand-bottomed pool. There's a pirate ship with a slide and a lazy river. The pool area is clean and well-maintained. The room reminded me of the other Disney "deluxe resort" hotel rooms as far as size and layout go. It has a yacht/boating theme throughout the property. We had a fun time. It's a great location. The boardwalk is just a short walk (as are other DIsney hotels) so there are plenty of dining choices. You can walk into the back entrance of Epcot. We had a late night swim and watched the Epcot fireworks from the pool. The pool bar and restaurant (Hurricane Hanna's) were friendly and affordable. The kids meals are served in sand buckets which come in handy in the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Can't say a bad word about the Yacht Club”
Reviews.Author: LouRoo2004
Reviews.Content: Our experience with the Yacht Club was great! Pros: -Friendly, helpful staff -Variety of dining options -Short walk to Epcot and Boardwalk -Short boat ride (or you could walk) to Hollywood Studios -Bus to WDW was easy and quick -Our room was well maintained -Beach/play area was fabulous and had things for all ages (we had a 2 and 5 yr old) Cons: -Some of the the beach was closed. However, there were enough other things to do that it really did not impact us. -Long wait time to check in -Computers were down a few times while we were there, so booking things took some time -Booked an appointment with the Bippity Boppity Boutique through the concierge and they booked me for the Downtown Disney one instead of the Magic Kindom one.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place but luckily I got a good conference rate”
Reviews.Author: klbears
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Disney Yacht Club Resort for 4 days for a business conference. The hotel is nice but not extravagant which for rack rates of $350-$400 per night I would think it would look more like a Ritz Carlton than a Hampton Inn. I'm glad I paid less than 1/2 that price per night on the conference rate. The service was pure Disney and very courteous, friendly and helpful. The gym as fairly large and had good equipment and a whirlpool. The very large pool and beach area seemed like fun if you were on a family vacation with a sand beach right on the pool. Area - If you are going to Hollywood Studios or Epcot you can take a very short boat ride to these parks. You can actually walk to the International Gateway of Epcot from the resort. You can also walk across the "lake" to the Boardwalk area. If you want to go to other resorts or Downtown Disney, that is either by car or the buses. For a conference, a pretty good place to stay and fairly quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel pool!”
Reviews.Author: KDK
Reviews.Content: My husband, 18 month old daughter and I stayed at this hotel for a few nights before taking a Disney cruise. The location is great - on a lake with other hotels to explore and plenty of restaurant choices. We didn't have a car and never missed it. We got a room with a view of the lake and pool which was great in the evenings for sitting on the balcony after our daughter went to bed. The room itself was fine - nothing fancy. The bed was comfortable and there was plenty of storage space for luggage. We were a little disappointed in the customer service. We called the first night to tell them the light on our balcony was out and to send someone to change the light bulb. After 3 more calls and a stop at the front desk they didn't come until 9 pm the next night was was too late. I had expected more after hearing about the great Disney customer service. Our favorite part of this hotel was the awesome pool! It's huge and has a sand bottom. There were plenty of places in the sand for our daughter to play and the zero entry made it nice for when she wanted to get wet. There was a water slide that we didn't get a chance to use. The lazy river was fun and always had tubes available at the end of the day free of charge. We would return to this hotel if staying in the Orlando area again - mainly for the pool and location.

Reviews.Title: “Disney property without the Parks”
Reviews.Author: TripCorrespondent
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property for three nights as a meeting attendee. Our Organization is Florida based and meets frequently in Orlando, but has not previously booked a Disney property. I must admit that they far exceeded my expectations and handled the group, as well as myself as well as any "business oriented" hotel. One is met upon entry by a roving greeter who facilitates check in and entry into your room. A very nice, and unexpected, touch. The rooms (identical to those at sister Beach Club) are well appointed and comfortable with bed(s) and fold out couch, depending on configuration. I had a balcony overlooking Crescent Lake, which was a great spot for morning coffee (supplied with the room). One minor issue is wired internet (for an additional charge) only; no wireless in the rooms. Though short cables are supplied, it was nice to have brought my own extra length Ethernet. Though the restaurants are somewhat overpriced and offer only average fare, there are many options nearby, and the staff is willing to direct those who request it to neighboring establishments. Friendly, helpful staff throughout and clean comfortable rooms, cause this reviewer to award high marks. One cautionary word: the free Disney airport transportation (bus) stops three times on the way -and way back- to the airport. Plan accordingly for at least an hour in non rush hour traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Very overpriced, and the staff was less than to be desired!”
Reviews.Author: Erindz04
Reviews.Content: For the cost of the hotel, compared with other hotel destinations, this was definitely not on the top of the list. I will not be a repeat customer! Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Best Disney Resort Hands Down”
Reviews.Author: Mattsmom96
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 with kids ages 15 and 11. We have been coming to Yacht Club and/or Beach Club since they were little. Every time we have stayed (at least 5 vacations) we have yet to ever come up with a single complaint. I would never stay at another resort. We have tried Poly and Wilderness and nothing compares to both of these resorts. We didnt need the close proximity of Beach Club for the drink refills so staying at Yacht Club is always our preference. It is MUCH quieter than Beach Club. You appreciate the quiet factor after a day at the Parks. The only advantage to Beach Club is a bigger food marketplace. And if you dont mind walking, it is nothing to walk through Yacht Club to Beach Club to go there without ever going outside. The restaurants are great, room service is great and our room was cleaned wonderfully every day. It is hands down the winner of location too. That alone makes it worth staying here. We stayed July 4th week and the resort not sold out so we got an instant room upgrade; had groceries delivered from Garden Grocer and they were there waiting in the hotel fridges and were immediately brought up to our room when we arrive. Looking forward to many more flawless vacations at Yacht/Beach Club.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been happier!”
Reviews.Author: pinkmingos
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel so, so, so much! It was absolutely beautiful from the entrance all the way to our room. Great lobby, not as busy as other Disney properties. The room was beautiful and very clean! The pool is the real gem of the resort, and looks even better than the pictures. The Boardwalk is a short walk around the lake, or you can take a ferry. The Boardwalk has restaurants, shops, etc. It is just a 5-10 minute walk (you can also take a ferry) to Epcot's back entrance and a short ferry ride to Hollywood Studios. I'm sure it is due to the price, but we noticed a much nicer vibe to the guests at this resort compared to others. We split a meal at the Captain's Grill, which was fantastic. We would highly recommend it. Overall, it was a great stay, and we were sad to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: getbit_98
Reviews.Content: WOW, What a place. From the minute I arrived, I was actually treated like I was royalty. A staff member actually walked me from the front door to check in. You don't get the overcrowded feeling that some of the other resorts have. This was my 6th different resort to stay in, and I think I have found my favorite. Nice access to Epcot and Hollywood Studios. Well worth the extra money to stay here. The pool has a 6 foot deep lazy river that was great to relax in . Of course I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect vacation”
Reviews.Author: whoslou
Reviews.Content: Disney's Yacht Club is the perfect family vacation spot. We took our 3 teenage kids for their first visit to WDW, aside from having a great time in the parks the Yacht Club is located in the perfect spot. It is far enough away from the Magic Kingdom to avoid the crowds, it is a 5 minute walk to Epcot , where we ate 3 nights and from our hotel we could see the Epcot and MK fireworks each night. It is an easy boat ride to the Boardwalk and Disney Studios. We stayed on the Club floor, which I recommend for anyone with children. They serve a nice breakfast, which includes cerals, oatmeal, fruit and bagels. In the afternoon they serve both hot and cold appetizers, which is perfect to take the edge off before dinner. From the moment we walked in until the minute we left the staff was great! I can't imagine staying anywhere else in Disney on a return trip!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you want all of your belongings to be stolen”
Reviews.Author: Nadia0922
Reviews.Content: My grandmother mysteriously lost her brooch, ring and cell phone in that room over the course of seven days. They also didn't vacuum the rooms properly. The convenience store was a rip off, buying a small bottle of milk cost just as much as a carton at Beach Club. The pool was the best thing they had to offer which still IMO doesn't justify the price. If you want to stay somewhere expensive and at a prime location though then the Beach club is better, it seemed much more lively, the convenience store was way better but beware of the clepto housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: RBD1975
Reviews.Content: There were definitely some issues with this hotel. We have two small toddlers who still take naps in the afternoon. Our first day, we were at a theme park for about 5-6 hours. We came back around 3 and the room was not clean. The 2nd day, we specifically called the front desk and asked for our room to be cleaned early. the woman at the front desk said it would be done immediately. We came back at 5 pm, and the room was still not cleaned. We had no privacy sign at the door. The location was fantastic. However, the decor inside of the hotel didn't really have a "disney" feel. I don't think it was worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Resort”
Reviews.Author: Backoftheboard
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Yacht Club in June of 2011. What a beautiful hotel! The staff was extremely accomodating. The man who cleaned our room each day always had a surprise waiting for our kids. The pool was phenomenal. Something to keep every age satisfied there from the water slide for older kids to the sandy area for our three year old. The rooms were not huge, but were very clean. Lots of nice Disney touches. Bathrooms look like they are soon ready for some updating. Our favorite part of the resort was the convenience. The 5-10 walk to Epcot and 10 minute boat ride to Hollywood Studios was fantastic. More time in the parks and less on the buses. Overall, it was a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Most Inconsiderate Staff”
Reviews.Author: VWY_11
Reviews.Content: We took the "Magical Express" which included Airport to hotel delivery of luggage. It was raining outside and they left the bags in the rain. The bags came to the room with the clothing and other contents all wet. I am still awaiting the return call to my room. It was supposed to be a quick return call and it's now going on 2 hours! Here I am with my three kids waiting to go to the park; but, instead I am sitting in my room awaiting my lost luggage and rectification of our wet formerly clean clothes! Just PLEASE Disney...do something good!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding - "Sooo Disney"”
Reviews.Author: pminyon
Reviews.Content: Attending a three day conference, our Corporation chose the Disney Yacht Club Resort. The people were extremely friendly, the rooms were clean and spacious.The bedding was extremely comfortable, with delicious pillows! Room service was excellent and entertaining with their towel creations! The bathroom featured a vanity area with dual sinks and a seperate toilet area with a tub/shower. Water pressure was excellent in the shower! The Lobby area was spacious with an ajoining bar. The decor was of a nautical theme, with rich wood and beautiful decor appointments. Transportation was convienient with cast member assistance everywhere to lend advice. The conference facility was beautiful and staffed well. The refreshments at each break were plentiful and comprehensive. The sand bottom pool is a real treat. The kids area had plenty of entertainment with activities, or you can nestle in away to a quieter area as well. Oh yes, there is a lazy river too! If you have ever had a Disney experience, you know how much they exceed your expextations. The Yacht Club Resort stays true to that Disney Experience. We had a Magical stay!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we we'll be back!!!”
Reviews.Author: kimberlyg01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our 10th wedding anniversary. We both loved it; we had requested a king bed and got it, the room was on the first floor and right by the quiet pool; and down the hall from the gift shop, very convienant...I thought it would be noisey..but it was very quiet and room was clean...no problems...everyone on staff was very nice. We did eat at the yachtsmen steak house...very good ..and I thought the breakfast at cape may cafe was good as well for a buffet...beaches and cream was awsome...not bad prices.
