There is so many activities to do...that you will never be bored...the pools are fantastic...enjoyed both...the movies under the stars was nice and relaxing after a long hot day at the parks...all and all it was perfect for us...so close to the parks...everything right at your hand...we are coming back to this hotel...we stayed at the boarwalk, contemporary, and port new orleans...all nice...but this one was perfect...!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: cwgriswold
Reviews.Content: This resort is our favorite by far. The pool complex is the best ever, nothing- anywhere- compares. We especially love the pool area at night, it was open 'til 11 pm during our stay. The distinguishing factor of the YC is its quiet elegance- it definitely is different from the rest in this regard, Grand Floridian included. Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, clean, friendly--a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: javl
Reviews.Content: I make this review with one caveat--this trip was given to us as a gift. I don't think we would have stayed here if we had to pay--both because we couldn't have afforded it, but also because it made me very nervous that, when the reservation was made, they would never give the exact room rate. It looks like it came to over $400 a night--and I can't really say the hotel (or any Orlando hotel) is worth that. Nevertheless, if you have decided to stay at a deluxe disney resort and are willing to pay for all the convenience that buys, then the Yacht Club is a great choice. It is quiet, peaceful and civilized (we had our young son with us, but the Yacht Club doesn't seem to attract the huge families that the neighboring Beach Club does). We had a 'garden room' with a balcony. It was quiet--we were never disturbed by voices or other noises. The room was pleasant and clean, although nothing more than you would find in a regular Marriott or Hilton hotel (in other words, it is not extreme luxury, despite the price). The room was always clean by the time we returned each day in mid-afternoon to rest. The housekeeping staff is very hard-working and very courteous. (Our one small complaint is that we twice had to ask for more shower gel and shampoo). The lobby is lovely and a great place to relax and enjoy a drink. Every single staff person we encountered at the yacht club was informed, cheerful, and very helpful. We wound up just grabbing a light breakfast in the mornings in the bar area--cereal and English muffins and coffee. The man running that was always friendly and helpful in helping us figure out what was covered by 'quick service' on the meal plan. We ate at the two main restaurants there--the Yachtsman STeakhouse and Captain's Grill--and both were very good. We expected a first-rate meal at the Steakhouse and got it: they had a wonderful deconstructed Beef Wellington that was creative and delicious. We also ate at the Grille a couple of times unplanned (too tired to venture out again at night) and were pleasantly surprised. The chef there is wonderful--creative, skilled, and friendly. Even the simplest items on the menu had special details added. In addition to its peacefulness and elegance, we liked the Yacht Club because of its proximity to other venues. We could walk to Epcot for dinner and the fireworks, or walk to the Boardwalk. The lagoon pool was also very nice, with an afternoon pool party that our son loved. Nighttime marshmallow roasting and movies on the beach were also a big hit. Our main complaint is that there is no wireless there--quite shocking in this day and age, especially when paying for a 'luxury' hotel and especially when Disney itself is so high-tech. We bought the wireless once, but it only worked in a couple spots in the main lobby--we had to move from chair to chair to find a connection.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but Great "Honeymoon" Stay”
Reviews.Author: sophie832
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Disney's Yacht Club resort for our much-belated honeymoon. Knowing that no requests are guaranteed, we asked for a king bed, and we got it! We had a great room with a balcony on the third floor. We had a view of the lake, as well as a view of llluminations at night! Housekeeping was great. Although we only received the infamous towel animal on our first day, our room was always clean and spotless throughout our 10 day stay. The best part about this hotel is really the location...you can walk to Epcot or Hollywood Studios, or take a boat! We never had to wait long for buses to the other parks, either. All the Cast Members we talked to were friendly and helpful. We did have a really long walk to our room, but we didn't mind...I think some people would, though. Also, we weren't impressed with any of the food, except for Yachtsman Steakhouse, which is amazing! My husband used the pool in Stormalong Bay, which is supposed to be one of the best pools on Disney property, and he had a great time, even in chilly December. I enjoyed the spa at the quiet pool near our room. Plus, I discovered there's also one in the back of the gym (which can be accessed 24/7 with a card you can get at the front desk). Yes, this is an expensive hotel, but you are paying a premium for 2 reasons: Disney and location. For us, it was worth it. Pros: Great quiet pool and jacuzzi, as well as a great gym with hidden jacuzzi! Yachtsman Steakhouse is an excellent restaurant. Location, location, location! Everyone was friendly and helpful. Beaches N Cream (at Beach Club next door) has the best ice cream! Cons: Long walk to room, not a great breakfast at Cape May, no quick service food (and the breakfast at the Beach Club quick service was gross). No free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: ClwMurph
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful resort, with an especially nice pool area. However the floor plan of the hotel is such that unless you get a room close to the Lobby, you will end up walking forever in order to get to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but not as clean as I would expect for the money”
Reviews.Author: LoveToGoAnywhere
Reviews.Content: First off I will say this is a beautiful hotel. The rooms were very spacious. Surprisingly, our room wasn't as clean as I would have expected. We had a stained comforter and I had to call to get it replaced. Also, the patio off our room didn't look like it EVER got cleaned. It was kind of icky just to go sit out there. That being said we really did enjoy our stay. The hotel is HUGE and we walked, and walked and walked for what seem like forever to get to our room. The staff is very friendly and happy, excellent greetings from the second we drove on the property to the minute we left (at 5:30 in the morning!). The sand beach and pool was fabulous. The scenery is gorgeous. And the convenience of the shuttles and water taxis was hard to beat. The view was beautiful and we enjoyed movie night on the beach, although on our night it got moved to a grass patch. However, the staff brought towels and set it all up for us to lie on. We didn't really eat at the restaurants except the one by the pool. It was a great stay but very pricey. Being a Disney hotel you really are paying for the name and all that goes with it, and I will admit I expected perfection from our room for that money. Would I stay again? I think we would LOVE to but can we afford to? Not sure on that. It was a treat to stay this time but I don't think we could do it again. For the experience I would give it excellent! And I do miss being wished "a magical day".

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: claryqueen
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, especially at Christmas time. The rooms are huge, by Disney standard. We had 2 queen beds and a couch that was one of the most comfortable I've ever seen. I was tempted to sleep on it - except the beds were equally comfortable. Very clean. Great pool. But....It is a maze to navigate. To get to our room from the elevator, we had to turn at least 5 times. I had to write down directions to help me find my way back! Also, the restaurants and pool are not very convenient. This hotel shares the property with the Beach Club. If given the choice, I'll stay at the Beach Club next time. It's closer to the lion's share of restaurants, the pool, and Epcot.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: gopatsgo
Reviews.Content: We had an awesome time. Family of four, kids aged 6, 9. We had stayed the previous year at Animal Kingdon lodge and very much enjoyed it, but Yacht Club was simply a lot better. We stayed Club at both hotels and that was where the big difference. In Animal Kindgom we had to walk quite aways to get to Club Level, but in Yacht Club we were on same floor, so we got to enjoy it a lot more, and it was a great deal better. Staff was great, food was great, only regret was the steak house, had a good meal there, but was not worth two dining tickets.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved the Yacht Club!”
Reviews.Author: SugarMagnolia923
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Yacht Club the second week in May 2011. The resort is huge, the pool is awesome, everything is so neat and pretty and everyone was so friendly. The bus and boat transportation were great. We walked to Epcot and the Swan & Dolphin a few times. The location can't be beat. They had a campfire/marshmallows followed by a movie every night on the beach. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Disney Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jbirdsal
Reviews.Content: Perfect Disney stay. Yes, it is an over-priced, nickel and dime operation. That's Disney's business model. BUT (for Disney) you can't beat the location or quality of the Yacht and Beach club resort. Can you do better? Yes but outside of Disney. Otherwise, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The best of the best as long as you get a good deal...”
Reviews.Author: jpuso2001
Reviews.Content: Orbitz had a sale so we picked this resort. It was awesome for the price we paid. The only thing was the boat dock to take the water taxi was under construction and they did not let us know before we arrived. Otherwise the resort is fantastic. The sand bottom pool is something to see and feel on your feet. The kids just had the best time. Would stay there everytime...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, phenomenal pool, and very easy access to all parks!”
Reviews.Author: crusher328
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a vacation at Disney's Yacht Club Resort with my husband, 5 year old daughter, 3 year old son, and in-laws. The hotel was gorgeous- think old Cape Cod. The pool facilities may be the best on the entire Disney property with a lazy river, water slides, large pools, and sand-filtered zero entry beach-style pool. My children would have been happy to spend their vacation in the pool facilities. Most of the staff were very helpful and would go out of their way to assist (as is the case with most Disney employees). The Yacht Club shares facilities with Disney's Beach Club, so it is very easy to make restaurant reservations at either resort. I would highly recommend the Yachtman Steakhouse for dinner. The Yacht Club Resort is conveniently located in between Epcot, Disney Hollywood Studios, and the Boardwalk. It is a fairly easy walk to the Boardwalk and Epcot, a longer walk to Disney Hollywood Studios. Regular boat taxis are provided (about every 15 minutes) to all three locations. Transportation to Disney water parks, Magic Kingdom, Animal Kingdom, and Downtown Disney is also very easy via the regular Disney bus service which will pick you up directly outside of the hotel. Rooms were spacious and clean. We were given a complimentary upgrade to a room with a view and a balcony. I would highly recommend staying at Disney's Yacht Club Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Happy, Dopey and Grumpy”
Reviews.Author: janea8
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 6 day vacation to Disney World. This is our third visit to the Magic Kingdom and we chose the Yacht Club primarily because of its vicinity to Epcot and Hollywood Studios. We stayed on the concierge floor so we wouldn't have to worry about breakfast each day. The concierge floor is DEFINITELY worth the extra money. We arrived by Magical Express and were immediately greeted and taken upstairs to the 5th floor. We did not have to wait in any line to check in-especially nice after a long travel day. The concierge explained our floor and the club room here were snacks and wonderful appetizers and desserts available at different times of the day and unlimited drinks, coffee, tea, water, etc. Another plus was the cappucino machine in the club room. In addition, the staff in the club room was outstanding-they were friendly and very efficient-I would rate them excellent. Our room was very clean but didn't have enough shampoo/shower gel for 4 people. Our balcony overlooked a grassy courtyard and you could see the boardwalk. The vanity is outside the bathroom which was a plus and we had a refrigerator in our room. Now, the Dopey-the drain in our shower was broken and, eventhough we informed housekeeping, nothing was really done about it, my husband actually fixed it well enough for it to drain. Then, later on in the week, the toilet broke and started to flood the bathroom. Luckily my teenager was in the room and knew how to turn off the water so that the flow would stop. Maintenance did arrive immediately after being informed and fixed it. However, after that the toilet ran every 20 minutes or so for the rest of the week. Then, one of the sink drains stopped working and the closet door fell off the hinges. These are all little inconveniences but it may demonstrate that there is a bit of lack of maintenance in the Yacht Club rooms. Finally, the Grumpy- before I go on please note that I recognize this past week was very crowded and hot, BUT we are paying top dollar for the Disney experience and Grumpy should NOT be working there. The woman at the pool entrance was Grumpy. The first time we used the pool, we didn't have to show our room keys-this time, however, we did. She stopped us with a gruff "where are your ID's?" When we asked about this, she was almost nasty-you have to show it before 5. She was nasty to grown-ups and children alike. When I was leaving the pool area, there was another younger woman working who couldn't have been more pleasant. Maybe Grumpy was having a bad day-but she shouldn't have been taking it out on the guests. The pool was very crowded during the day and quiet in the evening hours. The "lazy river" was very slow-almost unmoving but the pool area had a sandy bottom, which was a nice touch. The kids liked the water slide, too. The pool is not Typhoon Lagoon, but it was fun for everyone. The lifeguards were all very pleasant and the hair wrap girl was wonderful. She told us in advance that she wouldn't have enought time fit in our daughter but she told us where to go on the Boardwalk. All in all, the Yacht Club wasn't the best we've stayed at, but it is a good location for being close to Epcot and Hollywood Studios. The Yacht Club Steakhouse is just so-so, the Fitness Center is very good and room service was terrific. So, it's okay, but not great. We won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Upscale Disney Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: Cmurf3
Reviews.Content: Recently spent a week with our daughters, ages 11 and 14, at the Yacht Club. The location is fantastic, as you can walk to Epcot, in around 10 minutes or even to Hollywood Studios, probably around 20 minutes. You can also take a boat to either, or to the Boardwalk area across the lake. The hotel is is elegant without being stuffy and the pool area is the best we've seen at Disney. If budget allows, I would recommend staying on the Club level. The concierge service on the floor is fantastic in helping with anything you need. They were able to change and make dinner reservations at a moment's notice. Also, the lounge is a really nice perk, offering a nice little happy hour between 5 and 7 where they serve hors d'oeuvres along with wine and beer. Pretty nice after a long day in the parks. The continental breakfast was good and allows you to get a start on the day bright and early. Overall, we had a great stay at the Yacht Club and there is no doubt that we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Sail to paradise”
Reviews.Author: disney-pals
Reviews.Content: Were to start this hotel is truly amazing..... Myself, husband and two children aged 16 and 11 travel to Disney yearly we love it we have stayed in this hotel twice once in december09 in a suit on club level which was out of this world and in October 2010 for Halloween. I booked this direct with Disney on my previous visit and got a 40% discount but even without the discount this hotel is worth every penny. We stayed in club level the room is clean housekeeping is excellent room in generous. the club level service is like no ther and everyone raves on it as being the best in Disney. In the morning the breakfast has everything from cereal to pastries fresh fruit tease coffees chocolate shake juice etc. In the afternoon they have sodas hand cooked chips and dip, jellies, fruit. And in the evening they have drinks and snacks between 5~7 with beer and wine and then later on they serve cookies, cakes, milk and brandy, disarono and baileys. But what I have discovered about the yacht is that if you would like a beer or glass of wine other than between 5=7 just ask and they will gladly serve you. The service at this hotel is second to none and you need to see it to believe it. To eat out on resort eat at yachtsman steakhouse first class make sure that you pre book in advance it is nice to book a 8pm table to enjoy and relax at the end of a long day. If I had to say one negative thing it would be that the hotel does not offer a fast food service only the bar by the pool but the adjoining hotel beach resort does and it is just next door. Another really good place to eat is beaches and cream the burgers are like the size of a side plate and are meant to be the juicyest in Disney. The pool at this hotel is out of this world and has good activities it also has a sand bottom. If you want to character dine the beach club has character breakfast. I can go on and on but it will take me forever. Please check out this hotel you won't regret it and you will never forget it. One ofThe best things about this hotel is location location is is A short walk from Epcot and Disney boardwalk it has excellent night life dance clubs sports bars and many places to eat the hotel even has it's own beach were you can watch a late night movie and watch illuminations reflection of earth. You can also walk to Hollywood studios or take a boat ride. I really must end my review otherwise I will just keep going.

Reviews.Title: “perfect place to stay in disney”
Reviews.Author: dphallett
Reviews.Content: we have stayed at other disney properties,but this is the best by far.as soon as you walk into the lobby you will know you have made the right decision to stay here.we were upgraded to a waterview room,overlooking the wedding gazebbo,with a view over the lake.disney rooms are very similar but this room was bright and airy.we loved the swimming pools they really are the best in disney.the location is great within walking distance of epcot,we found we spentmore time at epcot and loved it.we have stayed at the grand floridian but i would say this is better

Reviews.Title: “Be careful billing dept”
Reviews.Author: KMC60922
Reviews.Content: They claimed I did not check out and billed me for three more days.. They arranged my ground transportation back to the airport on the Magical express. It is amazing how much run around I am getting from the billing dept. ... I have never had this kind of trouble from any hotel, let alone one that claims to have the ultimate in customer experience.

Reviews.Title: “Disney Dining Club!!”
Reviews.Author: Zekebrenner
Reviews.Content: Just submitted my review of Portofino Bay @ Universal. Crucial to stay on site there in order to enjoy the parks. At Disney, not so much - except for the Dining Plan. That we loved! We took the "Deluxe" option which, if you skip breakfast of lunch, permits you to eat dinner, gratis,(except for the gratuity), at Disney's super-expensive restaurants. We were there for 3 nights, so we ate at the Flying Fish, the Yachtsman, and Jiko. So much food!!! After 3 days there we had to get out - we could not possibly eat anymore! Not sure if you can take the Dining Plan without staying on site. The lobby was very nice (the Animal Kingdom lodge was way nicer), the room itself was very tired, and in need of an update to justify the price they charge. The bathroom looked like it hadn't been updated, ever. Very convenient 5 minute walk to Epcot and Disney Boardwalk, which is a very pleasant place to hang at night. Chose this particular Disney hotel because of the pool, which is very large, and always had available chairs. Staff are, without exception, eerily friendly & solicitous, a la Stepford.

Reviews.Title: “Very Quiet, clean and good location”
Reviews.Author: Carencromom
Reviews.Content: I am so glad we chose the Yacht Club over the Beach Club for our stay at Disney. The difference between the two is stark: The Yacht Club was quiet and restful after long days walking at Disney parks. When we visited the Beach Club, it was always bustling and noisy, with lots of families with small children. I don't mind families, however, keep that in mind when looking at the two. The advantage the Beach Club has over the Yacht is that it is about 300 yards closer to Epcot than the Yacht Club, and it has a small grocery store in the Marketplace for the guests that stay in the Villas.

Reviews.Title: “They do everything just about right here”
Reviews.Author: MediaProf
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for a 4-day getaway in March, taking advantage of the Florida resident discount Disney offers. In this sense, we saved about 35% on the room rate. The resort is perfectly located in the area by the Swan, Dolphin, Boardwalk, and Beach Club resorts behind the Epcot World Showcase. An added bonus is that resort guests can enter Epcot through the "international gate" entrance located next to the France pavilion. The resort is framed around an 1880s Martha's Vineyard motif, so the guest is presented with a lot of sailing/upscale beach scene stylings. The guest rooms take this a bit too far (repetitive use of blues, pictures of ships, etc), but the common areas hit better notes. The staff is first-rate, and indicative of Disney service at its finest. Every single person we encountered at the Yacht Club was able to help with any request or question. The first night back we found a welcome gift of a white chocolate mickey mouse statue and four chocolate covered strawberries with artwork on theme, which was a nice touch. The bed was very comfortable, and the numerous pillows all fit the bill. Dual sinks in the bathroom was a plus, but the toilet/bathtub area, which was separated from the sinks by a door, was on the small side. The parking lot was gated with an attendant, who always checked IDs and greeted guests with "Welcome Home" every time we returned from wherever we had driven. Although some of the hotel could be read as kitschy, if you look just at room accommodations and service, this is quite a nice resort. It's probably not the best option for families with young children or budget travelers, but for adults traveling without kids and mature travelers who want to experience more than the theme parks, this is a pretty good way to go. If returning to Disneyworld, I would probably opt for the Yacht Club again.

Reviews.Title: “What's Up with the TV Channels?!?!”
Reviews.Author: SC_Globetrotter
Reviews.Content: The Disney Yacht Club is one of many resorts at the Disney World property. I stayed there three nights for a conference. Prior to arrival, you have the option of checking in on-line in advance, which made the actual check-in so much faster. As a guest of the property, the Magical Express is available to shuttle you to the hotel. The staff at the Yacht Club was very friendly. The room I had was nice, though the thoroughness of housekeeping was a little suspect. I noticed on my first day an empty water bottle in between the nightstand and the bed. That bottle was there the remainder of my stay. The pillows were thicker foam so it was a bit more on the uncomfortable side. One other nit is that the door/wall along the outer hallways aren't insulated well - I could hear people walking by all the time. I had lunch at the Captainâ€™s Grille â€“ the roasted turkey sandwich was hearty and delicious. The biggest issue I have with the Yacht Club, as my other colleagues did as well, was the television station offerings. Iâ€™m sure the resort is all about trying to keep you out of your room, but seriously, no standard channels?!?! It seemed like 99% of the stations were variations of Disney World offerings. So be forewarned that at the end of a long day traipsing around in the parks of sitting in conferences, you wonâ€™t have the joy of laying around in bed , surfing the channels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: fantasy_travels
Reviews.Content: My family of four ( 2 young children) stayed here in August 2010, we were originally suppose to stay at the Dolphin Resort for a conference, but upon arrival we weren't fond of the room so we switched over to the Disney Yacht Club. Room was nice, the best part was the location. A short boat ride to Hollywood Studios and a 5-10 minute walk to Epcot. The kids pool area was nice, they had smores in the evening on the beach which we went to 1 night, the kids enjoyed. A short walk over to the Boardwalk in the evening provided some entertainment. For close by dining we ate at the pool counter service, Captains Grille, Beaches and Cream Soda Shop, all were good. We also ate at the Boardwalk's Big River Grille, which I wouldn't recommend. We've also stayed at the Polynesian, and Contemporary hotels. Our favorites were the Yacht Club and Contemporary (close to Magic Kingdom). They are both great locations, we did like the room at the Contemporary a little more. The housekeeping didn't do very much at all with the xtra disney touches at the Yacht Club, whereas at the Contemporary we were surprised every day with all the towel designs.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: MaryK_11
Reviews.Content: We loved the Yacht Club. Only stayed 3 days, but would have loved to stay longer. Clean and well maintained grounds. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Five reasons”
Reviews.Author: piteryunior
Reviews.Content: Five reasons to stay here : 1 ) best location Epcot on foot only 10 min Holl.Studio 20 min by boat other parks 20- 25 min by bus -reserved and free bus 2 ) elegant resort 3 ) excellent sleep quality if you are tired after visit parks - quite and silence room 4 ) excellent Restaurants - try the steakhouse ! 5 ) white sand on the beach if you like to stop your ride in the parks . There are no others resorts with these 5 points .

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel...would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: seattle27
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely gorgeous. Perfect location and beautiful view of the bay. The pool is outstanding. Lovely architecture. Our room faced the water and I could see where staying in a room facing the parking lot would not be as nice an experience. I could have stayed on the balcony looking at the water all day!

Reviews.Title: “Ah the memories”
Reviews.Author: homebody12
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel 9 times!! Can you believe it. I will never forget years of great fun with my daughter. Always wonderful. Can't wait to take the grandchildren BTW This is THE pool at Disney world

Reviews.Title: “Never disappoints”
Reviews.Author: frefutravelor
Reviews.Content: 5th year in row visiting the Yacht Club. Stayed on Conceirge level. My family loves this hotel and staying on this floor. The food served in morning is quick and easy and the snacks through out the day are nice to grab and take to pool. The before dinner appetisers along with wine and beer are a nice way to relax before going to dinner. There is nothing special about the rooms, ours was neat and clean but for the money do not expect a 5 star hotel, it's Disney! All of the staff from the shops to check in and pool are polite and always greet you with a smile. The pool is very large and usually short on lounges, mainly because guest do not remove their towels from their chairs when they leave so you cannot tell if lounge chair is empty. I guess some people forget their not the only ones using the pool. There is also a quiet pool and spa by the tennis courts which is a nice change. Having the ability to walk to Epcot, boat to MGM and walk the boardwalk only make this hotel a top choice. We look forward to our next trip to the Yacht Club.

Reviews.Title: “a brilliant holiday”
Reviews.Author: janandstew
Reviews.Content: this was our first time at the yacht club a fantastic hotel with friendly and helpful staff. We had a lovely room with a lake view the room was spottlessly clean with plenty of towels and toiletries .the breakfast taken off the lobby was just what we wanted ,toast and coffee and Wendy was lovely.The small bar was great for a nightcap Diane was very friendly and soon remembered our order.The concierge desk was great all our queries answered and dining reservations made for us .Unfortunately i took a fall and had to go to hospital.Emma sorted things out and sent me by car and brought me back again. A lovely suprise in our room when we returned was a white chocolate minnie mouse and strawberries covered in chocolate and a getwell card a lovely thought. Scott was extremely helpful and concerned throughout our visit.The transport system was great we did not have to wait long at all.Our only problem was the horns on the friendship boats !! Great location no need for a car hope to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “The atmosphere was wonderful but don't plan to hang out in the room.”
Reviews.Author: Lori024
Reviews.Content: The hotel is convenient to Epcot and Hollywood Studios. It has a great pool area that my children (ages 10, 8 and 2) loved. They loved hanging out at the pool more than going to the Disney parks. I am very picky when it comes to rooms. I liked that our room had lots of storage and a refrigerator, but was disappointed that there was no microwave. The room was spotless but I thought it had a weird smell. My husband suspects the smell came from their cleaning products. The bed was comfortable but there was no seating area facing the TV. So the room was great for sleep but not comfortable to hang out in. It reminded me alot of the Boardwalk Inn (we stayed there a year ago). The Boardwalk has more character and more shops--so the Yacht Club was like a scaled down version of that resort.

Reviews.Title: “Best location at Disney”
Reviews.Author: FreidaMn
Reviews.Content: We spent the week between Christmas and New Years at Disney. We knew it would be the busiest time of the year so we wanted to stay someplace close to our favorite parks, so we chose the Yacht club, and it was a great choice! Being able to walk to Epcot and hop a boat to the Studios was very convenient (the boats came by often). We only needed to take the bus to MK and AK. They say the key to a successful park visit is to get there before opening, and they are right! But since we were in line at the gate drop we were able to go on every ride that we wanted to by lunchtime in every park we visited. We even road Everest 3 times in a row without a wait! It probably helped that the temps were below normal, keeping some guests home until later. Even so, the parks reached capacity by the afternoon, and fastpasses were all handed out within the first couple of hours. It was great to be able to retreat from the parks when they got so congested and return to our hotel to relax and swim. Even though it was cool out my kids still spent hours each day in the pool! Stormalong bay is great, so much variety in one pool! Water volleyball, slide, lazy river, hot tubs, and so many little turns that made almost private pool areas! At night we would stroll back to Epcot to eat at one of their many fun restaurants, one of the best reasons for staying at the Yacht Club. Our view was sideways towards the pool and lake, and we had a great view of Epcot's nightly fireworks! I love the Yacht club for having so many balcony rooms compared to the Beach club. I also liked that we were able to get connecting rooms. The service is outstanding, as you would expect at Disney! My son was participating that week in a baseball tournament at ESPN's Wide World of Sports on site, what a beautiful facility!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised-Would return”
Reviews.Author: Lisa17Provincetown
Reviews.Content: I very much wanted to give this Hotel a 5 but thought carefully about other potential visitors who will read this review. Our experience was overall wonderful and unless I could be shown another better Resort in Disney with a comparable price We would definitely return here. All the staff were courteous and helpful and knowledgeable, sure what happened with other reviewers. We were attended to quickly and always with a smile. The Resort itself was beautiful and CLEAN. The pool was a dream! The gym and sauna, up to date and clean. Our room overlooked the bay and yes the boats honk but it didn't bother us. We got up and got out. I found them charming. If you like to nap, that might be a problem. The room was a very nice size and very clean.The paint seemed fresh, no dust. The carpet seemed newer as did the linens and the bed was comfortable. Plenty of towels, nice TV and a coffee maker. The only issue for me was the bathroom and hardware around were pretty dated. This would not keep me from returning but it really could use some sprucing up. If you are a light sleeper bring white noise( you can download it on your iphone). You can hear passer bys in the hallway pretty easily and our room was next door to a couple with a baby. baby's cry and this one did of course just when I was nodding out. White noise did the trick. Not a complaint, but another night and I might have asked to change our room. A REAL COMPLAINT: When we made our reservation we asked if WI FI was available in our room. yes was the answer and i never thought to ask if it was free!! It's $9.99 per day in your room and another $9.99 if you want it in the lobby or pool area. This is just ridiculous!! Ask at the front desk and they all drop their heads and apologize. I am sure this is a huge complaint at these rates! Well I still would return, My Iphone worked just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, quiet, out of the way, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: mtl4059
Reviews.Content: As a couple we enjoyed the setting, not a lot of kids or hustle and bustle one can experience at the other Disney properties. A little out of the way, but free shuttles are available. The room was great, service was with a smile. But, we had a shared balcony room facing the parking lot...no atmosphere...and all for $340 a night. My biggest complaint, having to pay for the internet, $10 in room and then another $10 for wi fi on the porch or pool area. For a couple who desire to be in an out of the mainstream area of Disney, the Yacht Club is nice; but this place just seems like a money trap to me.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Ever - Dreams Can Come True. Loved It !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: greenbean18
Reviews.Content: We have been to disney twice before this was our first time to this hotel. This hotel was amazing!!! There is NOTHING negative about this hotel, from the nicest staff to the beauitful rooms . Perfect location so easy to walk to Epcot or the broadwalk, eveything is on hand and easy to get to. We stayed for 2 weeks, on the first day both my daughters lost their lanyards and pins on a ride, they were upset and on our return from the magic kingdom a member staff greeted us his name was John, upon hearing this news he went to try and locate he missing lanyards and pins. He was unable to locate them but arranged for housekeeping to leave new landyards on my daughters pillows which was soooo lovely, he also arranged for a credit to be applied to or room in order that my daughters to have new pins. This gesture was so unexpected but very appreciated it was definatly one of the nicest things we have experienced. All the staff were very friendly and helpful, and were more than happy to answer any questions . This was the first time we opted for the dining plan and I would recommend anyone to take it you cant lose!!!! This was a perfect holiday and we didn want to come home, already saving for a reurn visit.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant enough, but for water-view rooms boat horns honk all day.”
Reviews.Author: TwoFourTheRoad
Reviews.Content: The Yacht Club is a perfectly pleasant Disney resort. The staff is cheerful and they try to accommodate your requests as best as they can, although on occasion their help is rather limited. Our room was clean. Daily housekeeping was good. We had a coffee maker with acceptable free coffee, a fridge, & ice machine down the hall. Shuttle service to the parks and airport was timely. The location seemed convenient, but I think that I would try one of the monorail-adjacent hotels next time (not sure if they are more convenient, but they seemed like they were). The restaurants were all good, both at the hotel and inside Epcot (which is a short stroll away). The problems that we experienced stemmed from the fact that the Disney system is so big. They automate everything for efficiency, which is, for the most part, appreciated, but when you do have a need/problem, it's hit or miss on how and when you'll get a solution. No one seems to be bothered by the boat horns that blast all day, from an hour before the parks open to and hour after they close, but we were. I suppose most families are in the parks all day. We went to Disney World to run in the Half and full Marathons, so we spent the first 3 days of our stay trying to rest and get to sleep very early (for a 3am wake-up on both Saturday and Sunday). Imagine if someone pulled into your home's driveway and honked their car horn three long times, every three or so minutes -- that's exactly what it sounded like from 8am to 10pm. We requested another room, but the front desk can't move you. You must go through the central reservations phone bank and they do not know which rooms face the water (boat horns) and which do not. So after being shown two rooms which were both equally noisy to our room, we gave up and stayed put. But one of the operators that we had spoken to (because of the system, we were unable to speak directly to her again, we could only talk with whoever answered the reservations phone), spent the next two days canceling our room keys (each day) and we had to have new cards made twice (a 20 minute ordeal each time). The front desk tried to help, they couldn't understand why this person was canceling our room cards daily, and the manager had to get involved because they became unable to make new room cards after the second time. Mind you, your room card is also your park entrance card, so we got stuck once at the the park's guest relations. By our third day there, it seemed to be settled. The concierge is hit/miss. We mostly needed Marathon-related information and some of the staff had it, and some of the staff were really misinformed. I could hear other people getting information that was totally different than the info I had just received (regarding shuttle times, road closures, getting to other parks during the race, etc.) Our room's clock radio displayed the wrong time and the first time we called Operations no one could tell us how to set it. But then we called back the next day and the person on the phone was able to walk us through it, no problem. (You have to unscrew a protector plate on the back to access the controls.) The wake-up call function on the phone did not work. No matter what time we entered, it tried to confirm 1:05 as our wake up time. So we just called the front desk and requested a wake up call, and that worked fine. We needed to use the internet for a quick work-related issue. But the modem in our room wasn't working. For service, you call the central system and they have to send out someone to fix the problem -- they gave us a 3-hour window (so much for 'quick') and no one ever showed up. It wasn't that important to us, but was on par with our previous experiences. So all-in-all, the major things like convenience, comfy bed and clean sheets were good. The little things that weren't right were annoying but forget-able. We had a great time in Disney World and at the Marathon, but I probably will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great stay but a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: bobbyrs
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed at the Yacht Club for two nights during our recent fortnight in Florida. We usually stay in a villa but thought we would try a Disney hotel for my b'day. This is an excellent hotel and i couldn't fault the rooms, the service or the staff at all. The pool complex is top notch and if you had kids the location couldn't be better. My only slight gripe is that it is so expensive. You would get much more for your money in any other city in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for Epcot and an incomparable pool area”
Reviews.Author: LesleyMeg
Reviews.Content: The moment we arrived at the hotel, tired and weary, we knew that we would like our stay here, and we did. We were greeted by a white haired twinkly-eyed parking attendant who told us "welcome home" and that felt nice. Very Disney. The reception staff are all very helpful and friendly. The lobby exudes a clubby atmosphere, with a globe, polished floors and wood panelling. It's all a bit artificial and Disney, though. Our room was superb, we had a sort of side view of the lake, but this meant we could see all the fireworks at Epcot every night. Location wise, you can get to Epcot really easily by walking maybe five minutes to the side gate. There are boats that take you both to Epcot and Hollywood Studios. The boats get packed at night with weary guests trying to get back, so often we walked from Hollywood Studios, along the canal (Disney- made) about a mile or so. There are also buses that take you to the other parks and Downtown Disney, but it is really difficult to visit any other resort hotels, other than your neighbours the Swan and Dolphin.We booked dinner at the Grand Floridian via the Magic Kingdom and never made it, due to the crowds and crowds of people waiting in lines for any transportation. We did manage to walk over to the Contemporary Resort for dinner on the off chance and it was amazing, with views over the Magic Kingdom. You will never, ever get a table at the Contemporary Resort, but you can get a table at the bar if you wait - first come first served.You will find it difficult to find a table at the Yacht Club, too. There are two restaurants, a lounge bar and "Beaches and Cream" which sells burgers and milk shakes, and was full to bursting every day we were there. Forty minutes, twenty minutes wait if you are lucky. And guess what? Empty tables when you finally get into the restaurant. An elderly rosy-cheeked lady will lead you to your table, and then you get your "server". I think they are keeping people waiting in order to accommodate the staff! I got sick to death of carrying a pager every night to tell me my table was ready....... Other than this minor irritation, I thought the Yacht Club was a great hotel, and if you have kids who love to swim, then this is the place for you. The pool at the Yacht and Beach Club is wonderful. There is a lighthouse, a windmill, and a shipwreck, which is really a huge long slide back into the pool. It's amazing.One word of warning- although there are lots of lifeguards on duty, there is an area of the pool that reaches over 8 feet in depth so watch this if you have less than capable swimmers in the group. Disney through and through, expensive, good service, and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: GEMWpg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Yacht Club for 5 nights as part of a 9 night trip (other 4 nights at Disney's Caribbean Beach Resort) and overall it was a nice stay at the hotel. We are a family of 4 (kids 4 and 2). We have stayed at Pop Century, Port Orleans â€“ French Quarter and off site in a town-house before. You do immediately notice the difference between a Disney moderate and a deluxe. Upon entering our room our 4 year informed us we needed to take our shoes off so he obviously figured out there was something a little more special about the room at the Yacht Club versus the Caribbean Beach. After our transfer the check in was smooth and the room was ready for us early â€“ we were there around 1 pm with normal check in around 3 pm. Bags transferred from a different resort arenâ€™t shipped until after 1 pm so the bags did not arrive at the hotel with us â€“ not a big deal but something to keep in mind. One thing we did find a bit like a money grab was that unlike Magical Express which will drop the bags in your room without you having to be there the bag service at the hotel required you to call to get the bags delivered and then a tip was expected. This isnâ€™t a big deal but it felt a bit contrived. The room was decorated nicely in a nautical theme with 2 queen beds (very comfortable), a desk and an arm chair with ottoman along with the dresser with the mini fridge and the tv. There was plenty of room for our family, luggage and 2 strollers. There was a lot more storage here than at the Caribbean Beach. The room also had a balcony which you canâ€™t get at a moderate. We had a room pretty close to the elevators and the ice machine and we rarely if ever heard any noise from outside the room. As others have said paying additional for internet seems ludicrous now a days. The lobby is gorgeous and the model train set up for the holiday season was quite nice. We didnâ€™t try any of the restaurants as we were on the quick serve plan but did try Hurricane Hannahâ€™s by the pool and the Marketplace at the Beach Club and they were good. Getting a quick serve meal from the Marketplace and heading over to the Solarium to sit and eat it was usually a relaxing way to have a meal. The Solarium at the Beach Club was also the alternate location for watching movies at night if it was too cold on the beach. On rainy and cold days they also had a Wii hooked up for the older kids and crafts for some of the younger kids. The pool area shared between the Yacht and the Beach Clubs is amazing. The sand bottomed pool for the kids was phenomenal â€“ if it had been warmer while we were there we would have spent most of our time there. Cast Members came out with pails to make sand castles with the kids one of the afternoons it was warm enough to swim. Being able to walk into Epcot is one of the major selling points for this hotel. Epcot is our favourite park and it was nice to just head out of the room and be in the park 10 minutes later after a short walk. We also walked to and from Hollywood Studios one day and it was a beautiful walk â€“ lovely setting walking beside the canal and brightly lit at night. I think if we were to come again with the kids we would stay at the Beach Club instead of the Yacht Club just out of convenience to the quick serve meal location but we couldnâ€™t recommend Yacht Club enough. It looks like our Disney trips just got a lot more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel but.....”
Reviews.Author: Agent_Andy
Reviews.Content: Disney's Yacht and beach club hotel was excellent from service to standard of accomodation. Luckly we were upgraded to a bigger room which was massive. The only bad point of the hotel was the car park and how far you had to walk from the Car to the rooms espically if you were based towards the back of the hotel. I feel the cost of the hotel for seven nights was a bit excessive I would not go back to this hotel for the cost reasons and would justify paying the same amount again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: bg013
Reviews.Content: My wife, children (17 & 13) and myself stayed at this resort from Dec 27, 2009 - Jan 2 2010. We were upgraded to the Yacht Club by Disney. Upon our arrival, we were met by the friendliest people on earth. Everyone had a smile on their faces and welcomed us home. Our rooms were cleaned every day and if we needed more towels, we had them within minutes. The resort is positioned perfectly between Epcot and Hollywood Studios (both within walking distance). My wife and myself have been to Disney World over 20 times and each time have stayed on Disney property. This resort outshines every other Disney resort. You also never know who you might run into while staying there. On our third day there, my wife and myself were in the shop in Beach Club and who was there? Celine Dion!! Ms. Dion was very friendly and spoke with my wife and hugged her like they were old friends. On the next day, we met Faith Hill!!

Reviews.Title: “disappointed after reading such great reviews”
Reviews.Author: stardust111
Reviews.Content: I was very excited for our trip to orlando since I had read such great reviews of the Yacht Club resort. It isnt that this is a bad hotel, but it isnt as great as I was hoping. First the Pros: 1. very friendly service 2. we had a good view from our room 3. very close to many of the attractions of disney (which we were not here to enjoy so I cannot give specifics) 4. free shuttle from aiport to hotel Cons: For a 4 diamond hotel, we had 1. peeling wallpaper in our room 2. Mold all along the door to our patio 3. water that never really got hot in the shower 4. several places to eat, but if you are vegetarian (as my husband and I both are) bring some food with you since options are very limited. The only real option I saw at any close place is a veggies wrap. 5. I suppose considering I was here for work, what irritated me the most was that you have to pay, not once, but twice for internet. You pay once ($10 a day) to use an cable connection in your room, and then you have to pay $10 again if you want to use the wireless in the lobby or by the pool. I guess maybe I am spoiled and have stayed at some rather nice hotels but if you are paying around $350 a night for a room internet should be included! If planes can offer free WiFi, why cant a resort?!

Reviews.Title: “Beauty and the Price”
Reviews.Author: Littleone88
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed in Disneyâ€™s Yacht Club in September 2010 and it was lovely but not worth the money. Room: We were very lucky because randomly we got a free upgrade, I think it just gave us a better view. We stayed in a balcony room looking over the bay and it was very nice. Plus, you could see the fireworks in Epcot from it which was lovely. The room was a very good size and loved the double sinks in the vanity area. Also the mini fridge was very useful as we kept our drinks cool! The bathroom was very small though and could only just open the door. Plus, every time you put the light on the fan/vent thing started and the noise was quite loud. Itâ€™s fine for using the bathroom but donâ€™t expect to have a relaxing bath at all! Hotel: The hotel is very well done and the pool is lovely especially as it has a sand bottom. There was also a lovely ice cream and cream soda shop but you couldnâ€™t take it away so bit pointless if youâ€™re by the pool. The location of the hotel was probably what you were paying for. Epcot is a 5-10 min walk and Disney Studios is a 10-15min boat ride away. Plus, the boardwalk is on your doorstep which is really nice but was disappointed about the lack of restaurants and bars on the boardwalk. I suppose itâ€™s all crammed into Downtown Disney. The staff at the hotel were very polite and helpful but all Disney staff are. Location: Canâ€™t fault the location at all with this hotel. As I said its right in the heart of Disney and the rest of Orlando has so much else to offer. International drive has brilliant restaurants such as the Don Pablos which on Wednesdays does fajitas for only $7 and my personal favourite Bahama Breeze which does amazing food and the cocktails are to die for. Plus, itâ€™s definitely worth going to Aquatica, best waterpark Iâ€™ve been to in my opinion. However, I was disappointed with Seaworld as there is very little to do and if you want to go on any rides you have to put your stuff in a locker for 25cents. Overall the hotel was lovely and I would stay there again but not at full price. Itâ€™s just too expensive for what you got. Would definitely go back to Disneyworld again as it is amazing and I would stay in a Disney hotel as you canâ€™t fault the service and having free parking is a nice perk. However, I would probably choose one of Disneyâ€™s cheaper hotels like a 3 or 4 star as the price might be more justified! Also as a tip, I found having a balcony one of the best things as in the evening you can sit and relax on it.

Reviews.Title: “5 STAR RESORT ,CASUAL , GREAT POOLS, VERY CLOSE TO EPCOT.”
Reviews.Author: hotelguide1950
Reviews.Content: My wife and i have stayed in every disney resort over the years , and this one is one of our new favorites , casual , really good restaurants , in this hotel ,the beach club, the boardwork , or swan/dolphin , and an easy walk to EPCOT , we took advantage of the disney florida resident rate , which was a bonus ,rooms were great and bigger than some other disney resorts , always up to there high standards ,all the pools are great especially the beach pool wth its shipwreck water slide ,really beautiful gardens , very nice places to just sit around and relax , my only reservation was when the staff at the hotel ticket counter said that there was no one day florida resident rate /AAA discount which was incorrect, but a very nice 3 day weekend , as always its the very friendly cast members that make the differance and they always do make it a wonderful experience

Reviews.Title: “Our new Disney favorite! Club level worth the extra cost”
Reviews.Author: schellgirl
Reviews.Content: We go to Disney about once a year and have stayed pretty much everywhere. We even stayed at the Yacht Club but that was 1996. I had forgotten what a charming, convenient hotel it is. We usually get two rooms (we have thee daughters) but managed with only one at the Yacht Club - two comfy queen beds and a daybed perfect for the 7 year old. We used the extra $ to stay on the concierge level. Wonderful "snacks" (one night it was pretty much dinner for us - excellent offering), great wine, excellent breakfast. The room had a lovely balcony and dvd player. Tons of activities. We had spent the first 3 days at the Portofino at Universal and were disappointed we had plans for most of the time we were at the Yacht Club (Halloween party) so we couldn't enjoy the movie on the beach. The girls tie dyed tshirts at the pool and had an excellent time. Walk to Epcot no problem. A huge bonus was being able to check our bags through to the airport at the hotel. They printed our boarding passes, checked us in and took all our bags even though we weren't using Disney transportation but going to lunch and then returning our car. I would highly recommend the Yacht Club. Beware, though, the room service pizza was about the most disgusting thing I've tasted in a while! I didn't find this hotel to be stuffy at all; after all - it's Disney. Awesome beach/pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Good luck has ruined all future trips to Disney”
Reviews.Author: newfieinthefalls
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in August to take advantage of the free dining promotion. For us (two adults and a six and nine year old) it seemed to be a great deal. We booked the Riverside and everything was going smoothly until we entered our room to discover that there was only one bed. When we went down to the front desk to get the room changed they informed us that they didn't have a room but they could send us to the Yacht Club instead. It was kind of funny, because my husband was so tired and ticked off at this point that he was actually annoyed. Neither of us knew what the Yacht club was like as it was our first time. WOW!!!!! The resort was gorgeous! Very plush. I felt very underdressed walking in. The staff was so helpful. My only moment of anxiety came when I went to get the room cards and the desk clerk showed me a $850 bill for the upgrade to deluxe. When I nearly choked she quickly realized that Riverside had sent us over and told me to ignore the bill. PHEW!!! Still, I think that made me realize what we had lucked into. The pool was absolutely stunning. It was huge and clean and well supervised. The pirate slide was a blast. I had a hard time convincing my kids and my husband that staying in the pool all day was not what we had come all this way to do. Being next to epcot was a huge bonus as most of the restaurants were there. There wasn't much selection for breakfast at the Yacht Club. Luckily we used the Garden Grocer for breakfast foods which worked out great. The room itself was beautiful and clean. It felt very large for the four of us. The mousekeeping did a great job (we tip daily, but I think they'd do a great job regardless). My husband was excited by the fact you could get a case of beer from the gas station HESS at Downtown Disney that wouldn't cost you an arm and a leg. A single beer costs about 5.00 in the hotel shop at the Club. We found this out from a very nice busdriver. The boardwalk was very cute and the boat to the various parks came in handy. The buses were very efficient and I can only remember one day that we actually didn't get a seat. My only complaint is that we are thinking about going back to disney in the future and I can't imagine staying anywhere else and not comparing it to the Yacht club. We have been spoilt rotten.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: benjsda
Reviews.Content: Myself, my wife and our two kids (12,5) stayed here in July 2010. We have the good fortune of being upgraded to Club Level. The rooms are no different but the "other" things are great. We also had the Disney Dining for the first time which I have to say was so good and handy. We ate quite a lot in Epcot with the Mexican and Canadian being our favourties as well as the Steak House in the Hotel. The Boardwalk is brilliant and the little bakery does the most diving sandwiches and salads. For the grown ups, if you get a moment go to Jelly Rolls (Dualing Pianos). Really good fun. This hotel really is as good as most other reviewers have said and whereas everyone is entitled to their own opinion I would suggest that those who didnt like it are just nit picking. Cant wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Fourth Time Here, Always been great, this time was a miss”
Reviews.Author: ddarchambault
Reviews.Content: We were very excited to be returning to Disney's Yacht and Beach Club Resort and brought family who were travelling here for the first time. Upon arrival to the resort we were informed that all of the other rooms in our party were ready but ours was not; we ended up waiting another hour and a half. We discussed this with the Regatta Club staff to no avail and decided to go down stairs to speak with one of the Managers. The service we received down stairs was perfect. The Manager made a phone call and within 5 minutes our room was ready and he ended up putting a credit on our room for the inconvenience. The house keeping staff always came into tidy up the room up and ensure there were enough towels and toileteries. Nice time of year to go; Epcot Food and Wine Festival. Weather was good and the pool was great; as usual. Regatta Club Staff missed the mark on this trip completely. Prior trips they were polite, attentive and helpful; not so on this trip.... Only answered your question, did not offer suggestions and at times were less than courteous. All in all, the trip was still nice. Would have been perfect if the Regatta Staff was on the ball and the room was ready on time. We will stay here again, as prior experiences led us to believe that this is not the norm and are hoping this was a fluke.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Resort in Disney World”
Reviews.Author: dallas75229
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here 5 times in the past 10 years and just got back from our most recent trip last night. The resort is still gorgeous. The location can't be beat -- we walked to Epcot for dinner every night (5 minute walk). The rooms are clean and the beds are extremely comfortable. I noticed in one of the guide books for Disney World that the only negative item listed is that the rooms are poorly insulated and are therefore loud -- we have NEVER experienced this and we've stayed in various locations in the hotel over the years. The staff is excellent. Oh, and the pool is gorgeous. When our daughter was little, she loved to dig in the clean, white sand. Now she loves to sit in the tube and float around the lazy river. The view of the lake and boardwalk are stunning. We wouldn't change a thing about this resort and will continue to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Couples Disney Vacation”
Reviews.Author: KristinAnnC
Reviews.Content: With the numerous options throughout the Disney parks, my husband and I were unsure where to stay when we visited Disney in May. Neither one of us had been to Disney since we were children over 20 years ago. I read numerous reviews on Tripadvisor, and i purchased a couple of travel books. After reading everything, we decided on the Yacht Club, and we were not disappointed with our decision. We loved the location next to Epcot, Hollywood Studios, and the Boardwalk. It was close to everything without being in the middle of everything. Also, we loved that the hotel was nice without being â€œstuffy. â€œ I expected the service to be very good, but in the back of my mind I did not want to be disappointed if something was off. The staff definitely exceeded my high expectations and was incredibly friendly throughout our stay. Our room was nice, and we had a wonderful view of the mini lake and Boardwalk. The pool was fabulous, and I loved the slide. The only downside to staying at the Yacht Club is the proximity to Magic Kingdom, which was not an issue for us since we only went there one day. We ate at a couple of the other resorts, and I am definitely glad that we picked the Yacht Club for our stay due to the charm and location. I definitely recommend this hotel for any couples unsure where to stay or families with older children. I cannot wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, lame amenities”
Reviews.Author: sjm1027
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 days. The room was great, the people working there were very nice... But... No free WiFi in the rooms is ridiculous for the price we paid. The other thing we had a problem was the toiled seat cover was loose, after leaving a $5.00 bill for the person cleaning the room we asked to have it fixed before I fell off. No answer the first day and then we asked in a note again, with an additional $5.00 bill the next morning and still nothing. I gave up and lived with it for 6 days I just chaled it up as our own private Disney Ride in our room. Still can't get over NO WIRELESS! I would recommend this hotel to others but would also tell them there is no Free Wireless.

Reviews.Title: “Yacht Club is great!”
Reviews.Author: frostyman99
Reviews.Content: we got a great deal on this hotel, the hotel was wonderful. The location was so close to epcot, I loved being able to walk there. The pool was also the best! I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disney's Yacht Club Resort is Disney's finest resort!”
Reviews.Author: Rayce333
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Yacht Club for the first time 9/30/10-10/9/10. We have always stayed at the Polynesian or Contemporary but wanted to try and EPCOT resort this trip. It was always the one EPCOT resort I dreamed of staying in. From check in to check out It exceeded all my expectations. The staff in every section of the resort that we encountered was friendly, helpful and just added to our happiness of being in Disney. We stayed in a Club Level room. The concierge staff as well as the lounge attendants and housekeepers on the Club Level are just wonderful. The room was large, immaculate and well laid out. The bedding was wonderful and comfy mattresses. I slept so good while we were there. Our balcony was a good size and looked out over the front of the hotel. The best part of Yacht Club has to be Stormalong Bay, their huge pool complex. My daughters (7 + 9 years) were in heaven! My husband enjoyed the sand bottom and lazy river section. The girls also enjoyed the movies on the beach at night. We dined at Cape May Cafe with the characters for breakfast at the connected Beach Club. It was a great meal. Also, we ate at Yachtman's Steakhouse for dinner. Food was incredible. Honestly, you can go to Disney's Yacht Club and never leave the resort and have a magical vacation. You don't even need to visit the parks!

Reviews.Title: “It's Disney - but it's old Disney”
Reviews.Author: JELLYBELLY02
Reviews.Content: This is an older "resort" that now markets itself as a timeshare. Went on a business trip. Nautical themed rooms. Rooms are small so I could not imagine staying there with a family. Food selections are limited on site. Boardwalk next door offers more variety and some take Disney dining plan. For the same money, you can get a newer hotel. Close to the Dolphin and the Swan and both have other dining options.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay... Above expectations.”
Reviews.Author: LuisMurano
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect. I wanted to stay at Grand Floridian but it was full so I ended up here. It is big but feels like those mid-sized charming hotels at seaside. It is silent, with less children running around than many other Disney hotels. Breakfast is delicious, but I would recommend trying also the Beach Club (walking distance) with a larger buffet and the enchanting presence of Disney characters. And the best of all: staying at the Boardwalk (Beach Club, Boardwalk Inn and Yatch Club) is priceless. You have lots of things to do if you are tired of daily theme parks "stress". To wrap up: I will for sure try to be back here again next yea

Reviews.Title: “Yacht Club Resort was terrific! Thanks Dream Makers!”
Reviews.Author: dmaslanka
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently celebrated our 30th Anniversary with a vacation at the Yacht Club resort at Walt Disney World in Orlando Florida. We read several recommendations for Dream Makers Vacation Services so we thought we would give them a try. Lynda Hower, our agent, was very easy to work with and helped us plan what turned out to be a great time at a wonderful resort hotel. The Yacht Club was a terrific all round resort. The pool was phenomenal! The staff at the hotel were pleasant and very helpful. The room was clean and we had a water view which was nice. It is located within walking distance of Epcot, the Boardwalk and Disney Hollywood Studios, very convenient. We would definitely stay here again. We would highly recommend Lynda Hower and Dream Makers to anyone planning a Disney World vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Excellent, Could Barely Fault It!”
Reviews.Author: Ghirardellis
Reviews.Content: I went to the Yacht Club with my wife and 3 children, aged 20, 17 and 14 from August 26th - September 10th. To start with, we were greeted at Orlando Internation Airport (MCO) by our Magical Express coach driver, who was extremely pleasant. Eventually, we arrived at the Yacht Club around 8.30PM, (after 3 previous stops on the coach, ALL were Value Resorts - i would expect deluxe to come first!). We were then greeted at the door by yet again another pleasant member of staff, whom greeted us by family name, which my daughter was amazed at! She assisted us over to the check in desk, where (yet again!) another very helpful member of staff checked us in, quickly, efficiently and helpfully. We were booked into a standard room (2 queen beds and day bed, standard view), but were upgraded TWICE OVER to Epcot Fireworks view! It was absolutely fantastic, we could view the lake and the boardwalk, and watched the Epcot Fireworks every day - all for free! All rooms come with a balcony, which is a great plus. We stayed on floor 4, and only one night did we have any trouble with a noisy family outside in the corridor, which was sorted out within minutes after i called reception. All the staff were SO helpful, they NEVER said no, and ALWAYS said "Good Morning" as you left and "Good Afternoon and Welcome Home" when we returned, along with a glass of iced water (free, of course!). Throughout our stay, we went to every restaurant, all could not be faulted - Yachtsmans Steakhouse was SUPERB! And the buffet breakfast at Captains Grille was a great find, there was so much variety! I would definitely prefer Yacht Club to Beach Club, the place generally feels quieter and more relaxed - probably because younger children tend to stay at the Beach Club. Also, the shared pool (Stormalong Bay), was absolutely fantastic! The sand bottom, with the lazy river style pool, and a waterslide - all great! What is also very good about the hotel is that it has that 'Disney Touch' but isn't overpowering as some could be - especially if you have teenagers! We sat in an evening on the Yacht Club private beach, looked over the lake and watched the fireworks while listening to the 'easy-listening' style music they play over outside speakers. Negatives about the hotel: (which really are little things, it's hard to find negatives!) Wireless internet is none-existant, and the wired internet is $10 for 24hours. The pool can get quite crowded, we tended to go to the 'quiet pool' instead. We had one disturbed night with one loud family (which was sorted out straight away) Finally, the proximity to Epcot, Boardwalk, Hollywood Studios and other resorts (Such as the Dolphin and Swan) make the journeys so easy! A boat or walk to Epcot, a boat to Hollywood Studios (all boats leave literally at the back door of the hotel), and easy bus journeys to the other areas" I will DEFINITELY go to the hotel again, and would recommend it to couples, families with teenagers/older couples, but younger children might want the slightly more fun and energetic atmosphere of the Beach Club.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families that don't want Disney overload.”
Reviews.Author: Kelly L
Reviews.Content: My sister and I flew down with our kids(5 kids-8-21yrs) in mid- August. TOOO HOT !! But our hotel was fabulous. The location was excellent. Less than 10 minute walk to Epcot. Disney has a great transportation system .From the hotel you can easily get to Hollywood Studios by boat, however it's about a 15-20 minute boat ride because it stops along the way at The Swan and Dolphin. Buses at their front entrance take you everywhere else. We loved the large sand-bottomed pool. Big enough that you're not on top of ecah other. Beautifully landscaped and a bar/grill at poolside. There's a large Pirate ship slide that was pretty cool and it was a nice relief from the hot sun. Unfortunately, the water was also pretty warm so it was wet, but not refreshing. The resort also had a white sand beach , but no one really went on there as they didn't recommend swimming in that water. We had bought the counter service food plan ( which I don't recommend-too inconvenient , too limiting and too much food) and the only place in our hotel to use this was the pool grill and a small cafe area in the morning in our lobby . Otherwise you would have to go to the adjoining hotel (Beachclub) to get food there. It doesn't sound like a problem but in fact it is quite a long trek there and back. It is a very large spread out hotel. There were character breakfasts but we didn't do that ( our kids were older) We originally had a room facing the forest ( standard room with the package) but on the second day, there was a problem with my sister's sink ( we had connecting rooms)and we asked to be moved (together) and they gave us both VERY nice rooms with balconies facing the lighthouse! It was really pretty at night with all the lights looking across at the Boardwalk. I sat on my balcony one night and watched a thunderstorm pass through. This hotel was just right, less younger kids than other hotels I'm sure since it has a more mature theme and the type I would return to even as a couple.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a few exceptions”
Reviews.Author: TLuntsford
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to have been a member of the Team in Training for the Leukemia Society who participated in the Disney Wine & Dine Half Marathon on October 2. They placed our group in the Disney Yacht Club for the weekend of the event. Had it not been for this, we would have probably never stayed at this resort seeing the prices START at $350.00 per night. For $350 per night I would expect free Wi-Fi, turn down service with a little mint on the pillow and a few other perks. None to be had. However, if you like to spend this much on a hotel, the hotel was extremely nice. The rooms were spacious and decorated perfectly for the theme of the hotel, The linens on the bed were extremely nice and I have considered even ordering some of the blankets as they do have a catalog in the room where you can order them. The beds were however a little hard for my liking so had trouble sleeping. Each bed had about 6 pillows on them so no shortage of pillows that is for sure. We were on the bottom floor and had a patio that was very secluded as they had high shrubbery planted in front of the patio. Shrubbery blocked your view of anything, however it was a nice place to sit and relax. Had a very nice flat screen TV however unless you wanted to watch Disney channels with the kids or about 5 stations with "commercials" about the various disney theme parks, not much too choose to watch. Normally not a big deal since when I am on vacation I dont spend that much time in my room. However, with this weekend's travel I was planning on simply laying around and resting all day until the big running event, and I was stuck watching very limited channels. Although they had Wi-Fi access in your rooms, you had to pay for it which I thought was utterly ridiculous. On the way to Florida we actually stayed in a LaQuinta in for a one night stay over and the rooms were only like $50.00 which included a very soft bed and FREE Wi-Fi. Why can't Disney supply Wi-Fi for free at a hotel that charges $350 per night?? This hotel is VERY LARGE and spread out so make sure you have your walking shoes. Just to get from our room to the front desk was a major walk. Then the restaurants were all clear at the other end of the hotel as well. They do provide transportation right in front of the lobby by bus to all Disney Parks. Very nice and large pool area with several lifeguards on duty. They have a "beachfront area" but you cannot swim in the water. Just for laying out in the sun or area for children to play in the sand. Overall, a very nice hotel, but for the price, I would expect a few more attention to details.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn has Disney Beat!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: FisherKingTampa
Reviews.Content: This last weekend I was involved in the Disney Wine & Dine Half Marathon Weekend (Oct. 1-2, 2010) , as a doctor friend ran in my honor. (http://thedisneyblog.com/2010/03/04/disneys-princess-12-marathon-returns/). My girl friend and I reserved a room at the Disney Yacht Club Resort to cheer on Dr Scott Stafford in his marathon run. Issues I had with Disney: 1. They will not carry any of Fox News, neither national of local on any of their TV programming. I ask management staffing and they told me the decisions at the corporate level. On the channel selection they show two FOX channels that carry nothing but infomercials. They do carry NBC, ABC, CBS, CNN, and a few I do not remember. I sorry, but this [--] me off. Especially since, I know that FOX carries commercials for Disney. Why? Think about this, you book a week with this place and when you check in you find out you have no chance to watch FOX, unless you want to pay for internet serve. I will never stay on a Disney Property again. I am appalled that FOX carries commercials for Disney. What say you? 2. Lock on door did not work. Not a bad problem until you check in at midnight and they put you in room 3049, with is a long way from the front desk. Two trips back and forth is a bit much. 3. Nasty trash in the ice bucket. 4. Phone not working in the bathroom. 5. Two light bulbs that did not work. 6. NO digital TV programing. 7. TV programing is very limited. 8. At home I set my thermastat at 78 degrees, Disney you have to guess that the settings is between low-high. 9. At $350.00 a night, I exspect them to turn down the room... not at Disney. 10. Food is geared to children, I understand that, I also know adults need to eat with the children. All od this may seem petty, but when you pay this much, you should exspect more, so save your money and stay at a cheaper hotel, you will enjoy your vacation as much.

Reviews.Title: “Ehhh...hmmm...”
Reviews.Author: INDIGOANDIRIS
Reviews.Content: Interesting vibe here. Disney definitely knows the demographic to whom to market this location. It is not for everyone. It feels like antebellum Charleston or Hilton Head. It's not for kids or for families that want that diversity and global feel. It is pretty, great pool, but uppity...stuffy. My very "colorful" family never felt comfortable or quite welcome. It was really the staff, but the clientele in general seemed to be there to avoid the rest of the population. All the decorum is very plantation style. We breathed a sigh of relief when we finally took the boat across the lake to the Boardwalk. This was much more festive and welcoming. We should have stayed there or returned to the Disney Contemporary. Finally, PLEAASSE Disney update this costumes that the staff wears. The sailor outfits for the men and the deep south maid uniforms for the housecleaning staff is just plain embarrassing and demeaning. If I had to dress like that every day and face the public... I just couldn't. Not for any amount of money ... I know the male staff in the daffy duck uniforms cannot have any girlfriends. Thanks anyway for the effort. I know the intent is to create magic and guests to another time. Unfortunately, it transports some guests to a time that wasn't so great...

Reviews.Title: “No wifi, internet 9.99 per day, limited tv channels.”
Reviews.Author: happypessimist
Reviews.Content: Nice place otherwise. Best for couples on a getaway. I did not see a lot of little kids...which was great!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASMIC”
Reviews.Author: davidHullUk
Reviews.Content: we have stayed at a few disney hotels over the years the grand floridian + beach club been at the top of our list but after staying at the yacht club we would not stay anywhere else we had a water veiw room and what a veiw it was lovely we could see right across the lake to the boardwalk,the room was lovely large and bright and clean ,it has the best pool of any hotel we have ever stayed in it is fab the children dont want to get out . you must go to beaches and cream the icecreams are wonderful .the staff are there for your every whim this hotel and facilities are wonderful cant wait to return

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS TIME WAS HAD BY ALL!”
Reviews.Author: LongIslandMommy042
