Reviews.Content: Let's be real, the Disney machine is unrivalled by any other! If you can book the trip with a 10 day notice, you'll save yourself about $150 in airport taxi transfers to and from the hotel (granted, once you're on the coach, you might end up with a couple of five year olds shrieking with delight as the movie plays and you start seeing signs of The Mouse, but what the hell . . . you can an understand their delight). From the moment you alight, to the moment you arrive at your room, the experience is truly magical. You'll arrive empty-handed, and your cases will automatically be delivered to your room. Everyone who greeted us was cheerful and helpful. We were unexpectedly upgraded to a water view room and it was really a fabulous view of the bay and the boats coming and going. There was a slightly odd odor in the room, which we attributed to the Florida humidity, but the room very large, with two queen beds, spotless, and very comfortable. One morning the cleaning service forgot to replenish the toiletries and when we called down to ask for more, someone from housekeeping was up in 10 minutes with aplogies and handfuls of shampoo and body gel. The only minor complaint we had was that if you are sitting on the toilet, you cannot close the door without having to get up as the door swings within a half inch of the bowl - of course the adults understood that, but the kids sometimes forgot . . . It was minutes away by boat to Epcot and Hollywood Studios, and maybe a 15 minute ride by coach to the Magic Kingdom and all of the transportation seems to run quite frequently (the ferries and buses are compliments of Disney). Also, if you choose to stay at the hotel. it has one of the best pool complexes. If I remember correctly, there were about 3 different pools, all heated, including a "lazy river" which you float down (either rent an inner tube or a noodle at the pool shop - inner tubes run about $3 per hour per person), as well as a shipwrecked vessel that the kids climb up to an then slide down a tunnel to the pool (my husband even did it and said it was fun!) We took a Mears cab (they're often stationed at the hotels) to Sea World and it cost about $25 each way. Personally, now that we've been to Sea World once, I don't think we'll be going back there any time soon again (it's no Disney experience - lets just leave it at that!) Although there are less expensive options if you head over to the boardwalk, or eat at the hotel's snack bar area that has pastries and coffee, for convenience sake we ate at the Captain's Grille and for a breakfast it was satisfactory. We have two children with food allergies and the chefs at all of the restaurants we ate at, went above and beyond to accommodate not only their allergies, but their preferences. If you are travelling with someone with food allergies and have restaurant reservations made, you can fax in an allergy sheet with your reservation numbers and food preferences and they will be waiting for you. One of my children can never have anything other than fruit or sorbet - if he's lucky - due to a dairy allergy. Citrico's (in the Grand Floridian) went out of their way to have a chocolate dessert prepared with soy icecream, and Jiko (at the Wilderness Lodge) also had something ready for him. On our last night, we turned up without a reservation at the Flying Fish Cafe (over on the boardwalk) and the Chef came to the table to go over the menu items personally. All of these restaurants were a bit on the expensive side, but totally worthwhile since the quality and presentation of the food were really top-notch with service to match. Wished we could have stayed longer, but alas it was time to go back to school. Plan to return again when we can.

Reviews.Title: “Best Disney club level staff”
Reviews.Author: skeeziks
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at many of the deluxe Disney resorts and have enjoyed them all. They are all nicely themed, comfortable, clean, and friendly. Since there are already so many helpful and detailed reviews , I'll stick with pointing out what the Yacht Club does better than the others. The Yacht Club has the nicest, friendliest, and most helpful club level staff...by far. We really enjoyed all aspects of the Yacht Club. But, when I think of the resort, it is the club staff that sticks out in my mind. They are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Cant say enough about the Yacht Club Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: LANewYork
Reviews.Content: Just back,traveled August 27th-Sept 1st. We are a family of 4 (boys 8 and 14). Have always wanted to stay here but the usual time we go is spring break and prices are too high. Never went this time of year before and was stressing about the weather We will never go at any other time again,weather was fine crowds were very low and the hotel is amazing! Upon check in we were notified that we were the "family of the day",given a warm welcome balloons and an upgrade to club-level. Room was on 5th floor accessed with a special room key. Bed was comfortable,room was clean had everything we needed. Club lounge was nice opened from 7AM-10 PM. Various snacks ,drinks throughout the day . We had the meal plan but used the lounge for the breakfast and wine/beer in the evenings. Kids loved just stopping in and grabbing a cookie and a soda. The pool is amazing ate at Hurricaine Hannas for lunch (next to pool) good choices for food. The convenience cant be beat 5 minute walk to Epcot,short boat ride to Studios. You can also explore the Boardwalk area which is a 5 minute walk across the lagoon. It gives you so any more options for food. The staff at the hotel was amazing,we never came in contact with anyone that was not pleasant and smiling. I forgot to pack underwear for my 8 year old and had asked the Concierge desk on club-level about where to buy them. They offered to send someone out to get them for me! I did find them in a gift shop. I think now we have been spoiled by our stay at the Yacht Club,even without the club-level service it is a great place. We have always stayed on site ,but this by far was our best trip to Disney,really dont know how they can improve upon it . It was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Disney experience”
Reviews.Author: icatalina97
Reviews.Content: Rooms clean, nice decor throughout, great Disney service. Kids loved the pool and game room. It is an easy walk to Epcot and Boardwalk, water taxis also offer service to both and Hollywood Studios. Had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel shame about the eateries”
Reviews.Author: jimd1768
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Yacht club for our last week of a 3 week trip in the US. We loved the hotel. The room was spacious and well kept. Housekeeping, except for 1 day, was of the highest order. The staff in the hotel were extremely helpful at all times. The pool is the crowning glory. I think it is the best pool on disney property. I have 1 drawback. If I want a quick snack, say a burger or hotdog or wrap, I would like to go to a counter and get quick service. There was none of this in the Yacht club. There was a small counter service, and I mean small, in the shop in the Beach club. Everywhere else was table service. We came in from the pool one day to grab lunch. Beaches and Cream was a 45 minute. The captains grille was a 15 minute wait. We were told that the delay was because tables were being cleared. When we got in, this was not the case as there were dozens of empty tables and few customers. Although the food was ok, I don't want the formality of a menu and waiting for drinks to be refilled and getting the wrong food in my order. After all that said, I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. A short walk to Epcot and a boat ride to Hollywood Studios are 2 of the draws of the hotel. The setting is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Magical!”
Reviews.Author: flossandmimi
Reviews.Content: After several disney holidays staying off site, this hotel was the first disney resort we had tried. It far exceeded our expectations. Our rooms were huge, staff were really helpful and the location was perfect and allowed us to do more rides in a week than we usually do in two. The food at Captains Grill was great and being walking distance to Epcot and Boardwalk gave us other great dining options

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful! Love the Yacht Club!”
Reviews.Author: caleighsma
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here from July 31-Aug 4. It was our first time at a Disney Epcot resort. We loved it! The room was beautiful, the sand bottom pool is awesome. My daughter wanted to stay in the pools instead of going to the theme parks! We didn't get the dining plan and ended up paying a lot of money out of pocket. If you are going to be doing a lot of sit down table service dining I recommend getting a dining plan. The only draw back, like many have said, is there is not a quick counter service dining option here. There is the Beach Club Marketplace, but that is at the Yacht Club's sister hotel, the Beach Club. The walk isn't that far between the two, but it is definitely more than just a 2 minute quick trip to get something to eat. The Yacht Club has a great gift shop, much nicer than the Beach Club's gift shop in my opinion. We ordered room service for breakfast twice and once for dinner. It was pretty good, nothing terrific since I can't remember what we ordered, so it didn't make that much of an impression. We also ate at Beaches and Cream ice cream palor at the Beach Club. Waits can be long, but the ice cream is lovely! We also dined at the Captains Grill at the Yacht Club. Again the food was good, but nothing spectacular. The Yacht Club also has a steakhouse which we didn't try, but I've heard good things about it. I would definitely recommend this resort and would stay here again in a heart beat!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Ever”
Reviews.Author: MissFatGirlSlim
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing. The rooms are clean, the beds are soft and comfortable. The pools are very fun and the quiet pools are nice to. This is the best hotel are family have stayed in. We all loved it and felt safe and welcomed. If you are going to disney book this hotel you get amazing views of the fireworks every night from your room. The main pool is open till 10pm , its nice to stay up late and have a swim watching the fireworks from the pool. It is nice and cool in the lobby and all around the building - (fans). Overall the best hotel i ve stayed in.!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Disney Experience”
Reviews.Author: TheRealJAW
Reviews.Content: We recently went to the Disney Yacht Club Resort as a back-up vacation. We were originally supposed to stay out of town; however, that didn't pan out. I was so glad that we have Disney in our backyard to come in and save the day. The reservation process was extremely simply; I called the reservation line and they had me all set for a â€œMagicalâ€� experience in about 10 minutes. We were greeted at the security gate by a warm "welcome home". The only complaint I have from the trip would be the service we received, both at check-in and check-out, from the front desk. Neither of the individuals seemed to know much of what they were doing. They fumbled around with the system and had to ask questions repeatedly. At check-in, the cast member didn't provide any description or guidance about the hotel amenities. He didn't even tell us where the elevator was. Furthermore, we had to go to the concierge desk to have some problems corrected with our park tickets. As a Disney secret, I would recommend that, even if you have a "Standard View", always ask where your room is located. This way you can see if there might be a better alternative. Initially, we were supposed to be looking at the parking lot. The front desk was able to move our room to overlook a nice courtyard with a wooded area-- at no additional charge. The concierge desk was also more than willing to accommodate special requests-- even at the last minute. We were celebrating a friend's birthday and the concierge desk was able to scramble up a cake and have it delivered to our room in less than 45 minutes. We had it delivered while we were at dinner so that; upon returning to the room, there was a nice surprise there. The room was immaculate. The decorations are nautical inspired with subtle Disney infusions throughout. The beds are extremely comfortable and the linens are of excellent quality. The restaurants were top-notch and the access to EPCOT was extremely convenient. I was able to walk over just in time to watch the â€œIllumiNationsâ€� fireworks show at the end of the night. I would highly recommend this resort to anyone looking for a nice, relaxed environment to enjoy alongside all of the perks that Walt Disney World has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Room was Dirty, Staff wasn't very helpful.”
Reviews.Author: candleguy
Reviews.Content: If you plan on driving a car you will have a bit of a walk to the hotel. The first room we checked into was only half cleaned. One bed was made and a few towels hung up. You could tell the staff had been in there as toiletries and toilet paper was replaced but one bed looked like someone had just gotten out of it and there were towel on the bathroom floor. Half way through our stay the A/C went out. In this day and age I don't see how any hotel, let a lone Disney, can charge for internet. With everything else you pay for I would think they could throw in free internet. Food was so so and over priced. It was quiet, which I didn't expect. I thought kids would be running around screaming the whole time but I noticed very little of that.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!”
Reviews.Author: romancewriterTN
Reviews.Content: Day 1 of four nights at the Yacht Club Resort. I'm here for the Romance Writers of America National conference, and this is the overflow hotel. This is my first RWA conference, and first time at a Disney Resort. They were kind enough to honor my picky room request for something on a top floor, and non-connecting to another room. The Internet wasn't working (you use an ethernet cord in the rooms and it's $9.95 per day extra), and in ten minutes - no kidding - a maintenance man was up here to switch out my modem. Working like a charm now! :) A special shout-out to Sandra and Antonio at the front desk for their excellent service, and wonderful smiles!

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: bostonterrier
Reviews.Content: My family is one of those "Disney" families--we come and bring the kids as often as possible. However, when my husband is lucky enough to have a business meeting at Disney's Yacht Club, he and I make it a little getaway for the two of us. Don't get me wrong--there's still a family friendly vibe--but just a little more quiet and oriented to the grown ups. It doesn't hurt that one of our favorite restaurants, "Cape May Cafe" (the most awesome seafood ever!) is here. The rooms are clean and lovely, the beds are comfy, the linens are fancy, everything is wonderful! Each day, we were not awakened at the crack of dawn by housekeeping, but were able to sleep in late. However, our beds were always made and the room spotless by the time we returned from our late morning pool session. And the pools--sand on the bottom and a beach, waterfalls , fantastic slide, poolside food and drinks--what's not to like? From the Yacht Club, you can walk to the Boardwalk for some shopping and food, take an easy water launch to Epcot or Hollywood Studios, or just stroll over to Epcot (this is of course in addition to the Disney buses which take you anywhere you want to go on the property). This place is terrific--can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible stay at a beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: buttonball
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 10 days at the Yacht Club hotel which was the "overflow" hotel for the Irish Dance Nationals. What a fabulous place to stay! It was a close walk to the events next door at the Dolphin hotel. Our room was extremely clean with a fabulous shower and very quiet but incredibly great air conditioning. Our room was very spacious with two queen beds and a daybed. The bathroom had a separate shower/toilet then double vanity outside. There was also a small refrigerator and an alarm clock that charged the kid's ipods. The lobby was lovely with comfortable seating and checkerboards. Our room had a beautiful view of the boardwalk and we were able to watch the Epcot fireworks (some of them anyway) from the balcony. The pool which was shared with the Beach Club hotel was beautiful. We loved the sandy bottom and the poolside food and service was very nice. As we were checking in the family next to us was surrounded by Disney Cast members and given a big bunch of balloons and told that they were selected as "The Disney Family of the Day"! Darn...we were so close! They were given a room upgrade. But even without being the Disney Family of the Day we were very happy with our stay and were always treated liked valued guests. Because we were traveling with teens, two days of our stay we wanted to go to Universal Studios. It was very convenient to rent a car for those two days. I rented in advance online and was able to pick up the car right next door at the Dolphin. My only complaints about the Yacht Club would be that there is no free internet service (they charged something like $10/day)-in this day and age that seems rather cheap and outdated of Disney. Also the bus service was often crowded (like really crowded) as service from some areas (such as Downtown Disney) grouped the Yacht Club, Beach Club, Boardwalk, Swan and Dolphin on one bus-we were often crammed in a standing room only bus. I think the Swan and Dolphin Resorts need their own bus-they are very large. Overall our stay was fabulous! And I would highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Second Trip to the Yacht Club was just as incredible :)”
Reviews.Author: smile5
Reviews.Content: My family made a return trip to the Yacht Club this past June/July. Our first trip there two years ago left such a impression with us we didn't hesitiate to return. The pool, property, location and service were wonderful. We were upgraded upon check in which made our trip that more terrific. The buses to and from the Magic Kingdom on Fourth of July weekend were quick, we expected more of a wait. We can't wait to return, I had a wonderful week with my family!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort”
Reviews.Author: kajun213
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Beach Club resort for our annual family vacation. We go every year in December and always try different resorts. The Beach Club was beautiful, and from the moment we pulled up, we were treated like royalty. The kids loved the Christmas decorations which looked like gingerbread. We arrived early, a little after 11 am, and were pleased to find our room was ready. The room was beautiful with a view of one of the smaller pools. The beds were comfy and even the sofa bed (which we needed for our family of five) was nice and soft. Pros: -The resort has the largest pool area in Disney, and the kids loved playing there on the beach, slides, and pools. We spent two days there! -There was boat service available to get to MGM, and the whole family enjoyed the rides. -The staff went over and above to make our stay wonderful! -The Cape May Cafe made for a wonderful and convenient place to eat, although I would definately recommend reservations. Cons - The only thing that even remotely could be considered a con was the distance our room was from the buses, and the walk to Epcot. Both wore us out after a long day in the park. But long walks ARE expected in Disney, so we were not too shocked. All in all, we would love to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “OMG! The BEST place I have ever stayed!”
Reviews.Author: tylermarie
Reviews.Content: The perfect place to relax and enjoy Disney! While the Beach Club seemed to have younger families, The Yacht was more sedate and pleasurable. Unbelievable pool, the NICEST employees (cast members!) and the prettiest of hotels. We had two queens and a daybed and were quite comfortable in the room...we weren't stepping on each other all of the time. The Boardwalk is lovely and the hotel is a mere five minute walk to Epcot. I cannot compliment this hotel enough--I will never be able to stay anywhere else. The absence of obvious clocks made this stay the most relaxing and enjoyable I have ever had. If someone had not told me, I never would have known that huge dance competitions were taking place at the next hotel and many of the dancers were staying at the Yacht and Beach Resorts. What a joy it was to stay there!!

Reviews.Title: “I WILL NEVER STAY HERE AGAIN!!”
Reviews.Author: CAKFarm
Reviews.Content: Our daughter was competing at Irish Dance Nationals and the Disney Yacht Club Resort was the overflow hotel for the group. We had reservations at the Disney Swan Resort for two of the nights and because they were booked we made our first night reservation at the Yacht Club Resort. We later discovered that the Swan had a room open up and we wanted to cancel our Yacht Club reservation and stay at the Swan for the three nights of the competition. When I called to make the change at first I was told because we were staying at the resort we would be able to make the change with no cancellation fee. AFTER being on the phone for 45 minutes and being transferred to NUMEROUS people I was told I WOULD indeed be charged at the YachtClub for the first night if I changed to the Swan! In addition to the time wasted on the phone and the MISINFORMATION I was given, we then had to move all of our things from one hotel to the other after the first night. The whole ordeal was frustrating and illogical! I'm sure this won't happen ever again because I don't intend to EVER stay at the Yacht Club Resort!

Reviews.Title: “Did not want to leave...”
Reviews.Author: towniemel
Reviews.Content: What can I say that hasn't been said already? We had been wanting to stay here for a long time because of the pool and finally took the leap due to a 40% off discount code I received via email, which I think is now available to the public for certain dates. (And no, I don't work for Disney!) We loved this place! This is the first (of 8) Disney trips where we really took the time to relax, and it is because of the fabulous pool. Although it is quite big, the way it is laid out, with a small, but very nice, lazy river, and the separation into various "coves," including one for the kiddies with a large sand bar in the middle for digging and castle-building, makes it seem quite intimate. I spent a lot of time watching my kids swim while enjoying a book and a snack from the poolside-grill. Our room was lovely, with a nautical theme, with lovely plush white duvets, and even though our view was "standard" we looked out into a nice grassy/wooded area. All of the staff here were incredibly friendly and helpful. After many stays at various Magic Kingdom resorts, I was a little concerned that I would not be happy spending money for an expensive resort that was so far from the MK. However, we really enjoyed the location. It is a very short walk to Epcot, best for visits to the "world" area, as I call it, due to its distance from the main entrance. You can also take a boat, but I think it is much quicker to walk. It is easy to hop over for a meal. You can also take a boat to Hollywood Studios, which is fairly quick. Also, the hotel is on the boardwalk, across from the, you guessed it, Boardwalk Hotel, and there are multiple dining options along here. We mostly just enjoyed the delicious chili dogs and funnel cakes! Also, there was a great magician performing on the boardwalk that we all loved. The miniature golf course Fantasia is also about a 10-15 minute walk from the hotel. We actually ended up driving when we went to anywhere other than HS and Epcot, because the buses stop at all the Epcot resorts before heading out to the parks, and since Yacht Club is the second stop, you end up going to 3 other hotels before heading to the parks. The hotel also offers nightly movies for free on the "beach" area, which we enjoyed one night, as well as marshmallow roasts. My only complaint about this hotel would be that there are very limited options for quick service foods. All the other resorts at Disney where we have stayed have a cafe area with many pre-made salads, yoghurt, snacks, as well as a grill area for full breakfasts, pizza, sandwiches, burgers etc. You have to walk all the way to the Beach Club (believe me, quite a hike) for anything remotely like this, and their choices are much more limited than at other resorts. There are refrigerators in the rooms, however, and we kept milk and cereal in the room for quick, inexpensive breakfasts, and saved our food money for lunches and dinners. All in all, I would highly recommend this hotel, particularly if you are not planning on going to the Magic Kingdom frequently during your stay. Just bring some light food for the room for quick meals unless you really like having a sit-down meal for all your meals.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Yacht Club, but the room was not as clean as in the past when I stayed there.”
Reviews.Author: mynana
Reviews.Content: Where are the people at Disney this year?? I do believe we were among only a few people staying at the Yacht Club during the time we were there. That was our fifth stay at the Yacht Club, and I have never seen it so deserted! Also at the restaurants, even though they say they are booked solid, maybe with empty tables not people. Seems everyone was trying to keep up the appearance of being dilled to capacity. Even the parks were not crowded, the workers did not seem as "happy" as they were during previous visits. Oh well, it is the economy, I guess. If so, why is Disny not giving some real deals? and they are not, you know.

Reviews.Title: “Did not want to leave!!”
Reviews.Author: justmyopinion19
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week here at the YC. Check in was on a Saturday. It took maybe 10 minutes . First of all the moment you arrive they greet you by name. ( We checked in online the day before) As we walked in through the lobby the smell was amazing. Not sure the scent but if you imagine a beach/ yacht scent , this is it! Very light scent not overpowering. Can't believe I'm talking about the scent but it truly was a nice surprise. Anyway, our preteen loved the pool. It was by far the best pool I've ever been in , The sandy bottom was always warm and the sand felt so good on the feet.. We made a sandcastle and really enjoyed our time in the pool. It was just like the beach minus the salt and waves. The steakhouse at the YC was so so good. I cannot say enough good things about this place. The only negative thing I can say about this place is the cost ,but it lived up to every expectation we had so to me it's well worth the extra cost. It was crowded a bit in the pool area during the day but we were always able to find a good spot . The next time we visit I think we will spend more time at the pool instead of the parks. Oh and that brings to mind how close Epcot is to the YC. We arrived in the late evening at check in, so we walked to Epcot ( took 5 min) . Housecleaning was always generous with bath products and cleaned our room everyday. So much I haven't mentioned. Keep in mind we did not visit during a holiday, we requested at room near the lobby so walking to the pool was really fast. No special room view . I think this made a huge difference. Quieter , cleaner and more convenient . I hope to visit the YC in the future. It was our best vacation yet!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort - Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Cherylh407
Reviews.Content: We had a 5 night say at the Yacht Club and looked forward to staying on the "Epcot side" after several stays at the Polynesian. Check in was seamless. We were greeted at the door by name and shown to the check in desk. Check in only took a couple of minutes and the clerk was very helpful when we requested a change of room from the first floor to a higher floor. Our room was well appointed with two queen beds and a day bed. It was nice having a coffee maker in the room for that first early morning cup. The room was clean, the beds comfortable...and the air conditioner worked well...almost a little too well! Housekeeping was magnificent. Our room was always cleaned by the time we came back from the parks, even if we were gone only a few hours. There is a nice flat screened television in the room and the bathroom was well appointed, with the sinks separated from the toilet and tub area. We reserved a water view room and from our room we could see Crescent Lake and the Boardwalk if you looked to the right. I personally would have categorized our room as a garden view because it looked straight on to the garden area rather than the lagoon. Stormalong bay was inviting and well maintained. I especially liked the rocking chairs scattered about the property where you could sit and relax with a cold drink in the middle of all of the Disney bustle. Overall, we had a wonderful time. The rooms are a bit pricey, but you can't beat the location if you spend a lot of time at Epcot or the Studios.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Ever!”
Reviews.Author: soccerbabe45234
Reviews.Content: The hotel was so beautiful. All the landscape and decor was perfect. However the restuarant was very expensive and there is much better in Orlando. Buses were offered to everything on Disney so a car isn't even used. Rooms were large and clean with balconies. One minor issue is some of the rooms are far away and require alot of walking. There is also and aracade and many places for children (and adults) to hang out. The best part was the pool. It included many hot tubs, beaches and even a large pirate ship with a slide. This hotel was great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: christy31
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband had planned this vacation half a year in advance and were so excited. I decided that I wanted to change where we stay so I changed the location to The Yacht Club. I'm so glad that I did!! It was the best place I have ever stayed. We had an garden view room that was very nice and liked the nautical theme. The housekeepers were great always came back to a very fresh and clean room with towels made into shapes like animals cute. Check in was easy and the people were so friendly and everyday you were spoken to. You could tell the people enjoy their jobs The grounds are beautiful and the pool more like a waterpark is the best anywhere!! They offer great restaurants especially enjoyed the Cape May Cafe for the Character Breakfast was delicious and the pictures with the Characters turned out great. The nice boat was a big plus taking you to Epcot or Hollywood Studios. I understand that it is not cheap to stay here but honestly worth every penny for sure. We would highly recommend staying here it is paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Simply 'Magical!'”
Reviews.Author: MrsHotspur
Reviews.Content: There is nothing my husband and 10 year old daughter and I didnt like about this hotel or holiday in general. The hotel is spotlessly clean with the most friendly helpful staff you could possibly get anywhere. Our room was a lot bigger than we thought it would be having seen pictures online and in a brochure. We had a safe, fridge, hairdryer and coffee maker all provided. We had two large double beds which were very comfortable with crisp white linen which was changed very regularly. The bathroom had a dressing are with double sinks separate to the living and sleeping are and the toilet and bath / shower were in a little room of their own. All were ultra clean with towels changed daily. Our holiday was on a room only basis but you could get a buffet style breakfast if you booked at the restaurant downstairs. Failing that there is a lovely bakery on the Boardwalk just across from the hotel which had great fresh pastries and croissants. This hotel is ideally situated for Epcot as you can walk there in approximately 10 mins if that. You can also get a boat down to Epcot as park of the complimentry Disney transporation system. This was excellent and a lot quicker to use getting to other parks than we first thought. If you want to explore a lot out of the Disney World location then you will definitely need to hire a car as taxis can work out quite expensive. We found the food more expensive within Disney than outside in the rest of Orlando however this is to be expected and was not off the scale. The pool area at the Yacht Club is delightful and great to chill out by. The pool itself caters for all swimmers, ranging from a shallow paddling area for the little ones to an area 6ft deep for swimmers. Its not a serious swimmers pool but then with so much else to do around the area who cares. Its great for wallowing and relaxing between park hopping, shopping or whatever takes your fancy. We definitely want to go back and would recommend this hotel to anyone. It wasnt cheap to stay here and there are cheaper alternatives within Disney. That said, its worth every penny !

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: jintykerr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Disney Yacht club for my 40th and I can honestly say it was one of the best holidays I have had, I was a bit apprehensive before I travelled as I thought it would be too "busy", but as soon as we arrived, we were made to feel really special. The hotel was very grand and the staff were so helpful throughout our stay. The room was very comfortable and spacious for a family of four. On my birthday, they sent a bottle of champagne and dipped strawberries complementary, also every restaurant wished me happy birthday,(although after 13 days it was getting a bit too much). The hotel is situated perfect for all of the parks, and we used the disney transport buses, so easy, I would definately reccommend this hotel for all parties.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Disney Hotel”
Reviews.Author: codysmomnow
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Yacht Club for a business meeting which was held at the Swan Hotel within walking distance of the Yacht Club. The Yacht Club is a lovely place to stay. The pool is fantastic and the location is great. The Disney Boardwalk is close by and is within walking distance to Epcot. Even though I arrived very late the first night, the check in person was very pleasant and efficient. The check in was quick so I could get to bed after a day of flying. No problems during my stay. Staff was very friendly and helpful. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice for your vacation!”
Reviews.Author: PBozeman
Reviews.Content: We spent a week here on our vacation in May. From start to finish we were serviced by an excellent staff. Our rooom could not have been better. The location is fantastic! Walked over to Epcot several times. Took the boat to Studios. Busses are right there. Have stayed in several Disney hotels and this one by far is our favorite. They gave us a comp upgrade to club level upon our arrival. This was a very nice surprise. Could not ask for more. We would recommend this hotel to anyone. The pool is to die for. Rockers and benches everywhere outside to take a rest. Restaurant choices are good but we usually ate in the parks. Good hotel choice for large families or a couple of adults.

Reviews.Title: “Best pool for young children & excellent location”
Reviews.Author: coco61
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Yacht Club and will not be our last. We have a 1 and 3 1/2 year old - the location was great - quick and easy access to parks. Plenty of walking opportunities and dining options. The pool is the BEST. The kids had a blast. The staff was excellent. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional for an Older Crowd”
Reviews.Author: Mendon4
Reviews.Content: Brought my three older kids 16-16-21 and myself for 9 days in August. Although Orlando can be beastly hot and humid we had an exceptional time from start to finish in spite of the weather. The two pools are fabulous. Hotel lobby is very good and usable. Outdoor porch rocking chairs and smoking areas exceptional. The most comfortable bed I've ever had in any hotel. Very good room. If you want to see all of Disneyworld this is the Hotel to do it from. Boat transportation is the best right outside your door. You can walk to Epcot or Ride, all other parks are easy to get to. Bus service is excellent also. Fabulous Ice Creasm Parlor, Steakhouse, and other Dining right within the complex. Great powerr boat riders for rent, travel to adjacent properties for Boardwalk Disney etc., a snap. You share one pool with the Beach Club next door which caters more to families with smaller kids. But you also have a private pool for your hotel with a terrific laundry building right their, in case you want to do a few items, and not just sit around a laundramat. You can always put your time to good use at this particular hote. Can't say enough and can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: ms6238
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at the Yacht Club and it is definitely our favorite! My husband had to go down to Orlando for a conference and they put us up in the Yacht Club. Everything about it is spectacular from the friendly staff, to the clean rooms, to the multiple amenities! This hotel is great for couples, honeymooners, and families! For those who want a nice relaxing quiet vacation, they offer the "Admiral Pool". The pool is in the back of the hotel away from all the noise. They also have a great gym and a very nice spa! For kids, they have "Stormalong Bay" pool which has a real sandy bottom, a water slide, tube rentals, music, and a regular pool. They also offer many kid activities including movies on the beach every night and s'mores by the fire on the beach! I highly recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with some minor issues!”
Reviews.Author: Lori32
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful but we did run into some issues. Upon arrival we go straight up to our room. We walked in and the beds were half made, towels in the floor, etc. Call down to get another room and they were like... Oh, no problem, come back down so we can get you another room. The problem with that is that you walk FOREVER just to get to your room. If you are planning on visiting this hotel and are handicap you will want to request a closer room. Anyway, did this and finally got settled in. Ate at Beaches and Cream which was really good. Ate at Captains Grill for lunch and dinner and was disappointed both times. Service was HORRIBLE and book was just ok. I would suggest you go out and explore. Disney has other places to eat that are better not counting the amazing restaurants in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Usual Excellent Service and Ambience”
Reviews.Author: Intrepid1
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one week and once again enjoyed the usual high level of service we've come to expect. This hotel has the nicest "themed" pool at Disney IMO. Within easy walking distance of EPCOT and also about a 15-minute walk to the Studios. Housekeeping immaculate; food offerings varied and we stuck to the lower calorie offerings this time around and were pleased. It is Disney; it is not cheap. We know what to expect here and we like what we get. Not for everyone nor do we expect it to be.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT! Already booked a return trip!”
Reviews.Author: ward103
Reviews.Content: We were picked up by Disney's Magical Express at the airport. We didn't even have to wait for our luggage, it was brought to our room! We were then taken to the Yacht Club. The lobby is beautiful and smells AMAZING! Check-in was speedy and friendly. The rooms have a nautical theme and we had a great view of the water. Everyone in the hotel was very friendly and they helped us in any way they could. The pool and beach looked very nice but it was too cold to partake. They had fun activities every evening. The location is wonderful. We were steps from Epcot and Hollywood Studios. The only bad thing is that some of the rooms seemed a good distance from the lobby. Our friends stayed near the end, and they were forever walking to the hotel restaurants and gift shop. I spent a few days exploring the hotel and the adjacent Beach Club. There are a few cute nooks and crannies to sit down and read a good book. The solarium at the Beach Club is nice. Sunny and full of windows! The transportation system was also beneficial, but time consuming. One evening we took the bus to Animal Kingdom Lodge and it took us an hour and a half to get there! On the way back we took a taxi and got back in seven minutes. No lie! The rooms are rather pricey, but I felt like we got our money's worth. I already booked a trip back for September. I love Disney World :)

Reviews.Title: “Our Happy Place”
Reviews.Author: needsaholiday87
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed here for 2 weeks with my daughter and her fiance in Novemeber 2009. During the trip we were also meeting up with my brother and sister in-law, who had emigrated to canada in order to celebrate my 50th birthday and her 40th birthday. From the moment we set foot on the property after a long haul ( 9.5 hour) flight, from Scotland, we knew that this was going to be a fantastic holiday. We were met from Disney's Magical Express by staff, who stated taht they would make us" fell comfortable" after our long journey. And boy they did just that! We were then shown to the lifts only to be told that for the duration of our stay, we had been upgraded to Club level!! :D After having been checked-in by the friendly and curteous concerige staff we were on our way to room. Our room was at the end of the corridor and was a corner room so had extra floor space.Nothing can prepare you for seeing this room! For our entire stay, conceirge desk staff ,house keeping and catering staff were nothing other than excellent! Karla from house-keeping was thorough and efficient, Jean in the concerige lounge always made sure he had our breakfasts favourite's and definately a smile! The Stormalong bay pool is without a shadow of a doubt the best on Disney Property,with sand bottomed pools, Disney trivia during the day and even bingo.Be sure to catch the changing of the guards at 4.15pm With a 5 minute walk from EPCOT and 10 Minute walk from Disney Studios this hotel is in the perfect location. Be sure that you catch a movie on the beach, we watched Snow White, these are played daily, you can find the week's listings at the entrance to the beach. We had many lovely walks to the boarwalk, for pizza and coffee and to play some of the arcade games, there is also lots of evening entertainment on the Boardwalk! I have to finish this review at some point, I just can't rate this hotel highly enough,although it can be assured we will be visiting again, especially when Grandchildren arrive!

Reviews.Title: “club floor REALLY pricey but exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: wackyseester
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the club floor at the Yacht Club. Expensive, but exceptional service from the club floor staff. Really friendly, and incredibly accomodating. Which some would argue we were entitled to, given the premium you pay to stay on the club floor. Food in the lounge was great, and the staff even got stuff out and warmed it up for us when we came home after the service period had ended. In general - the pools are spectacular. Still can't get over the sandy-bottom pool in the center, and kids loved the enormous water slide. This hotel is convenient to Hollywood Studios and Epcot, longer to Magic Kingdom and MUCH longer to Animal Kingdom.

Reviews.Title: “Draw the money from your pocket”
Reviews.Author: rabiatot
Reviews.Content: Don't take the free transport from the airport...you get brainwashed for 45 mins with Disney adds. Five minutes would be ok, but a 45 min treatment brings you close to running amok and kill the bus driver, family or colleagues. I have never seen a place, where the art of making money was so perfect. Well, on the restaurant bill you can click whether you pay the suggested 18 or 20%. Don't book the meal services, I learned that they remove everything exactly after 2 hours, doesn't matter whether everything was paid or not, even another glass from an open bottle of wine 2 minutes after deadline was a no-go. Disney, two times in my life...the first and the last time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: junesflame
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for my husband's conference and stayed a few extra days and turned it into a family vacation. The hotel is quite nice and the rooms are comfortable size with nice yacht design, in-room fridge and cozy amount of space. We also had a beautiful view of the lagoon from our deck and could see parts of the Epcot fireworks (very loud at 9:00 pm -- just as an fyi) The resort is immaculately clean and the pool area is awesome for kids. The transportation by shuttle and boats to the parks was quite easy and we never had to wait very long at all. The Boardwalk is quite close with the restaurant and shops. The first night we ate at the Captain's Grill and despite some good reviews I've read, the service was slow, prices very high and food mediocre. We didn't eat there again. I had better luck with restaurants at the Beach Club or Boardwalk. There are fun activities at the pool and beach and we all had a wonderful time. Super easy to walk to the surrounding hotels, the Boardwalk, Epcot and Fantasia Golf.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: travelholic_mom
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week while visiting Disney's Parks. It is rated under the Deluxe Hotels, but I was surprised that the room service is available only until 11 PM and after that you have only few types of sanwiches and pizza. Not worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price if you like Epcot.”
Reviews.Author: aprilisis
Reviews.Content: This hotel is expensive- but you get what you pay for. It is walking distance to Epcot and the Boardwalk, the rooms are huge, the pool is spectacular, the store off of the lobby has a great selection of merchandise, the arcade is great- and huge (for rainy days), the staff is friendly, and the water view rooms are just awesome. I want to stay here every time I go to Disney. I'm actually staying here again in October. I have more photos, but was only allowed to post 10.

Reviews.Title: “CAPTAINS GRILL RESTAURANT ONE OF THE BEST IN DISNEY”
Reviews.Author: napagirl2
Reviews.Content: We have dined here many times for lunch and dinner and we have never had a bad meal here. Everything is good. Fish and chips, crabcakes, porkchops etc... The only problem with this place is that the service can be slow but that is always typical disney. This is by far one of our favorite disney hotel restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: familyoffive106
Reviews.Content: Clean comfortable rooms. Excellant on site restraunts and location is outstanding. Can walk to Epcot or then MGM Studios. Pool and hot tubs were fun. Pool with a sand bottom is one of a kind. When you can get all the comfort, a little more in price is a good tradeoff.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish upscale lodging - a break from the Disneymania”
Reviews.Author: carissachandler
Reviews.Content: 2 moms traveling without kids to Disneyworld for the Goofy race (half marathon sat and full marathon on sun). Wanted a stylish place that was more geared towards adults then kids. PERFECT PLACE!!! PROS: Classic furnishings, comfortable beds, close to Epcot, walk to the beach boardwalk, and great views. Additionally, the restaurant in the hotel served great food. CONS: expensive ($300 plus a night) it's disney, not a big surprise. WOULD RETURN: HIGHLY RECOMMEND

Reviews.Title: “Classiest Resort at Disney, no wonder it`s rated # 1 !!!!”
Reviews.Author: rayc1744
Reviews.Content: It`s easy to see why The Yacht Club was rated # 1 among Disney Deluxe Resorts by Birnbaum. We stayed for a week in June `09 and I must say that the accomodations are stunning. The Lobby area is breathtaking and the exterior grounds / pools,etc. are the best of any resort I`ve seen. The location near Epcot, Boardwalk, Disney Hollywood Studios( Boat Ride is free!!!), Fantasia Gardens, etc.is also preferable to other resort locations. Buses to the other parks like Animal and Magic Kingdom ran very efficiently. Rooms are not real large but very nice and perfectly clean. The dining is great, especially for table service, examples Yachtsman Steakhouse, Cape May Cafe ( Actually at the adjacent Beach Club), and The Captain`s Grill. Probably the only small criticism would be the need for another Quick Service option at the Yacht Club. The main Quick Service option ( Beach Club Marketplace) is located at the Beach Club and is a little bit of a haul to get to. There is the Hurricane Hannah`s Grill at the pool area ( which is great ), but I think they could use one indoors on the Yacht Club side ( maybe near the fabulous Fittings and Fairings Gift Shop ). I would recommend the amazing resort to all !!!!! It`s pricey but YOU GET WAHAT YOU PAY FOR !!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't stop thinking about it! Can't wait to go back!!”
Reviews.Author: Disneyfreakuk
Reviews.Content: I visited the WDW Yacht club in August last year with my wife and 3 year old daughter and have only just found the time to write a review about how good this place is!! The positives â€“ everything! The location, the pool (the best hotel pool Iâ€™ve ever seen!), the staff, the rooms! I seriously could not fault one aspect of the holiday! Yes you can hear and see children â€“ this is DISNEY! My daughter was made to feel like a princess and cried all the way to the airport and when asked what she wanted for Christmas she asked to go back to Florida. The only negative I could think of was the long walk to the beach club shop for a coffee on a morning but so what?? We were on the DDP and loved that on an evening we could take a stroll into the Epcot centre for our meal (a seven minute walk, 7 minutes and 32 seconds to be precise) â€“ this made it much more like a self catering holiday; I recommend eating in Mexico, Italy and Japan. All were fabulous. Also try Wolfgang pucks at Downtown Disney. Thereâ€™s loads more I could say but I would be here all day. Quick point â€“ if on the DDP; 90 days before you travel it is worth making a timetable and thinking about where you would like to eat, call Disney and make your table reservations, (from the UK the call will cost around Â£20 and youâ€™ll need a good 40 minutes!) if you canâ€™t get in where you want - book the next best and try when you get there, there may have been cancellations â€“ we managed to have lunch in Cinderella castle due to a cancellation and turning up at the right time â€“ luck or magic?? We will defiantly be going back, fingers crossed for 2011!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend for location, service and quality of hotel”
Reviews.Author: Krausey
Reviews.Content: Stayed w/my husband in late December at the Yacht Club and we booked a room on the Concierge level. The staff was extremely warm, helpful and professional. We walked around the surrounding hotels and found the Yacht Club to be particularly well suited for travelers w/o kids. We also only need to take a bus to Animal Kingdom and Magic Kingdom. For Epcot or Hollywood you can either walk or take a ferry - VERY CONVENIENT. Loved the hotel and would come back in a heart beat! CAUTIONS: Crowds are large in late December w/wait times from 45min to 2 hours for rides

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pool, amenities, etc.”
Reviews.Author: KathyBiggs
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights and 5 days. Booked the Concierge Floor, 2 room, connecting. Check in was a breeze on the Concierge floor. Taking the ferry boat to Epcot (or walk), and also ferry to Hollywood Studios was sweet. The bus ride to the Magic Kingdom was a breeze too. Walk or ferry to The Boardwalk was nice too. The continental breakfast was a nice way to start the morning with the kids. And the kids couldn't wait until the evening desert bar was open, homemade cookies, hot chocolate, and after dinner drinks for the adults. The staff was very accommodating, helped with suggestions and reservations for all the meals. The rooms were clean and pleasant, and the beds were very comfortable. We loved the steak house on property. The pool was awesome, slide, lazy river, sand into the water, just beautiful. Disney World on the other hand was absolutely packed.... would have much rathered spend our days at the hotel then deal with the crowds at the parks. We won't be going back to Disney... but if we were to return or recommend a property to anyone, this place gets thumbs up !!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't even go there.”
Reviews.Author: HermanT
Reviews.Content: I would have never imagined that a Disney hotel would not be able to produce a play area for when it is raining outside. Average room size, terrible food choices, it feels like you are trapped in and are only available to go to a Disney locations. In the middle of nothing else but Disney stuff. Forced to buy from therm at a ridiculous price. Apple juice for my toddler $12.00 for a 12oz bottle. If I go to Disney again (I don't think so) I will much rather stay at the local Holiday Inn or something else for half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: lambert1133
Reviews.Content: This was our first family trip to Disney. I put several requests for our room and when we checked in, none of them were taken into consideration. However, they were able to accommodate us with the room we wanted plus a pool view at no extra charge. The pools were nice but nothing special. My daughter doesn't like sand too much so she didn't like the main pool with the sandy bottom. We ended up going to the "quiet" pool most of the time. The main perk to this property is the access to the boat and buses. From my perspective it's more centrally located compared to some of the other properties. We stayed 7 days and were able to visit all the parks and still have down time at the pool. Everyone was very accommodating. The only other negative was that we had to wait FOREVER at the pool snack bar to get lunch. They need to get a better system in place to move everyone through at a quicker pace. Otherwise, we would definitely go back if we ever plan another Disney trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for a Non Driving Florida Holiday”
Reviews.Author: Ouseview
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights 2 Oct 09. Booked a Mears Town car on line, which was waiting for us even though we landed early. Once at the hotel we were upgraded to a lake view room which was great. Looked out over the lake and Board Walk. Also could watch the nightly fireworks from Epcot from the balcony ( food festival was on ) so not sure they do the fireworks every night normaly. Room was great, had everything we could want. Beds, well what can I say, never slept so well. They recommend you book a table in the restaurants well in advance. We asked the conceirge to try and change a booking we had at the Yachtsmen Steak House, no can do, so we just went along to restaurant later and asked, no problem, told it would be 10min's given a pager and went to the bar next door. Pager went off, and we were shown to a great table for 2 in the window overlooking Storm Along Bay. Great night. Found a really nice pool just to the back of our part of the hotel( Admiral Pool ). Only 2 or 3 people around, so plenty of beds or tables. Also has a Laundry room next to it, so for a total of $5 you can get everything washed and dryed while you swim and sunbathe. We were on the Disney Dining Plan, and I have to say that saved us a small fortune, food is not cheap anywhere in Disney, but it's normaly good. Overall a great stay, with great conections to Hollywood Studios by boat from the pier, or a 10min stroll into Epcot and a 5min walk across the bridge to the Board Walk. Or failing that, there are the Disney Buses from the front of the hotel that will take you anywhere in Disney, we never waited more than 10 min's for one. Enjoy, we did.

Reviews.Title: “Captains Grill Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Bevzvet
Reviews.Content: The Captains Grill is located inside the Dinsey's Yacht Club. This is one of the best kept secrets at Disney. Christine our server and she was the best. Ordering NY Strip which was tender and cooked to order and Snow crab legs were the best, sweet and served with potatoes and drawn butter. Relaxing and unrushed, Christine gave us the best service during our stay at Disneyworld.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel and vacation spot!”
Reviews.Author: Dasher55
Reviews.Content: I have spent a week at the Yacht and Beach Club at Walt Disney World now on 5 different occasions. It is hands down my family's favorite vacation destination! The hotel is beautiful, is extremely well run and has a truely awesome water park right in front of the hotel. We often got out to the parks early, took advantage of the fast passes and were back by mid afternoon to swim in the hotel water park for several hours. Then we returned to the park for dinner and evening activities. The best thing about the Yacht and Beach Club is it's location. It looks over a large lake with a beautiful view of the Disney Boardwalk area which is within a quick walk. You can walk from your hotel to Epcot and can even see the Epcot fireworks from the hotel. It is also a quick and pleasant boat ride to MGM. All of this makes many restaurants very convenient. The staff at the Yacht and Beach Club treat you like royalty and have helped us with many a reservation. All and all it is very easy to relax and leave your cares behind!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: maya1964
Reviews.Content: This is a great place for families with young children. The staff was very nice and hospitable. The room was a bit small for us ( there were four of us) but had a balcony that made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort - fun fun fun - lots to do!”
Reviews.Author: cherylll50
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 6 days at the Yacht Club Resort. It was so much fun. There is so much to do - everything is close - walking distance to the clubs at night - great restaurants - the bus *which is free* is at the front door and the longest we ever waited was 10 minutes. The breakfast buffet was fabulous. We went to Downtown Disney and Pleasure Island almost every day. Our room was gorgeous and spacious with a beautiful view of the lake. We could see the Epcot fireworks from our room. We miss it already. I would highly recommend the Disney Yacht Club.

Reviews.Title: “Refurbished Rooms are Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: ThePoolGirl
Reviews.Content: We were lucky to get a newly renovated room on the 4th floor with a view of the lake and lighthouse. It was spotless and cleaned thoroughly every day of our one week stay. The pool is one of the finest amenities and the pool staff organized games for the kids to play. The waterslide is a lot of fun as is the sandy area. Naturally the location being close to Epcot can't be beat. The whole experience was wonderful and relaxing. Can't say enough nice things about this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Yacht Club return this time to concierge”
Reviews.Author: nydoc
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 night stay and all were very pleased. we had stayed in this hotel about 6 yrs ago when the kids were younger and now wanted the kids to really take advantage of the pool complex. Plusses -outstanding pool complex with a great water slide-very long. Stormalong bay has something for everyone, sand beach, slide--long one for for older and a small one for little kids, river pool (which is only deep part of the complex,) which is fun but not that strong., whirlpool My kids spent hours on the water slide and also looking for the sink holes in the pool. the pool hrs are 10a-12midnight so we often took advantage of the pools upon return from the parks in the eve(even the water slides are open till late and manned with lifeguards). There are smaller but nice pools at beach and yacht club outer wings if u want to swim early. Ping pong by the large pool also a plus -large game room----keeps kids occupied but not cheap -nice lobby with free wifi availble-in lobby only. endless loop of disney cartoons playing 24/7 by small tv is nice too -great access to epcot -less than 10 minute walk to epcot world showcase. Boat to epcot takes longer than walk. Boat ride to hollywood studios is 10 minutes maor a decent 15 minute+ walk. can easily walk to boardwalk area or swan and dolphin (where miniature golf is). Boats ran more frequently than i had remembered -Concierge level----overall very nice although prob not worth xtra $. Nice breakfast (fruit, oj, apple juice. coffee , lattes/cappucinos etc from nescafe machine(this was available 7a-930/10p), muffins/danish(2 types usually avail....neither great), average bagels, yogurt. Snacks during day including candy (swedish fish, yogurt pretzels), cookies, homemade potato chips. 5-7 had liquors/wine to pour with decent choice of various appetizers(average) and pastries/cakes --3 or so till about 10. Only complaint was often seemed to clean up room by 930 instead of 10).. Main advantage of concierge level is staff that can get you into restaurants with more success than you can do on your own with Adv dining ADRs. Staff not overly helpful to us as we made our actual reservation to the hotel late and things were booked. My best advice is to contact concierge thru # you get right after club level reservation is made -nice gym although on small side. i think this was xtra charge if not on club level Negatives -bus sytem is really hit or miss and we seemed to have many misses. bus travel time once bus comes is 15 minutes or less to most locations (AK, wdw, bb, typh lagoon) but we waited at even peak times up to 30 minutes. We are told buses run every 20 minutes but who knows -no easy travel to front entrance of epcot---about 20 minute walk(at least) -internet access is daily extra fee which is crazy at these prices although free wifi in lobby -rooms average size but with flatscreen tv hope this helps---all in all a beautiful hotel, great for kids

Reviews.Title: “Treated my daughter like a queen....”
Reviews.Author: brookesmom10
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice. Everything was clean. Not much of a view but we were not there much anyway. Captain Woody chose my child to be Captain of Day while I was in my meeting. Front desk staff never said no to any requests.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: jcjohns91107
Reviews.Content: There is almost nothing bad to say about this hotel. You can't get a better location if you are there for Disneyworld. Its a 5 minute walk to Epcot, 15 minute walk to Hollywood Studios. The room was great. We had a balcony overlooking the quiet pool. Double sinks outside the toliet/tub area. Small refrigerator. The Yacht Club definately feels more adult than the adjacent Beach Club. There seemed to be plenty of closet and drawer space, even with two teenage girls. The Captains Grille was a solid coffee shop type restaurant. The small coffe/breakfast area off the lobby sold reasonably priced pastries. The staff was great. There are laundry facilities if needed. The one complaint was that the water in the pool felt about 90 degrees. Not refreshing at all, which is not good in June. I was so looking forward to taking a break in the afternoon with a cool dip in the pool. Wasn't to be. Very short waits when we did need to take the bus.

Reviews.Title: “Bad start but it got better.....”
Reviews.Author: pieboy4
Reviews.Content: Booked this Disney resort as it was a family holiday for 6 adults and 7 children ranging from 1 to 9 years of age. Was based on the 1st floor (ground to us in the UK) overlooking a small private pool - there was another larger pool used by the majority of the guests at the front of the hotel with slides etc. Initially when we got there the rooms seemed nice and roomy and had internal doors in-between which was useful for the kids to roam from room to room. On closer inspection the rooms hadnâ€™t actually been cleaned. There was visible sand on the carpets ( I guess from the beach) and the bathroom had pubic hair on the floor. When I went to bed on the first night I pulled the covers to find some of the bed sheet was blood stained which meant that the beds were clearly not refreshed after the last guest. Anyway we got everything sorted by the following morning and the rooms were cleaned quickly. No real apologies or any extras offered even though we were asked to have a â€˜magical dayâ€™ every time we spoke to someone. On the plus side â€“ the location is perfect for Epcot and the other parks as you can get a bus from the car park or a boat that comes around every 15 minutes or so from the jetty at the rear. Couldnâ€™t fault that at all. Well serviced by restaurants. There was one buffet that we went to that had a horrendous queuing system where you had to take away a buzzer which was activated when a table was free â€“ horrible. Lobby was lovely and you could sit there quietly and use a laptop with their free Wifi. Place was nicely decorated as a whole and a great retreat after the parks. If you could get a room to the small little pool that would be good as it is quite secluded and you can leave your kids there quietly happily bobbing around in water (I could see them from my room). Overall nice hotelâ€¦.food over salted thoughâ€¦yuk

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, but that Restaurant M.A.N.A.G.E.R!”
Reviews.Author: Robert C
Reviews.Content: everything was exceptional, except the main hotel restaurant manager. she actually told me, in front of 8 family members, "You should not have been give a reservation. My priority is to the guests who called many days ago." naturally, i flipped my lid, though remained cool in front of the gang.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel and staff ever....”
Reviews.Author: blessedoklahoma
Reviews.Content: The trip from the time we got there till they said goodbye 8 days later it was great. They always greeted us made me feel like they really wanted us there. Service at the food places were great the food was good to. I have cancer and they made all my dreams come true and treated my grandchildren like prince and princess and my 16 year old nephew had just as much fun. The pool is beautiful and the kids loved it. May God bless all of them. And thank you all for my wonderful trip....Toni Borza

Reviews.Title: “another magical Disney resort!”
Reviews.Author: disneybarbie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Disney's Yacht Club from July 9th-23rd, holiday with group of 7 adults: my partner's parents, his sisters & boyfriend of elder sister. This was my first stay at the Yacht Club, although I have stayed at five other Disney resorts to date. On arrival, we were immediately greeted by two cheerful cast members (disney staff) who gave us glasses of ice-cold water. Check in was quick & enjoyable, a bellhop took care of our luggage while we went up to our rooms - two pairs of adjoining rooms 2091&2089 and 2079&2077. About half-way down the corridor, there was a stairway at the end which gave us access outside, near to the edge of the hotel, near the Swan & Dolphin. We had booked waterview rooms and the view was beautiful - directly below our room was the wedding pavillion, and to the right we could see the pool, Storm-a-long bay and Crescent Lake - in the distance the Eiffel Tower in Epcot's France Pavilion - and even further away we could see the Characters in Flight hot-air-balloon at Downtown Disney! Rooms were very clean, well-themed and decorated. Beds were comfortable & only occasionally heard noise from room above (usually children running around with excitement in the mornings!) Maid service ("mousekeeping") was excellent, always done before lunch & we were always given a plentiful supply of shampoo, soap, showergel, coffee supplies, towels... also on arrival there was a towel shaped liked Mickey Mouse arranged on the bed! There are several 'hidden mickeys' in the rooms as well as in the hotel lobby carpets. The rooms are very big and have plenty of draws, cupboards & wardrobe space. New radios have been put in the room which have iPod docks in them. The hotel's rooms are currently being renovated & I believe they will soon have new furniture & flat-screen televisions. We noticed a mix of guests at the Yacht Club - some convention/business people but also many families - we had dinner at the neighbouring Beach Club Resort one evening, and noticed this hotel seemed much more lively & family-orientated. We ate at the hotel's Captains Grille for dinner which was a very nice meal - they had a three course set menu for around $28 as well as A La Carte choices. The Crew's Cup Lounge bar is very richly decorated, and has a glass wall that looks into the private butcher's of the Yachtsman Steakhouse restaurant. The Ale & Compass lounge sells quick breakfast items from 6am - such as muffins, bagels, cereals & speciality coffees; this is very good if you want to grab a quick bite to eat on the way to the parks! Epcot & Hollywood Studios are short walks away, and the boats to these parks are also frequent, and the cast-members provide useful info about park hours & firework shows while onboard. The Disney transportation buses to Magic Kingdom, Animal Kingdom/Blizzard Beach and Typhoon Lagoon/Downtown Disney were very efficient, rarely crowded and the longest we waited was 15 mins one morning (to Downtown). Storm-along-Bay is an excellent pool, plenty to do for guests of all ages. Sun loungers were a little harder to find in the afternoons (still plenty on the resort's beach however), but in the mornings it was easy to find places to sit in the shade or sun. There are poolside activities all days for children (hoola hoop contest, team games & Hannah Montana karaoke!), also bingo & disney trivia for all. Pool is open until 11pm at night. It is possible to hire a variety of boats from the Yacht Club Marina - as a surprise for the family I arranged a private boat cruise to view the Illuminations fireworks in Epcot. The cruise lasted over 90mins, we went to the Studios & back past the Boardwalk before mooring in Epcot - view of the show was incredible! A captain is included in the price, as well as sodas & snacks - further food and beverages can be requested from the hotel's private We had a great Captain called Michael. The shop, Fixtures & Fittings, is located on the ground floor near the lobby, it stocks a lot of Disney park merchandise, as well as exclusive Yacht Club tshirts, pins etc; also a range of food, drinks & medical items. This hotel is beautiful, staff were all incredibly friendly and helpful, and the location on Crescent Lake is fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “family holiday”
Reviews.Author: erinfraz
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel staff are wonderfull rooms are ok but need updating pool is great kids loved it. The Yachtsman Steakhouse as the best steaks Porterhouse is amazing will be going back to this hotel. Absoluley loved it .Lovely walk to epcot and boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding service!”
Reviews.Author: wheelerba3
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to the yacht club. We were greeted by name as we entered the resort and the service continued to be great during our trip. On our third day, the refrigerator in our room broke. On our way to the pool, we stopped by the front desk, not knowing who to talk to. Before I made it up to the desk I was approached and asked if I needed help. I explained out situation and the woman quickly told me she would have it replaced and our room credited to cover the spoiled items we had purchased. When we had returned from the pool, a new refrigerator and room credit was in place. GREAT SERVICE! After spending several days at the Yacht club, we continued on to the cruise portion of our trip. I just want to point out that the luggage service is fantastic. It is so helpful to not have to lug everything around from point A to point B. Disney even takes everything thru customs on the way home. No dragging luggage and children around. Again, a great service. On our return from the disney wonder, we were faced with spending 7 hours at the airport, due to a late flight. Not my idea of a good time, especially with kids. We were able to return to the yacht club. They stored our carry-on luggage so we could spend one last day at the parks. Not only did they take care of our luggage, but they arranged the needed taxi to get us back to the airport on time (at our expense). Of course, just as they had said, the taxi and our luggage was ready to go at the needed time. All we had to do was hop in... The yacht club is central to several major attractions and as stated in other reviews has an amazing pool. Our kids loved it. We never waited more than 10 minutes for a bus to the theme parks and were glad to see the buses were larger and held many more people than 4 years ago. (the park transportation was my biggest complaint the last time we visited). We had a great time and appreciated the friendliness of all the disney staff at the yacht club. Our family has travel extensively and I can certainly say that not all hotel staff is as warm, friendly and helpful as the staff at Disney's yacht club.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I would expect from a Deluxe resort”
Reviews.Author: savannahbeach
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in June with my husband and kids. I was here for a class run by Disney. Given that this is typically a $300/night hotel, I was less than impressed. The wallpaper was peeling from the walls in the hallway, the door hinges in the bathroom were rusting, and the cabinet door which hides the small fridge was torn clear off its hinges. Some of the personnel were nice, but others were not. And it seemed to be random, as different employees would give you difference responses to the same request. The kids really enjoyed the sand bottom pool, but I would not stay there again. The $10 a day internet fee that Disney resorts charge is just too much.

Reviews.Title: “Grandma's Celebration”
Reviews.Author: OrnerytoYOU
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at the Yacht Club for two weeks. We were celebrating my Mother's victory over cancer, and this was the one hotel she kept wanting to stay at when we went to Disney World. We thought the hotel itself was beautiful, our room was clean, and the flowers we ordered for my Mother came on time. Our request that we stay by the elevator was honored, and we had a lovely view of bushes, yep. The hotel itself was far from being booked solid, and they put us on the third floor looking at the bushes and trees, positive thing was we knew when deliveries came because we heard that beeping sound they make when they back up. We did love our balcony, and my Mom in a moment (she called it chemo brain moment) went out on her underwear and danced a jig on it, we were happy for the solitude. Kids adored the pool, and we managed to get some shaded lounge chairs. The slide was fun for all. Kids liked walking to the BOARDWALK in the evenings, so much to see and do there, but they really loved coming back to the Yacht Club. It really is beautiful, the lobby, and the smell each and every time you walk in the doors is really a nice touch. We really liked eating at the Captain's Grille, it was convenient for breakfast the buffet was nice but we basically ordered off the menu so no one over ate. We loved being chauffeured from the airport to the hotel, and it was nice not having to rent a car for 2 weeks. My Mother's plane came in late from Pensacola(about seven hours late), and let me say that Disney came through in a very big way. We had timed the flights so we could land at airport within an hour of each other so she would not be at airport by herself. When I explained the situation, that I was worried that she would be alone at MCO airport they sent a Cadillac with driver to pick us up to get us to the airport to get to her. I was exhausted,and I am sure I was babbling when I first tried to explain it but they came through. It really meant so much to my Mom she was worried we would not get to her on time, and being older she felt vulnerable. Walking to Epcot or riding the boat launch to Epcot was so very nice. We also walked to MGM studios, they were having the STAR WARS weekend and it was a big photo opportunity . Once again we ate at Le Cellier, food was perfect as was service. We loved eating at the Grand Floridian's Park Faire, they added the Wicked Step Mother and Sisters and it was hysterical. We watched a little girl throw herself in Prince Charming's arms and almost knock him off his feet. The Evil Trio played their parts with gusto and were hysterical, one even stole our magical wand and walked away with it using it to zap her way across the dining room. Not once in the 14 days at eating at the table service restaurants were we disappointed. The fireworks at the Magic Kingdom and Epcot were magical, and Disney does it like no other. One other thing I want to point out, we think Disney must have gotten serious with the mosquitoes because not once did we get bit, and it was raining like mad most of the days we were there. Mind you Florida has those mosquitoes that bite through jeans, and have a very nasty reputation, but not a one. One more thing we found curious was that my youngest daughter stayed hours at the pool and her eyes were fine, most of the time the chlorine gives her a hard time, eyes turn read and swell, but not at Disney, so we told her it must be Fairy Dust doing its magic. Yacht Club is a fine pick for families, so beautiful and relaxing. We decided that on this trip Yacht Club was now our official Hotel, and no other will do now. My daughter graduates next year, and once again we will be heading back with the clan. Grandma in tow.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: friends19
Reviews.Content: We LOVED the Yacht Club! It is very nice and clean. The staff was very friendly. They are renovating the Yacht Club at this time so if you plan on staying there make sure you are not near the construction. (or you get a renovated room) We unfortunately were right under the construction which starts at 7:00am! We asked to be moved and they did without any hesitation. (FYI: they started with the 5th floor and are working their way down. It takes about 2 to 3 weeks to complete a floor. They started the 5th floor in the middle of June) We were actually moved to the Beach Club which in my opinion is not as nice. The Yacht club has a really nice balcony with a small table and 2 chairs. The Beach Club has a very tiny balcony...so small you have to stand b/c their is not room for a chair. The pool is amazing!!! The kids loved the slide. You are only a short walk to Epcot which is nice b/c we loved to eat dinner at Epcot. When you enter Epcot you are near the Worlds so it is perfect for dining. I will say the buses seemed to run slow. Our wait at one time was 45 minutes! But, overall it was amazing and I can't wait to go back. This was our second stay at the Yacht club and won't be our last.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous property but poor meal and the steakhouse”
Reviews.Author: MEPASQ123
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt the Yacht Club was a georgeous hotel. The pool is amazing and the people at the front desk were extremly freindly. Easy trek to EPCOT and the restaurant and fun there. My one disappointment was the dinner we had at the Yachtsman Steakhouse. It was really awful. The waiter recommended the steak from Australia.
