It was all grizzle, tasteless and tough. Three of us ordered it and all three were terrible. One other person ordered the prime rib which came with a roll and no potato or veggie. .Pricey meal and poor quality!

Reviews.Title: “All the good things you read are true.”
Reviews.Author: kjohnson9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Yacht Club the second week of June. The hotel is beautiful and the staff was excellent. Our kids couldn't get enough of Storm-a-Long Bay. It is by far the nicest pool we have ever seen! The movies by the lake are a great way to end the day. The location, just a 5 minute walk from EPCOT, is tip-top. My only caution is that the refrigerator in the room is tiny and the restaurants are expensive, so if you are traveling with kids and don't want to eat out every meal it will take some planning.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lindcarla
Reviews.Content: I was here for my birthday and from check in to check out everything was exceptional. The staff are wonderful, the hotel is superb, the rooms are lovely, comfy, clean. Wow, I just cannot recommend it enough. It was our first visit and we loved, loved, loved it. The facilities are great, everything you could wish for. The pool area is amazing. They are great with kids - my grandaughter "escaped" from our room and when I went looking for her I found her in Reception with one of the staff who had given her a Minnie Mouse and was watching t.v. with her when I arrived distraught to find her there. They are wonderful. I cannot recommend this hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation with a personal touch!”
Reviews.Author: henngirl
Reviews.Content: The Yacht Club had very personal service when we arrived we were greeted by name and walked in to the desk to check-in. As we were checking in we found out we had been chosen family of the day and got our room upgraded. It was so nice and the staff was so accomodating. The pool was awesome. Cape May Cafe character breakfast was great. The only negative thing I can say about it is that it needs a 24 hour quick service spot to get snacks late at night and to fill up the refillable mugs. We loved the Yacht Club and its staff and we would stay there again. Thanks for a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: annie02Clearwater
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to a Disney Resort. I must say Disney employees are first class service!!!! From the moment we entered the resort the gate attendent was aware of my arrival. The check in was quick. We needed a fan, microwave and a robe. Our needs were met promptly. The first room service our meal was mixed up, Disney corrected ,the bill was comped; at their suggestion. The lobby had an air of family friendly atmosphere. The staff was always present; but they blended well with the guests. I reccommend early dinner reservations. Cape May has an excellent breakfast buffet, that includes the Disney characters making rounds to each table. This was my favorite.!! We can't recomment The Captains Grille though, The menu is limited. For Late diners Beaches and Cream is open until midnoc. But like all resturants reservations are suggested, or plan to wait a while. The pool area has a full service staff with lifeguards.Also at 8 pm a campfire with roasting marshmellows and a 9pm out door movies on a beach. A shuttle boat took us across the bay to The Boardwalk and Hollywood Studios.At no cost.The shuttle runs every 20 minutes until 10 pm. I can't say enough about the excellant service. I would go back. The ONLY issue I have is the Cost of dining.. A family can find ways around thisby bringing in food. I reccomend Cape May Breakfast with Disney characters ;3 adults pluse a child was $87.00..The pictures and smile from all us Children was well worth the cost...I could live without the other resturants. Every employee met us with a smile and a greeting. I travel a lot. I can't say enough about the service.

Reviews.Title: “My Tips and Tricks for the best Disney Vacation”
Reviews.Author: vacaprincess13
Reviews.Content: Around February we decided to go to Disney World for vacation from May 4- May 11. We usually go places like Jamaica, Mexico, etc., but I persuaded my parents to take us to Disney World (I'm 13) . We all agree it was the best vacation we have ever had. I did months of planning in advance. But I found out the best book ever was The Unofficial Guide to Walt Disney World 2009. You can buy it on Amazon for about $20. But it also allows you to go to a website called touringplans.com and print out touring plans of Disney World. Those plans were a life saver! The longest we waited was to meet Ariel in Ariel's Grotto. That was a 30 minute wait. The plans tell you in order what to do. We followed the "Happy Family" touring plan, which included a 3 hour or more break from the parks in the middle of the day. We were done with everything we wanted to do in Disney World in one week using these plans. Some people complain about hating being on a schedule. But its really loose guidelines you don't always have to follow! They were just amazing. Okay, more about our hotel. The Yacht club was awesome! The people there were just so nice, we really didn't want to leave! As you walk in the huge lobby they have a little corner with old cartoons playing, which are fun to watch. The atmosphere is so calming, that after a hot, tiring day, you feel relaxed. Not to mention the pool is fantastic! The Yacht Club shares a Pool with the Beach Club, but its more like a mini water park! Its has a fun water slide, a relaxing sand bottom pool, and a lazy river. The downside is that you have to pay to rent an inter-tube. I don't think it's worth it. They also have a beach but you can't swim in the water. The rooms were also very elegant. We originally booked a water view room on a regular level. When we got there, we were awarded Family of the day and got upgraded to Concierge level. That was a nice treat, but I wouldn't pay to stay on concierge level. The one thing thats was cool about it was the lounge. In the morning they had breakfast, in the afternoon snacks, and the evening dessert and Appetizers. They also had a happy hour with beer and wine at a certain time at no extra cost. If you aren't planning on booking concierge level, bring your own breakfast foods like granola bars, oatmeal, etc. You don't want to break the bank paying for breakfast. And again, I don't think we would pay the extra money to stay on the concierge level. The only difference is a slightly bigger balcony and the lounge. Are you going to pay $100+ for breakfast per day? I wouldn't. So, overall, the Yacht Club was an amazing hotel! When we go back in two years, there is no question about where we are staying! If you are going to stay on Disney property, I would highly recommend the Disney Dining Plan. I think that was one of the keys to our great vacation! When you check in, you get your hotel key which is called your "Key to the World" card. On it are all of your meals and snacks. So whenever you eat, you just swipe your card and you're covered! They give you a receipt that tells you how many meals/snacks you have left. We weren't hungry at all! They give you such large portions there! It was awesome. You can check out more about it at DisneyWorld.com or The Unofficial Guide. The restaurants we went to were all awesome. The first night we went to Cinderella's Royal Table in the Cinderella Castle. That took up two of our meals but was worth it. We all agree it was the best dinner. In the beginning you meet Cinderella and take photos (two of which you get to keep) and get autographs. Later they preform a show, that was cool too. The food was pretty good but the experience was even better! I would highly recommend it but hurry and book soon cause it fills up fast! We also had my sisters (10 and 6) dress up as there favorite princesses and we did their hair. We bought really nice cinderella and Sleeping Beauty dresses at a garage sale for bout $10 each. You might want to try that instead of paying a lot at the Boutique they have there. They next day we went to Crystal Palace, which was cool too since we got to meet all the Pooh characters. Then we went to Princess Story book dining in Norway. That wasn't our favorite and we wouldn't go again. The food wasn't good and we had seen the princesses earlier so it wasn't as special. That one you do get two free photos as well though with one of the princesses. Then we went to ESPN club, right across the lake in front of the hotel. That was good. We did that the night we didn't have any plans ( because of the Cinderella dinner) It wasn't expensive and the food was really good. Then we went to Tepen Ido, a Japanese food restaurant where they cook the food right in front of you. That was really good too. The steak was awesome. Then we went to the Grand Floridian Cafe, which was good too. They had American food, the Steak was good there as well. The last night we went to the Sci-Fi dine in theater. That was cool but bring a sweatshirt! It was so cold in there we couldn't enjoy ourselves! All i was thinking about the whole time was my jacket sitting in the hotel room. Other than that. the food was pretty good and the short clips of old movies were entertaining. When you are at the parks, look around for cast members who look like they are searching for someone. My dad saw some and told them to pick my sisters. In Animal Kingdom, they were Honorary Presenters and they got to present the Regal Emperor scorpion when the park opened. We were also let in early :) . So my dad and I were the very first of the day on Expedition Everest! They also have this great thing called Disney's Photo Pass. We bought a cd of all the pictures before our vacation for $99. You get a card and give it to any of the cast members with a camera and they take really cool pictures of you. When you are back home you can view all your photos online, add borders and more. The CD was really worth it because we have about 300 pictures! Lastly, remember to buy a park hopper pass, make dinner reservations in ADVANCE and get fast-passes! I hope this helps! For any more tips you might need, you can email me at mickeymouse.br@gmail.com in the subject line, please write Disney Tips :) Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT Listen to the BAD Reviews!!”
Reviews.Author: ilovedisney777
Reviews.Content: I must say I am one of the hardest travelers to please and very particular when choosing a resort for my vacation. If you get one thing out of my review, let it be to DISREGARD any bad reviews on the Yacht Club you read. Let's just be honest, some people just need to complain about something!! I was there April 29th-May 5th and let me tell you it is a FABULOUS Resort. From the greeting & service we received once departing from the Magical Express, to the time we got back on it to go home was FANTASTIC. The staff was EXCEPTIONAL & literally went above and beyond for every request we had. I had a small medical issue while there and the front desk, guest services and house keeping continuously checked on me & offered to help in any way they could. The location of the resort CAN NOT be beat. You can either walk to Epcot or Holly Wood Studios or enjoy the relaxing water taxi rides. They have one of the BEST pool areas available which is perfect when you need to rest from a long day at the parks. There are PLENTY of fantastic dining options close by to choose from while staying @ the Yacht Club as well. There was PLENTY of Hot Water even on the days when I took 2 showers. Housekeeping did a GREAT job and continuously brought extra towels through out our stay even though we only asked for them the 1st day. If you are trying to decide which resort to stay at, the Bottom Line is this: If you enjoy beautiful resorts, great food, a convenient location, and great service, than the Yacht Club is the place for you! I go to Disney World every year and the Yacht Club is my first choice along with the Beach Club. Take the chance and you WON'T want to check out! :O)

Reviews.Title: “Anything but Magical -- No hot water, No cable, Awful food, Nice grounds”
Reviews.Author: ChiTravelChick
Reviews.Content: After coming highly recommended by friends, my husband and I decided to stay here for a long weekend. We were very impressed when we first arrived at the hotel grounds and friendly staff. Then our stay went downhill from there -- we had to wait 2 hours for dinner (when I tried to make a reservation way ahead of time), in the morning we had no hot water so took cold showers and our cable did not work. Our experience on the Disney Magical Express was anything but magical. It took over two hours to get to our hotel from the time we got our bags at the airport becuase we waited for a bus for over an hour. When I nicely explained all of this to the hotel manager all he offered me were fast passes on park rides. He was very apologetic however a dinner certificate or something with a little more value for our lost time and awful experience would have made the vacation a little more enjoyable. The grounds and pool are beautiful and well kept. Still, I would never stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel I have every stayed in”
Reviews.Author: benjsda
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is heaven on earth. It is a delux resort. it is very expensive and you pay for what you get. Everything about this Hotel was perfect and I cannot use enough words to descibe it. Absolutely brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Yacht Club Resort at Disney World: "Amazing!"”
Reviews.Author: L0vet0Travel747
Reviews.Content: In February of 2009 my family and I took a vacation to Walt Disney World. After reading many reviews and looking at pictures of all of the resorts, we decided to stay at the Yacht Club. It is a little pricey but it is completely worth it! Everything was perfect about this hotel! The lobby is incredible and there's always extra friendly staff members making sure you're being taken care of. The room was absolutely gorgeous and very clean. It was spacious and decorated very cute. The balcony was also really pretty and I loved sitting out there and just relaxing. This resort is perfect if you have young children, teenagers, or if you're two adults looking for a romantic getaway. As I walked out the back door of the lobby for the first time, my jaw dropped. The view was gorgeous! You can see the lake and the boats and the boardwalk with all the shops and restaurants. It was a breath taking view! Also the pool was HUGE. When I say huge, I mean huge! The sand on the bottom of the pool was so cool and it felt like you were in the ocean! The slide was also really fun, I went on it ten times! What I also love about it was the snack bar. We ate their at tables with umbrellas eating our delicious lunch by the poolside! It was so beautiful and peaceful but also really fun and exciting! The Yacht Club Resort was the most amazing hotel I've ever stayed at! Its worth every penny and will make your trip to Disney a million times better! I strongly suggest staying at this resort. It's absolutely incredible!

Reviews.Title: “Not Magical”
Reviews.Author: bigdmommy
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were not greeted by name or in any other way. My husband was lugging two giant suitcases no one asked if they could help him. We were given a room as far away from the lobby as possible. The view was of a swamp (as my 5 year old called it) with stagnant green scum with floating plastic cups/bottles. I had requested a crib for my 1 year old. We called about it twice. Finally, someone brought a pack n play. Asked again for a crib. One was finally rolled in and left...no linens for it. LuckilyI had brought a crib sheet from home. The bedspread in the room was torn. We asked for a new one which was dumped on the bed on top of the ripped one. The room was shabby, the smoke detector dangling. The bathroom small and dingy. Old style tv and not enough hangers. The large pool area was dirty with lots of cigarette butts in the sand. In general gave a feeling of yuck. Very convenient to epcot and Hollywood . Staff apathetic and underwhelming. My daughter threw up in bed the last night of the trip and I called to the front to explain and ask for new linens and before hanging up the person told me to have a magical evening.............hmmmmm. Getting the sheets changed took about ten acts of God and as many phone calls. So, I would say this hotel is not worth the money and is not kid friendly or fun in anyway. There is nothing "resortish" about it. The restaurants are average. We will go back to Disney, but will skip the Yacht Club

Reviews.Title: “Disney does it best”
Reviews.Author: me21103
Reviews.Content: We've been to Disney several times and never stayed on property, so decided to try it once to see what the fuss is all about. We are a family of 5 and had enough space to sleep comfortably - 2 in each dbl/queen bed and my preteen son on the daybed. The main problem was having only 1 bathroom for 5 of us, but we made do. The pool for this hotel is AWESOME! Even having only stayed at this one resort, I think I would have to say it's the best one on property. It's HUGE and family friendly for all ages. There are beach areas and a huge pirate ship and slides and plenty of shallow areas for the little ones. There were also plenty of lounge chairs all around. In our room we were pleased to find an autographed photo of Goofy, along with the washcloth/towel animals made my housekeeping. My kids loved this, as did my husband & I! The rooms are very clean and well maintained. We had to go down several long hallways to get to our room from the elevator, but the kids loved racing to the door to our room to be the first to use the key card! Simple pleasures! :) I would have to say the biggest benefit of staying on property is the early admission for onsite guests to the parks. We used it the days we could and it was quite nice. A very nice perk to be able to get in before the crowds. We also did a character breakfast at Animal Kingdom which was very fun. The staff at the resort were all exceptional and friendly. No complaints here. We ordered room service twice and although rather pricey, as all Disney food is, it was very tasty, hot and delivered promptly. If you can afford it, staying on property definately has it's advantages. Not sure if we would do it again, but it was a nice vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Still Great 2nd Time Around”
Reviews.Author: travelmommaryland
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at the Disney Yacht Club. It was still as wonderful as we remembered. The resort was clean. Staff was outstanding. Room service was great. The only complaint I would have is the late night menu is very limited. We received an upgraded room upon check in which was a wonderful surprise. Easy walk to Epcot. I would highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: kcheer22
Reviews.Content: If you can, upgrade to the concierge level. From the time you arrive you will be treated as royalty. There is a lounge for complimentary refreshments (including cordials, wine and beer) throughout the day.

Reviews.Title: “So-so rooms in a fabulous setting”
Reviews.Author: jlp879
Reviews.Content: Our family of five stayed in a standard room over the Thanksgiving holiday. Though this was a deluxe Disney resort, you wouldnâ€™t really know it by looking at the room. The room contained two queen beds and a twin daybed but it felt cramped with all of us in it at once. The TV armoire housed a small fridge and there was a small coffee maker in the bathroom sink area. I like how Disney puts the sinks outside of the toilet and bath area, itâ€™s more efficient for families. The lobby and public areas had an elegant feel to them, but that feel did not flow through to the rooms. There wasnâ€™t anything wrong with the rooms, they just felt cramped and a bit rundown. Paying over $300 per night you think the room would be outstanding, but not so here. Youâ€™re paying inflated Disney prices for an ordinary hotel room. What you do get for the inflated price, though, is an enviable location and some nice restaurant and recreation amenities. We loved being able to stroll around the Boardwalk and have a great selection of restaurants to try out. We loved that we could walk to Epcot and Disney Hollywood Studios and we loved the fantastic pool that the Yacht Club shares with the Beach Club. Stormalong Bay is almost reason enough to stay at this property. We swam everyday, even though it was a bit cool, but the pool was so inviting we just had to get in. The kids loved every aspect of the pool, from the zero-entry sandy beach area to the lazy river and the great water slide off of the pirate ship moored in Crescent Lake. The only drawback to the three-acre pool is that it so hard to keep an eye on your kids! Good thing Disney has it well-staffed with lifeguards. There were lots of other activities that kept the kids busy besides swimming. Some nights there were Disney movies being shown on an inflatable screen on the beach, campfires and storytelling on the beach, organized kids games around the pool, surrey bicycle rentals, watercraft rentals and more. We didnâ€™t have time to partake in all we wanted to as we spent the days visiting the theme parks. All the staff we encountered on the property were friendly and helpful and terrific with children. Overall, it was a terrific vacation, but in terms of value for money spent, I canâ€™t say if I would choose it again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay at Yacht Club”
Reviews.Author: LEGJCG1
Reviews.Content: Disney's Yacht Club Resort is a very nice resort with a great location for many dining options. The resort has a pool area that will rank higher than most at Disney. Our stay was for 8 nights in December which was a very busy week from 12/5-12/13. The parks were busy and the weather was cool about 70 everyday. And actually cold at night around 45-55 degrees. We found the staff very friendly and always attentive to the children. As far as the hotel room- I have to say clean but dated... the rooms need renovation and for the price you expect a bit more new and plush surroundings. The restaurants for the Yacht Club were very good. The Galley has a great buffet for breakfast - fresh pastries and excellent hot and cold items to choose from. As well as Yachtsman Steak our meal was wonderful and very expensive but upscale and worth the money. Hurricane Hanna's was a bit average to below average. Burgers are much better at the Beaches N Cream nearby in the Beach Club. I would recommend the Beach Club as an alternative, Lobby was beautifully decorated and softer on the eyes. The Marketplace within the Beach Club had good sandwiches and breakfast or pastries to choose from also. We were on the dining plan-worth the money because everything on all menus around Disney are priced high. We used the plan and whenever we wanted added to it and paid cash as well. If you have young children the pool has a great shallow end with a sandy beach surrounding it. I may choose to stay again perhaps at the Beach Club for the location, or maybe closer to Magic Kingdom next time because of the bus transportation or by taxi from here is a bit slow. Email me with questions I would be glad to offer my help.

Reviews.Title: “Dining plan will drive you crazy”
Reviews.Author: Tiredmommaindiana
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Yacht Club from Dec. 27th to January 2nd for a conference. Our room was fine, very spacious, and clean. Our 2 children loved the sand bottom pool. However, I saw hotel staff members sweeping sand off the sidewalks back into the pool at night, and I thought that was a little gross. After that, we swam only in the small pool by the tennis court. No sand, but hopefully cleaner. The biggest problem, by far, is the food situation. This is the first time we have stayed at a Disney hotel since the implementation of their "Dining Plan." We were not on the plan, as my husband and one child are very picky, and never eat dessert, and only drink water, so we would probably lose money. In any case, keep in mind that lots of people ARE on the plan, and MANY of them are in hotels without full service restaurants. Where do all the people at pop century, etc, go for their daily full service meal? Guess. Also, they are all advised to make reservations 180 days in advance. We thought, "How many idiots make dinner reservations for their entire stay six months in advance?" The answer is "LOTS of idiots." Several nights, although we were staying at this expensive hotel, we were unable to get dinner in the restaurant. It was full of people from OTHER hotels, NOT paying for an expensive room. I even tried calling in the mornings, and couldn't get a reservation for the same evening. I met several other families in the same situation. I guess the Disney attitude is "If you can afford the hotel, then you should get room service." We ate a few nights at Hurricane Hanna's and the Beach club marketplace. One night I was able to get into the Captain's Grille ( the restaurant) because I made a big noisy fuss at the check in area. To me, it is ridiculous to PAY big bucks to stay at one of the best hotels, and not be able to eat in the hotel restaurant!!! We were there for a meeting, but if we go again to Disney on our own, I'll stay at the cheap hotels and just use the food court. If you have to go to one of the expensive Disney hotels, I would block reservations for dinner six months in advance, even if you are not on the meal plan. I like staying on property for the convenience, but this whole meal plan thing seems like a big scam to ensure that every restaurant in every hotel has every seat filled every night, all night. And, you have to give them your money IN ADVANCE. AND, if you don't eat all the meals, YOU LOSE!!

Reviews.Title: “love the yacht club”
Reviews.Author: tubby75
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the yacht club for a two week holiday from the uk, we originally booked the beach club but our tour operator didn't book my mum a disabled room so we had to switch to the yacht which having had a wonderful time at the beach club the year before we were a tad disappointed. however when we arrived we were made to feel so welcome we had adjoining rooms that overlooked the lagoon and we could watch the epcot fireworks, the only con was that the shop where you get your drinks refilled was in the beach club but we ended up loving our early morning strolls to get our coffee and the kids had no worries walking to get there drinks either. we also found that you could refill your cups at the pool bar too. on our third day after returning from a full day at universal we opened our door to find all our stuff had being removed furniture carpets the lot... the horror and shock was very upsetting. we went to the desk and they explained that they had tried to contact us but our mobiles are very hit an miss in the usa, to inform us that a sewage pipe had burst in our room and that it had started to flood... the swift hitel staff removed all our belongings and my mums next door before any of it got damaged. they said they had got us a room and took us to it. when we got there the staff had even packed all our stuff in as we had left it in the previous room however the view was overlooking the bus stop so they said they would move all our stuff the next morning to better rooms once they became available we didnt have to do anything.. we went to the pool and waited for the rooms to be sorted, nothing got damaged broken or went missing. our new rooms were higher and had even better views only con was that they weren't next door to each other... later when we popped to the desk to say thank you they informed us that they had refunded our full stay at totak of $8000 and we got park hoppers and fast passes which we maxed out on toy story mania... oh and they didnt charge us for valet parking the whole stay... they couldnt have done anything more for us they were fantastic, they made an awful situation feel better. the rest of the holiday was glorious and having now holidayed in florida ten times i would now only stay on disney. the location is fantastic. the kids love the pool area and we love the boardwalk oppisite and th service... i do notice alot of the reviews on here are from people who are american and maybe have higher standards than the british... but having holidayed in the uk and europe i can hand on heart say that the americans have the right idea when it comes to hospitality and service. yas the hotel may be abit tired and i do think they could upgrade the tv's but compared to the uk this is luxury and its a full package, location, service, nice food and pool and its all disney ... my mum has now brought into the vacation club so we have lots of plans to return....

Reviews.Title: “Great Location to many Options”
Reviews.Author: ElaineConnecticut
Reviews.Content: We are a repeat customer to the Disney Yacht Club. What keeps bringing us back is the location nestled between Hollywood Studios, the former MGM and Epcot; the resort and family character of the hotel; the service level and all of the options it gives us with being on the Boardwalk. You have ... -the lazy river, sand bottom pool; -the quiet pool that we have to ourselves most days; -the Friendship boats that launch from the resort to Epcot and Hollywood Studios; -the Boardwalk with ESPN, Flying Fish, Clowns and Live Shows in the evening on the Boardwalk. -Surrey Bikes for rental that are a hoot on the Boardwalk. -Water activities right at the Yacht Club. -Afternoon teen / family games poolside. -Restaurant options at the Yacht Club, Beach Club next door or on the Boardwalk. - Shopping at Disney stores in the hotel or on the Boardwalk which is always a late night event. - to top it all off, you can watch the Epcot firewalks from the hotel or your personal hotel balcony if your room faces out towards Epcot. - the magic hours late night are great when only the guests staying on Disney property can ride the rides. We never wait for rides and time it during this timeframe so we ride all of our favorites without a wait. We love it here..... but.... we noticed cutbacks and room for improvement on our last stay: - Rooms were not as clean as they could be. The walls, doors were sticky like kid sticky... kind of yucky. - We had to ask for our carpet to be vacuumed - We had to ask for clean towels to be replenished in the evenings. - No optional turn down service - No characters in the lobby in the morning like prior years - No fresh apples in the lobby in the evening like prior years - No hot cider in the lobby in the evening like prior years. - No hot chocolate for purchase at the bar in the lobby this year like prior years for sitting near the tree in the lobby - Meals at the restaurants has been cutback on - noticeably. We don't buy the Disney mealplan b/c we want what we want. And, I think the meals have been cut back on b/c of the mealplan. For example, no lobster tail at Teppen Eto's this year (I am sure I usually got lobster tail and filet mignon), Primetime's meal this year unlike the past made us look for another meal...left us less than pleased. - the park ticket prices are really high for non-Floridians and the days expire now unless you pay a lot of money for this option. - Also, not for nothing Disney, but I love the decor but upgrade your beds now like all five star hotels - I had a backache. I guess I could stay at the Dolphin and have the heavenly bed, but I like the Yacht Club...get better beds. - Also, get flat screen TVs at least at the Yacht Club and Grand Floridian... at a discounted rate we paid almost $500 a night... upgrade the amenities in the room. - Also, get larger safes instead of those small closet safes. We bring all of our best photo equipment, laptops, blackberries etc with us to stay in touch with work so we can pay your prices. Give us a safe. We mentioned things that were missing this year at the hotel and we were told "a lot of changes". All in All.... you can't beat the Yacht Club, but there is room for improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Disney Yacht Club lives up to the Disney Promise”
Reviews.Author: TAMemberfromHalifax
Reviews.Content: If Disney's success is due to fanatical attention to detail, the Disney Yacht Club is a perfect example of this promise in action. The first thing that struck me was such a high proportion of staff to guests - I've never seen this before, particularly in the pool area, where there are at least three lifeguards from every viewpoint. Check in and check out were painless, the food was incredible (try the filet mignon and tomato salad in the Crew Lounge) and the wait staff very accomodating. But the best part of the trip was the world-class conference facilities - from breathtaking architecture and sensational meals to the best in technology and audio visual. I can't wait to come back with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 4 days!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JBBuffalo
Reviews.Content: Disney Yacht Club for four days in Nov. Check in no problem. Rooms clean! Maid serves was great. Employes willing to help with any questions. Location close to Epcot,Boardwalk. The pool looked great (didn't use it) Food was good. (expensive) Service in the restaurants was very slow. Bus service good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway at Yacht Club”
Reviews.Author: takeachance8
Reviews.Content: My husband (we are 28 and 29) and I spent a weekend at the Yacht Club for a friend's wedding. The hotel itself was great. The staff was ready to meet us at the front door, escort us to check-in, and take our bags straight to the room. We had already bought a one day park pass but the concierge was able to have our park passes put onto our room keys so we only had to keep track of one pass- a nice touch. The room itself was very nice. Spacious with 2 closets, a bathroom, and a separate living area complete with sink and couch in the main room. The bed was incredibly comfortable and the balcony was nice. I was surprised the TVs hadn't been updated to flatscreens but we didn't go to Disney to watch TV! No problem. The lobby had so many lovely details and they had a nice restaurant for breakfast where we ate once. It was a bit of a wait but they give you a buzzer so you can wander around if you want and they'll ring you when you are ready. They also have a smaller more informal bar where you can get bagels, coffee and at night of course drinks. The grounds are beautiful and the pool was fabulous. We don't have kids but if we did they would love it! Sand bottom pools, a lszy river, hot tubs, and a really fun covered waterslide that starts from the top of a pirate ship! We were like 10 years old all over again. They have a little snack bar right by the pool which is convenient for lunch. Plenty of chairs we had no problem finding a place to sit. Property is close to EPCOT and the Boardwalk which was really nice. You MUST visit Jellyrools- dueling piano bar. Beware it gets loud and can be crowded but worth it. Overall experience- excellent. At check-out they will even help you print out your boarding passes and pre-check your bags.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place”
Reviews.Author: MSEK
Reviews.Content: We returned on Nov. 16, 2008 from a 5 night stay at the resort. The room was bright and clean with great maid service everday. The entire staff was very friendly. We loved the pool and the pirate ship slide. We got the "kitchen sink" at Beaches and Cream and loved it! Great location to all the other parks and hotels. Transportation was very easy to navigate. What a great stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: WouldBTravlin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for five days in June of 2007. We had the worst experience I have ever had in a hotel. One day we came home to find a bag of trash in the sink and HAIRS in our toothbrushes. When I contacted the front desk they said "We will let housekeeping know." And then did NOTHING! I contacted the Disney property again upon our return and received the same response, "We'll let housekeeping know." As a family we have traveled extensively and this was by far the most disgusting experience I have encountered in a hotel property. I was shocked by the manager's total lack of concern. Other aspects of the property were nice. We enjoyed the pool and the proximity to EPCOT. However, like all Disney properties, you pay a price for this convenience and considering the unresponsiveness the of the management, I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Second terrific experience at Yacht Club”
Reviews.Author: MemberinWilmington
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5-day visit to Disney World (to celebrate the Halloween holiday); this was our second trip (in the past 2 years) during which we stayed at the Yacht Club resort. Once again, we had a terrific experience at this resort. Our room was clean, and while we paid for a standard room, we again received a room with a view of the water/boardwalk. Fabulous view of the Epcot fireworks from our balcony! No room at any Disney property comes cheap, and you have to accept that a Disney vacation is going to cost $$$ (whether it be for a room, food, activities, etc.). In fact, I felt like I was the only parent to say "no" to some things.....it's the one place where our children freely take advantage of us!! As for the staff, aside from some relatively slow table service, we had absolutely no complaints. Because we were resort guests, we took full advantage of the extra hours in the parks. This made our stay even more enjoyable, as we typically did not wait more than 10 minutes for any ride (you do need to time this right, though). The extra hours also afforded us the opportunity to spend time at the resort itself, enjoying the fabulous pool(s), children's activities, and night-time movies on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Money at All!”
Reviews.Author: Agent348
Reviews.Content: I made reservations through Disney. We were planning on going to the Epcot Food and Wine festival for our 19th anniversary, so, since it was a special occasion, we took the splurge. I agree with the last reviewer and the one who said the place was kind of "snooty." We could have stayed at one of the "moderate" hotels and used the money put toward this hotel on other things! The only request that I had when the reservation was made was that we have a king bed. I called the hotel directly the morning of check in to confirm and request an upgrade if possible, and the cast member was very short and abruptly told me "NOo, you will have to inquire upon check-in." Upon check-in, I did request an upgrade. We were told that there was nothing. The party behind us approached the counter, asked for an upgrade, and received it. I offered to pay the extra for the concierge level if there was availability and was once again told there was nothing. The second party behind us (family of 5) was approached at the counter by hotel management and told they were selected for an upgrade to the concierge level. OK, I thought...let's see, Disney properties are great, so everything should be fine. We went to our room, which was a good 5 minute walk from the elevator. The view was nice, it was of the Boardwalk, but was 2 queen beds. Remember, I tried to confirm right before we left for Disney. We called and were told there was nothing they could do, that I should have requested that at check in. HELLO??? I called Boardwalk to see if they could accommodate us because I was not at all happy with the way the reservation went. Turns out that the manager there (same office/person for the whole Boardwalk/Beach/Yacht Club) told us that those rooms were more money than our $380/nt. rate. Who is to say I could not afford more than that? I was asked, "What would it take to make you happy?" I detected attitude, like I was asking for a presidential suite or something. I simply said, a king bed with my water view. I did not think my room request for a king bed was out of line. Guess what? Within 5 minutes they had one. And it was just ok. No big deal. In fact, nothing at the hotel was so overly terrific. With only 4 people in one of the lounges, it took a long time to get served. I could stay at Caribbean Beach or Port Orleans for the same thing, or even more! I should have paid the $150 extra and gone with the Grand Floridian when making the reservations. We went there for breakfast and dealt with their guest services staff for tickets, dining, etc. and they were accommodating and pleasant. Unless it was a freebie, I wouldn't stay at the Yacht Club again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for location, not the rooms”
Reviews.Author: travelersc92
Reviews.Content: The hotel facilities are very nice - the lobby, the pool, the grounds. The location is terrific. Just walk right into Epcot or over to the Boardwalk. But, there are many problems here considering this is one of their Deluxe hotels. I paid the extra money for a Club level room. Don't do it. It's not worth the expense. You get your own check in desk, but there isn't any problem with the general check in desk. The concierge at the Club level doesn't do anything more than the general hotel concierge or by just calling for reservations or tickets from your room phone. The "Club room ", which is where they offer free food and drinks is tiny and dark. The food and beverages that you get with the club level are average. During breakfast, there's no place to sit unless you get there very early or very late. The rooms are tiny and outdated. They cram so much furniture in one tiny room that my wife and I could barely walk through at the same time. Be forewarned, "garden view" may mean "no view". I was told when I made the reservation that I would have a garden view. My view was of a rooftop. I questioned the concierge about this and was told that what I had was a garden view and it's just a general term they use. Garden to me would mean grass, trees, etc.. But maybe I'm being picky. Housekeeping is friendly, but not very good at their job. There was hair on the bathroom counter, sand on the bathroom floor, stains on the pillow case and hair on the duvet. And that was when we checked in. Also, there's no food or beverages past midnight. No vending machines. If you go to the park late, don't come back thirsty or you'll pay $12 for a bottle of water from room service. Dispite the issues I had, I would give the Yacht Club another chance, knowing now what I'd be getting. But I wouldn't stay on a Club level.

Reviews.Title: “Yacht Club Didn't Meet My Expectations”
Reviews.Author: nj_freq_trav
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Yacht Club for four nights at the end of September and I don't think the room and experience was worth the $600/night that we spent. The checkin process was flawless and we were quickly escorted to our room by a bellman. Kudos to the hotel for letting us check in at 11:00 AM. Upon entering the room though, we quickly noticed several disturbing items. There was hair on the bathroom floor. There was a par of women's underwear in the corner of the room behind a chair. There also was a layer of grime/dirt on the switch that controls the fan that had to be washed with a wash cloth. We bought our park passes through the Concierge's desk (we stayed on the Concierge floor) and had multiple problems with the tickets. We went to the parks four days and each day at least one member of our family was not allowed into the park and had to go to the customer assistance window. Each time we went to the window, we were told that our passes were not set up properly. The Concierge floor was o.k. As someone pointed out in an earlier post, there was no reasonable place in the hotel to go for breakfast so it was very convenient and economical to have access to the continental breakfast every morning. Each evening they had good appeteizers including one hot dish. My only complaint regarding the concierge service, was that they were veyr slow to refill the wine. One night I was not able to find any wine and could not find anyone to restock it. The location is fairly good and is within walking distance to Epcot. The bus service to/from Magic Kingdom was so so. Sometimes it took only about 10 minutes, but other times we had to wait upwards of a half hour. The pools were great, and my kids loved the waterslide and lazy river. I don't know if it was because of the time of year, but every night starting at around 4 PM, there were thousands of very annoying black bugs swarming around the pool. They didn't bite, but made sitting by the pool very annoying. I guess you are paying for the location, the pools, and a decent room, but I still think they grossly overcharge for their rooms. Rooms at a standard Marriott, Hyatt, etc. are much nicer and a third of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Memories of Disney's Yacht Club”
Reviews.Author: CherylD7275
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 9 day stay at the Disney's Yacht Club. It was fabulous! Right when we got there we were greeted by the Captain in the Lobby and proceeded to check in. We were fortunate to have met the Manager and he came over to us and upgraded us to a water view room. It was so amazing. We had a view of the boardwalk and Epcot. We could see the fireworks from our balcony at night. The boardwalk is beautiful at night and they have some great outdoor entertainers - very comical. The pool is by far the best pool in all the Disney's Resorts. The sandy bottom pool and sand bar for the kids was fantastic. The lifeguard activities throughout the day were so much fun and it really made you feel special. The sing-a-along campfire and movie each night was a real bonus too. Everyone is so nice there. The maid was incredible too. The rooms were very spacious and very nice. The character breakfast was very good at the May Cafe. The variety of food was wonderful. I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. You will not be disappointed if you stay here. It is money well spent. We will be back again! Hope your trip is as magical as ours!

Reviews.Title: “Best Ever!”
Reviews.Author: afriesen2
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at other Disney resorts, but this one by far the BEST!!!!!!!! The room was very clean and tidy. The maid service was very good. The resort and grounds were beautiful ! The pool was awesome The best part were the short walks to Epcot. Would recommend this resort to anyone! Cannot wait til we return!

Reviews.Title: “The Snoot Club!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jersue96
Reviews.Content: we had planned our trip for over a year. we had booked our stay at the animal kingdom as we had stayed there in december and loved it. We had booked a standard room at animal kingdom with 2 queen beds. upon arrival we were told that they had overbooked and we were going to have a different room. when we finally found the room, it was near the pool, our patio was right in front of the hot tub and not to mention the pool pump was noisy. not a good thing with our autistic child. we spent over 2 hours trying to remedy this. since they had no rooms they sent us to the yacht club. we were not pleased, foremost, we are average middle class family, not uppity snooty, better than you type of folks. when i went to make a dinner change reservation the man asked if i was staying there, I guess I didnt fit the uppity yuppy prototype. the resort was dated, housekeeping was great, but it was definetly not our cup of tea. not to mention the poisonous snake that greeted my husband as he tried to come in after doing the laundry. we will not stay there again and dont recommend it to the average joe. If you are looking for a nice resort, try saratoga springs. we did the bounceback and will stay there next august. I cant say anything bad about the resort other than it was not our disney favorite as we are not trying to keep up with the jonses. It was quite comical to see some of the wanna bee richies!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ahhhh, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: caam04
Reviews.Content: We checked into Disney's Yacht Club Resort for a 3 night stay after beginning our vacation at another Walt Disney World Resort. This was our first time at the Yacht Club and while we'd heard good reviews, we were anxious to experience it ourselves. When we arrived we checked in with the security guard at the booth on property. We were greeted by name and escorted into the gorgeous lobby where check-in was fabulous (and our room was ready at 10am and we were given a room with a gorgeous view despite booking a standard room). The room was spacious and extremely comfortable. Our 1st floor balcony overlooked the wedding gazebo. Stormalong Bay was, by far, the biggest plus of the resort for us. Our kids loved spending the days in the sandy bottom pool building sand castles and participating in the daily events held by the lifeguards. The boat transportation to Disney's Hollywood Studios and Epcot was convenient and reliable. The view of Disney's Boardwalk Resort from across the water was gorgeous (especially at night) and we LOVED that we were able to watch movies on the beach at night. Everything about our stay was fantastic and we will absolutely return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Yacht Club is Great!”
Reviews.Author: Tuckers
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th trip to Disney World and we have stayed onsite for all. This was our first stay at the Yacht Club (we have stayed at the Beach Club, Beach Club Villas, Contemporary Resort and Port Orleans Riverside). I have to say that the Yacht Club is our favorite so far. We were upgraded to a water view room, which was in a great location. We were in room 4075. We had a view of not only the lagoon, and wedding gazebo, we could also see Illuminations from our balcony. What a treat. Check in was a breeze. Took less than 5 minutes. The staff at the front desk were courteous and helpful. We used the Magical Express service, which really is convenient. You put the supplied yellow tags on your luggage at your home airport and magically your bags appear in your hotel room a couple hours after you check in. We did not use the transportation part of the service because we needed to have a rental car. The lobby of the Yacht Club is very classy, and not like a typical Disney resort. Its calm, relaxing and we liked it. Our room was spotless upon arrival. We thought it was very pretty, too. The beds were very comfortable, and the crisp sheets were nice. The room had two queen beds, and a chair w/ottoman. There was a nice desk, and a dresser with a tv on it and a nice empty frig for our use. Then there is another dresser by the closet/bathroom, which was nice. The bathroom area is great because there are two sinks, with plenty of counterspace that is separate from the toilet/shower/tub area. So it was easy for more than one person to get ready at once. The room could use updating, but it was just fine. We thoroughly enjoyed it. We really liked having the balcony, and our view was wonderful. Even though it was raining most of the time, we'd sit out there and enjoy the view. The pool area is spectacular. We were there during hurricane Fay, or should I say Tropical Storm Fay which dumped INCHES and INCHES of rain on the area. So we didnt get much use out of the pool. It was raining 95% of the time. We did get to go sit in the jacuzzi one evening, and we played some ping pong there by the beach. Most of the time, however, it was just miserable out so we never went down to swim. The pool has so many areas, there is a sandy area with a very shallow pool for the little ones, a lazy river area, a big water slide, lots of other pool areas for swimming. We've been there in the past and the pool does get quite crowded and sometimes its hard to find chairs. They do ask for resort ID at this pool, because its probably the best one in all of the disney resorts. There is another pool on the edge of the resort, which is next to the larger laundry room. Because of the weather, we didnt get to enjoy that one either. But I did use the laundry room. It was $2 to wash and another $2 to dry. Believe it or not the dryer actually dried our clothes in one use. They sell soap and stuff in there, but we brought our own. I dont know how much the soap costs. Our room was cleaned very nicely each day. We had Bertha as our housekeeper and she was very pleasant. We left her a tip each day, and I think she really appreciated it. She left us little towel animals, and we always had restocked items. We used bell services a couple times (we had a pkg delivered) and they were always prompt and friendly. I have no complaints at all re: the staff. Everyone was very helpful and friendly. Even the people who worked in the little store were overly helpful. The only downside to this resort: the buses. They are slow! Very slow! You have to share with the Beach Club, Boardwalk, Swan and Dolphin. This makes for some packed buses and long waits. Standing in the rain for 20 minutes is NOT fun. Then the bus finally comes and its full! This is one thing that they should change. If you stay here, or even if you dont. Go eat at Beaches & Cream. Its right out by the pool. They have great burgers, fries, onion rings and ICE CREAM! We loved it. We ate there twice. Once for lunch and another time for dessert. I will definitely stay here again. Loved the resort. Got great service from everyone we encountered. If they ever get the bus thing figured out, this would be the perfect place!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Yacht Club”
Reviews.Author: need2travel2
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the Disney's Yacht Club from April 19-25. The hotel is beautiful with a very "New England Seaside" feel to it. Our check-in was handled quickly by the very pleasant front desk staff and our standard room was very nice. One word of warning here though, we were on the front side of the resort right over bell services which was rather noisy-buses & garbage trucks & the magic express bus coming and going starting at 5:00am-talk about a loud wake-up every day! Our room was clean, spacious and nicely furnished. The proximity to Epcot and the Boardwalk could not be beat!! Just a nice 5-10 minute stroll to both & about a 10-15 minute stroll along the water to Hollywood Studios. Stormalong Bay was just the ticket for an afternoon away from the parks, the lazy river was very relaxing. The hotel also has movies on the beach at night. I didn't feel the "disney magic" here, it felt much more like a nice upscale hotel with great service, very nice decor & beautiful landscaping than "Mickey's House" but overall it was a great place to stay & I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: leeala
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the Yacht Club. My husband and I with our children, ages 10 and 11, just returned from a Disney Land and Sea Package. The first part of our trip we spent four nights at Disney's Yacht Club. About the bad reviews - if you are looking for a 5 star, Ritz Carlton experience, then this is not the hotel for you. But, if you are looking for a fun, laid back, all around good hotel (3.5 - 4 star), then the Yacht Club is a great place. Yes, the decor probably needs to be updated, but the rooms are clean and comfortable. Really, for as much time as you spend in your room, this is a fine property. And I truly believe if you look for the negatives, you will find them - if you are positive, then you will see the good. Our room was on the second floor close to the elevators and stairs with two queen size beds and a day bed. The beds were very, very comfortable and the room was a decent size. The bathroom has the shower/toilet separate from the vanity which makes it easy for four people to get ready. The very best part of the hotel is its amazing 3-acre sand bottom pool - the pool alone is worth the stay! The workout room looked very nice though we didn't use. We ate at the breakfast buffet in the Yacht Club twice, both times were very good. We grabbed clam chowder, sandwiches, and salads from the Market two nights while the kids swam. The transportation system could be improved, but we all decided that it was not worth getting upset about. The buses are full because they stop at the Yacht, Beach, Boardwalk, Swan, and Dolphin Hotels - more than the other buses. You can take the boat to Epcot or walk. I do not suggest walking to Disney Hollywood Studios in the heat - take the boat. We spent two days at the parks and two days at Downtown Disney - one day shopping and one day at Disney Quest. I would definitely stay at the Yacht Club again - maybe next summer!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but service has declined...”
Reviews.Author: Sharonb423
Reviews.Content: We have been big fans of Disney for years and have always stayed on property for the convenience. We have tried many different resorts but had not stayed at any of the villas until this trip. Room location was great - we were able to see the fireworks from our balcony - and spacious enough but had several small problems that were directly related to service. Also were able to walk to a back entrance to Epcot with no lines! A big perk! Upon checking into our room, we took off our shoes and our socks were immediately soaked! The rugs were just cleaned (a good thing I guess!) but the floors were thoroughly drenched. When we called downstairs they confirmed the rugs were recently cleaned and that we should open the balcony doors to help speed the drying process. I understood they couldn't change our room as we had committed to that particular villa for the week but still... We ordered room service on Monday night and set the tray outside in the interior hallway after dinner. In the morning it had not been picked up. Upon returning from the parks that day, it was still in the hall (24 hours now). On our way out that evening, I stopped at the front desk to let them know it was still there and I would like it removed. Upon returning late that evening it was STILL THERE! I called down to the front desk and asked them to have it removed. When we left midmorning on Wednesday it was STILL THERE! I don't make a habit of misbehaving in hotels however after almost 2 days the food was getting a bit nasty in the humidity. Never mind that there was a maid's cart in the hall both mornings and it wasn't something she seemed interested in picking up. So I slid the tray into the middle of the hallway and left it there. If it was still there when I returned that day (it was not) I figured I would walk it downstairs and leave it on the reception counter. A few years ago that tray would have disappeared moments after it was set down in the hallway - magically! Staff service was not as helpful and friendly in the past overall. This Disney property has become "just another hotel" in my eyes, completely lacking the Disney service and attitude we have come to love.

Reviews.Title: “Yacht Club made our stay at Disney World an unforgettable one!”
Reviews.Author: Fab5Family
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 (kids ages, 13, 10 & 7) have been planning a Disney World trip for several years. At the time that we booked our vacation, a big decision was where we were going to stay. We read a lot of reviews, and from the reviews and talking to our travel agent (Yacht Club allows 5 to a room), we decided on the Yacht Club! It was one of the best decisions we made about our trip, and will stay again when we go back to Disney World. I don't know what other traveler's EXPECT when they go on vacation, but the hotel and rooms are very nice!!! For 5 people, we felt very comfortable. 2 queen beds and a day bed perfect for our 7 year old. They keep the hotel VERY clean, and are constantly keeping it that way! Our room was more than adequate and the maid service did an excellent job providing towels, and cleaning up the room each day. If you get the chance, take advantage of a day at the hotel. Our children insisted to skip an afternoon at Magic Kingdom to go back to the Yacht Club for a few hours to swim in their awecome beachside pool, and relax at the hotel. We are so glad we did. That was one of the best parts of our trip! Also, we recommend going to the "Market" at the Beach Club just next door for snacks and drinks for your room or to take along to the parks! We ate breakfast here almost every morning, and saved $$ because we decided NOT to take the dining plan. Also, the character restaurant at the Beach Club is well worth the money, but book as soon as you arrive as it fills up fast. We also recommend taking an evening to spend around the Boardwalk in the back of the Yacht and Beach Club Resorts. There is always a lot to see and do that is entertaining, and we highly recommend taking a family bike ride on one of the Boardwalks bikes for 4 or 5. We had more laughs with this then we did all week. The staff is very friendly, and we were welcomed "home" every day after a full day at the parks. What a nice way to end the day. We would definitely stay here again! It was one of the best parts of our trip! I would say that if you only like the "Ritz" to stay, then go someplace else, but you would be missing out on a vacation of a lifetime!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not What I Expected”
Reviews.Author: DTNPROMAN
Reviews.Content: This hotel is average overall and dated. The decor looks like it hasn't been updated since the early 90's. You will certainly see this the moment you step on the elevator if you hadn't noticed it in the lobby. The TV in the room is an old Philips. One might expect an LCD at a "Deluxe" resort, but no. Something else that was disappointing is that we could only get luke warm water, never hot, for the shower/tub. The ice machine on our floor didn't work. Vending machines are only on the first floor in a "Guest Laundry" area which is way out of the way, and after the trip, none of them would take our money or cards. I would suggest checking out other "Deluxe" lodging in the area if that is what you are expecting for the price. This property needs attention.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: MadHatter08
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent a week at Disney's Yacht Club Resort. Our experience there was nothing but positive. We absolutely loved it and can't wait to go back! We booked a waterview room with a king sized bed. The hotel room was very large with plenty of walking room, sitting area and balcony. The room didn't feel cramped at all. We had a beautiful view of the marina from our room. We experienced nothing but wonderful service from all the employees. Everyone was friendly and helpful. We found the resort great for couples! The very best thing about the Yacht Club is it's location. It is walking distance to Epcot and MGM. It is also within steps of other Disney resort properties - Beach Club and the Boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Ended up her because my dad got the flu”
Reviews.Author: jameygamer
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed here because my dad got the flu and our reservation ran out at the Beach Club. It's extremely nic, pretty much the same as the Beach Club. If you want to know more about my stay at these hotels, please check out my review of the Beach Club. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: smile5
Reviews.Content: Family of four (two children 8 & 5) just returned to NY from Yacht Club. Incredible vacation - was upgarded to Concierge Level - service was wonderful - they could not have done more for us. We had a water view on the 5th floor - actually preferred this hotel way more than the Beach Club. Did not have to even leave the resort if we did not want to . Can't wait to go back - Darvin Nunez was an incredible employee who welcomed my children with open arms :) Thank you so much!!

Reviews.Title: “too corporate...”
Reviews.Author: carol_a_2004
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from disney and the yacht club...we have stayed there 5 times before. We always stay at beach, yacht or boardwalk. Our room was great and location too. On this visit the hotel was full with corporate people going to conventions and I felt like I was attending one too. The people made a definite effort to make sure you knew they were working. At times it felt uncomfortable to be on the elevator with a bathing suit cover up on...and do not try to get a bite to eat while they are on the lunch break. I know conventions are a money maker for the resort, but does it have to be at the expense of a family looking for the magic?

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel-don't understand the bad reviews!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cheermom4
Reviews.Content: From start to finish, I can honestly say this hotel provided a wonderful expereince. Upon arrival the staff could not do enough for us and were always asking what they could do to make it better. There were numerous food choices, rooms were beautiful, and there were tons of things all over the place for the kids to do. To save some $$, I recommend skipping the huge buffets breakfasts and just grabbing a lite breakfast at the counter just off the lobby which had milk, juice, coffee, cereal and various bagels and muffins and fruit-it ended up costing me 1/2 of the other breakfasts OR just going to the store at the beach club and buying milk and juice in a carton with mini donuts and keeping it in the fridge in your room...they made it very easy. The additional convenience is that this hotel is connected to Disney's Beach Club so you really get two hotels in one. The pool area is the most amazing my husband and I had seen...it really provides a safe area for small children to play with the sand bottom and very shallow play area. My non-swimming three year old could play while we sat a few feet away and watched her while my 12 year old was floating around the lazy river. They also had the Hurricane Hanna Grill open at the pool from morning until night so you had many food choices while you were there-not to mention that you were a very easy and scenic 5 minute walk from the Epcot World Showcase area with all the countries to shoose from. Each morning upon entering the lobby and also when we returned back to the hotel for the day there were several people whose entire job it was to greet us and see if we needed anything at all. I would never stay anywhere else when returning to Disney!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in Room 4210!!”
Reviews.Author: NMNativeinDallas
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Disney Yacht Club for a business conference and was not overly impressed. For the prices they charge, I was expecting a much more luxurious hotel. The grounds (landscaping, pool area) were nice but the rooms were standard at best. But then again, it is Disney, so I should have known that prices would be inflated for everything. The first night I stayed in room 4210 which was directly over the valet and delivery area and next to the freight elevator. I was so tired when I got to my room that I didn't notice this until after I was already in bed and began hearing luggage carts rolling around, the delivery trucks beeping as they backed up and the very loud clunking and thunking of whatever was being transported in the freight elevator. The next day, I had conference sessions until the afternoon so I went to the front desk around 3pm to request to be moved to another room. The girl told me that they typically do not change rooms after 11pm. After a short discussion, she was able to change my room to another mediocre room but at least there was less noise. I expressed my feelings to her that I donâ€™t understand why they would put anyone in that room but she did not have a response for that. Overall, the staff at the property was nice and friendly. I spent one afternoon at the pool which is very pretty but not relaxing at all because of all of the screaming kids. Again, I know that is to be expected at Disney. I would not return to this resort nor Disney World in general.

Reviews.Title: “Not at all what we expected”
Reviews.Author: kbergmann
Reviews.Content: I'm dumbfounded by all the positive reviews of this hotel! My husband and I are frequent business travelers and have a lot of domestic and international hotel experience and have never paid so much for so little. I agree the grounds and lobby area of the hotel are beautiful and (seemingly) clean - but the entire experience goes downhill on the journey down the very long room corridors. The hotel - beyond the lobby - is certainly showing wear and tear and corresponding filth. The experience just does not match the price tag - for Ritz-type prices, just know that this aint the Ritz. The first 'upgraded' room we were in was just plain dirty. My first and worst complaint is of cockroaches. Right there in plain view. Beyond that - there's no attention to detail whatsoever (for example, someone had obviously spilled some sort of liquid on the top of the dresser - which had been wiped, but the spill continued all down the front). The TV looked like something from another era. Again, for a premium price, isn't it reasonable to expect a premium experience? The second room (not wanting to bunk with the cockroaches) was slightly more clean and had a post- year 2000 TV, but again we had cockroach issues. When addressed with a manager, she seemed shocked that we were the first complaint of cockroaches - for the week. Perhaps a bouquet of flowers would make us feel better? There were numerous other examples of this just not meeting up to what we think of as a Disney-experience. We really were surprised at all the ways they fell down on cleanliness and overall hotel management. We cannot recommend this hotel in good faith and our experience makes us question all of the Disney -run properties. If this is the best they have to offer, no thanks.

Reviews.Title: “A true Disney experience”
Reviews.Author: tripper1988
Reviews.Content: What can I say, the property, rooms and service were outstanding. Was there for a business conference and they did a wonderful job.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Disney-run Resort at WDW”
Reviews.Author: Tax_Counsel
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Swan/Dolphin resort during our last five trips to WDW we decided to splurge and stay at a Disney-run hotel. Wanting to stay within Boardwalk resort area, my wife and I agreed on the Yacht Club Resort. Check in would have been mostly painless but for the fact they placed us right next to the loading dock of the Dolphin hotel; complete with an idling semi. So much for wanting to â€œget awayâ€� from the Starwood hotels. The front desk did try to fight our request for a room change, but relented after politely explaining the need for a quiet roomâ€”which was noted in our reservation. Our room was very clean and well-maintained. â€œHidden Mickeysâ€� were everywhere: bed spreads, wall-mirror frame, carpet, bath fixtures . . . you get the idea. The nautical theme was carried throughout nearly every feature of the room (except the TV). Solid marble counter-tops for the sinks and the marble-tiled bathroom were especially nice. Our daughter loved the day bed which she used in lieu of the second queen-size bed, she said: â€œItâ€™s just my size!â€� We enjoyed the refrigerator which was included. We visited the resort during mid-December, all the public areas were decorated beautifully for Christmas. The Christmas trees in the lobby and the large-scale train set fascinated our daughter. The Christmas theme also included nightly entertainment by local choirs and storytellers in the hotel lobby. That type of entertainment differentiates this property from the lower-end resorts. Bell service at the resort was prompt and helpful, upon arrival and upon check out. Valet parking also worked very well at this resort; driving to the Magic and Animal Kingdoms shaved about 30 minutes off our travel time compared to Disney Transport. Waiting for Disney buses can be a real drag, especially with a three-year old. The sundries store in the lobby was very well stocked. It carried several items that I expected I would have needed to obtain off-site. You do pay a slight premium for that convenience. The pool area for the Yacht / Beach Club resorts is gorgeous, with a waterslide and significant amounts of tropical landscaping. We found the exterior public areas of the resort to be a fun adventure all on their own. The dock on the lake provides an excellent viewing location for the fireworks at EPCOT. Dining choices are amazing if you count the hotelâ€™s restaurants along with the restaurants at the Boardwalk across the artificial lake. Character breakfast buffet was fully bookedâ€¦good thing we had a reservation. Our only other complaint was the cleanliness of an out-of-the-way elevator towards the Westside of the hotel. It had tarnished brass fittings, numerous scuff marks and crusty food stuck in the door tracks. It remained that way for the duration of our stay despite our call to housekeeping. All in all this property is nicer and better maintained than the Swan/Dolphin properties; I suggest staying at the Yacht Club if the price per night is within $50. Otherwise, the Swan/Dolphin is a better value.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelmore149362
Reviews.Content: Just enjoyed 3 nights at the Yacht Club. Asked for, and got, a direct lakefront view. This was very nice- we could see Boardwalk across the way. The room was quite spacious for the 2 of us (daughter and me). Some odd things- the alarm clock/radio/IPod player was incredibly bright- acted as an unwanted night light. On the way out, I was asked if I wanted to complete a survey about my stay. I agreed because I wanted to say how nice the place was- but the computer they gave me to use was balky and difficult, and I gave up altogether when I got to the question "What did I expect to find in the room?" Also, the A/C was not on a thermostat- it just ran until I shut it off. But these are minor nitpicky details- the hotel was beautiful, staff was excellent, and the location could not be beat. Particularly want to point out the prompt and friendly room service, including the pick-up of the used dishes, and the great staff at Captain's Grille restaurant at the hotel. Housekeeping was impeccable. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ucdavis
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel to find out that there computer system were down. This meant that we could not check into our room until there system came back online. However after about 3 hours of waiting we were able to check into our hotel room. Our overall experience of this hotel was average. Our room was a little on the small size. There actual bathroom is VERY small. For the price you pay to stay here we were a little dissapointed. However the location of the hotel made up for the average room. Were were a ten minute walk away from epcot. The hotel was right on the boardwalk so we had plenty of things to do close to our room. Overall I might use this hotel again if the prices were a little less expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here for the location”
Reviews.Author: IndianaTravelmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over spring break with our 7 year old twins. The location is a 10 minute walk to the back entrance of EPCOT(ie the part with the international themed restaurants)-very convenient if you like to try dinners with an international flair. Keep in mind that once you are in EPCOT it could be up to another 15 minute walk to get to some of the restaurants(Norway and Mexico). The other huge attraction of this hotel is the fabulous pool complex with its sandy bottom,small toddler sandy beach area and 2 slides(a huge thrill slide and another more tame slide our kids loved). This is shared with the Beach Club but never seemed uncomfortably crowded even though we were at Disney at peak time. Overall I prefer the Beach Club which is closer still to EPCOT. One complaint is that this pool complex doesn't open until 10am-we would have liked the chance to swim some mornings before heading to the park. The "Boardwalk" area which is an easy walk to the other side of the "lake" has nice restaurants too(Spoodles and Flying Fish Cafe are both good choices) as well as fun activities like surrey bikes,jugglers,etc. While we were there the Yacht Club also had nightly campfire with S'Mores kits-one of our kids' favorite memories of the trip. Definitely recommend scheduling some extra time for your trip so you can enjoy the hotel area and escape the crowds and heat of the parks. Rooms are satisfactory-nothing special for the price you are paying(it's all about the location). Also, we got connecting rooms and weren't able to get one with a king as requested(had 2 queens and a daybed)-were told few rooms have kings. Did experience more hallway noise than we have on numerous previous trips(parents allowing kids to scream and yell at the top of their lungs at 10pm when our kids were in bed). Also note that fireworks are at 9:00 each night and there is about 15 minutes of loud booming if you have kids who are sensitive to that(on a plus note-we could see some of the fireworks outside our window). We did the Magical Express bus service and luggage delivery-loved the lack of hassle!!! Staff was friendly but the little Disney touches we've come to expect were missing(eg always left tips for the maids but no animals made out of washcloths and other little kid pleasers). As an aside, we did the Disney princess dinner at the Norway restaurant and while the food was good we really did not appreciate being totally rushed through our meal(literally walking back from the salad bar when our entree was being delivered).

Reviews.Title: “Good Disney hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: vicki.m.e
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 5 nights in the Yacht Club, it was very pleasant. There were 4 of us, 2 being teenagers, so we had 2 interconnecting rooms. The rooms were a good size with comfortable beds and a good view over the lake. They were occasionally noisy caused by other guests in the corridor, but this was not too much of a problem. The hotel location is great for Epcot and Disney Hollywood Studios, both within easy walking distance, although a boat is also provided for transportation to both which is very pleasant. Its location was particularly recommended by our children One grumble is that given how expensive the rooms are, the extra $10 a day charge for internet access seemed unnecessary (many cheaper hotels no longer charge anything). Also, I accept that we were there at a busy time being just after Easter, but there was no chance of a lounger near the pool and there were very few umbrellas to give shade. We would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a 'familymoon!'”
Reviews.Author: nickihof
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days at Club level as part of our honeymoon with the children. I considered all disney deluxe properties but chose Yacht Club because of great reviews and the possibility to walk/boat to Epcot and Disney Studios. We booked directly with Disney USA which was cheaper than booking with Disney UK. Booking concierge level certainly makes you feel a VIP, with personalised attention from the minute we arrived. Our room was decorated with banners and ballons for our honeymoon, which although embarrassing for my teenage daughter, just added to the celebratory feel of the trip. Club level also helps secure hard to get dinner reservations. We also paid for valet parking, with the pound/dollar exchange rate it didn't seem too extravagant and was also valid for the GF when we went there for the Cinderella dinner.
