The biggest hit for our 5 year old was the pool - it's all other reviewers have said and more. Needless to say she found it hard to leave to go to the parks. The rooms are fine, spacious but without any wow factor. The club food service is adequate, worth more for convenience rather than any gastronomic delight. Is club level worth the extra cost?- most probably not. Would we return to the Yacht Club ? - most definitely yes. The pool, the level of service and most importantly the proximity to the parks made this hotel score highly for us. We wanted our holiday to be about relaxation as well as park fun - staying at the Yacht Club fulfilled our expectations. It is not in your face Disney, it is not overrun with children and it has a slightly expensive feel about it. If the exchange rate stays as it is we could be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “it's perfect!”
Reviews.Author: love4maui9697
Reviews.Content: LOVED this hotel (and I can be pretty picky)...the rooms are very nice and clean, there is a fairly large giftshop/convenience store in the gorgeous, nautical-themed lobby, and the pool is AMAZING! It has a SAND BOTTOM! There is a lazy river, a big slide and did I mention a SAND BOTTOM? You feel like you are in the ocean! There is a great ice cream place and an outdoor grill for lunch. There is also a nice steakhouse. There are water taxis that will take you across the little lake to the Boardwalk Beach Resort (or you can walk, its not far at all) where you can shop and eat. This hotel made my first WDW experience so memorable! I loved it as much as the actual park! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great repeat Yacht Club stay”
Reviews.Author: WDWforus
Reviews.Content: We were at the Yacht Club last August, and decided to go back for our first spring break stay. The prices were higher due to time of year but I wasn't worried about our value. When we checked on March 20 we were directed to room 3118. After a few twists and turns we were in the far corner of the resort overlooking a service road and trees. Since the room was kind of in a nook of the hall it was a little smaller as well--the door was not at the end of the room but on the side wall, and the dresser was at the far end. I was kind of bummed after our great wedding gazebo view last year and my husband went off to try and get us moved or even to a water view, but they said they were 100% full, no moves for us. On the second night, though, we had a plumbing issue that continued into the next morning--not good with 3 older kids 9,12,16. When they woke I had to send them to the lobby to use the bathroom. The carpet was damp from the previous evening as well. My husband went down to the desk to see what we could do, and the manager immediately said she would move us. We went to the studios and came back about 2 and were moved to room 4078. This room had a much nicer ambience and overlooked the YC quiet pool. Husband had offered to pay for an upgrade but she said this was on them, since the plumbing problem did not get resolved. Our housekeeping service was fine. We saw the mousekeeper a couple of times and she seemed very friendly. We did end up losing DS's wallet the day we left and have called but no sign of it, but that's not their fault. We also used the pool and won a trivia contest and won a Disney trivial pursuit game. We also used the "mouse boats", and my oldest and I laid out in the sun while my husband and my other two kids rented a surrey bike. We ate Easter Dinner at the Yachtsman and it was the best steak we have ever had. There is so much to do at this hotel and many activities to choose from. We have just joined DVC so I don't know if I'll ever have to stay in a regular WDW resort again, but if I do the YC is definately my favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Experience I cant wait to repeat!!!”
Reviews.Author: AndyMoores
Reviews.Content: Stayed in many of the WDW hotels over the years, including the Grand Floridian, but the Yacht Club was the best. GF plush but a little too stuffy-the YC have got it just perfect. On arrival we told the reception of our `eventful` journey from Britain & problems with the UK side of the holiday, strait away after gentle probing from reception, she discovered we were there to celebrate our anniversary & my birthday, they gave us an unexpected free room upgrade and from that moment on everything just got better. It`s our silver wedding anniversary next year and are positive we`ll be going back there! We loved the location, staff, friendliness, room & view, everything was clean and nothing too much trouble. Keep the Grand Floridian, give me the Yacht Club any time - Congratulations to them for giving me the most perfect holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: KAHS
Reviews.Content: Absolutely beautiful. Traveled to Disney with my family (2 adults, 3 kids). Very clean hotel. The pools were incredible. The rooms were nice/clean. We had two queen size beds and a sofa. The boat was right out our back door. We rented a car so we drove to the parks (which is free parking since staying at a Disney hotel). There a water slide in one of the pools. You could rent water rafts and float around the one pool. There was sand in the bottom of the one pool (which my children loved). The outside bar/grille was very good. There was an outdoor ice-cream parlor that stayed open late. Beautiful grounds. Walking distance to Disney Boardwalk. Staff was VERY friendly. Complimentary apples in lobby all day. Excellent hotel. The room is a little small for 5 people, but we weren't in the room that much for it to bother us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Nantucket2007
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay here - it's not cheap - but what a worthwhile stay. Immaculate, lovely rooms - and we lucked out with a view of the lagoon (and nightly fireworks to boot) and I loved the decor. The wood and brass and blue carpet with stars and ribbons. The location is perfect - on the Boardwalk, attached to the Beach Club and walking distance to Epcot. There was a great choice of restaurants and places to relax (sometimes hard to get a reservation at the restaurants or a drink at the pool bar, but that's all of Disney - very popular!). This place is just top notch - clean and so well appointed - the absolute perfect balance between elegance and total laid back comfort. Families and Honeymooners - everyone seemed to be loving it. The Yacht club also has great amenities, fabulous beds and just first class all the way. Attentive staff. I thoroughly enjoyed my time here.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Outdated Decor”
Reviews.Author: BGDUDE
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Yacht Club Resort for 4 nights at the end of January,2007.The room location could not have been any better for the views and convenient outside access.The room itself was a little outdated and kinda' rough, but not dirty at all.The proximity to the Disney parks was good for walking if you enjoy Epcot and Hollywood Studios(MGM).Overall, if this was our only choice we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “uncomfortably cold indoors”
Reviews.Author: travel182
Reviews.Content: The Yacht Club has keep all indoor public spaces (both at the hotel and at the conference center) so cold that the stay has been downright uncomfortable. Repeated requests to management to turn down the air conditioner in the conference room have led to only minimal improvements. Many attendees have been wearing jackets and thick, heavy sweaters despite outdoor temperatures that have ranged from the mid-80's to the mid-50's, and the widespread discomfort has created something of a disruption to the meetings. Expect cold blasts of air as you walk through the hotel hallways, and a somewhat better but still quite chilly lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the best in Disney”
Reviews.Author: wallywanna
Reviews.Content: A very nice location and facility in the Hollywood Studio / Epcot area. Felt "special" when walked in with multiple greetings. Front desk staff was accomodating with request for specific room type. I had faxed my request ahead and it was met. Rooms could be cleaned better, in particular the bathrooms. Grout needs to be cleaned once in a while as well as baseboards - certainly for these prices in my opinion. The hotel does have an (in my opinion) annoying program of dropping pre-recorded voice mail messages on the phone at all hours of the day/night. Though the phone doesn't ring, when I notice the message light flashing at 1:30 AM I find a need to check for emergency messages... and instead get the recorded "greeting" of the hotel GM or restaurant manager. For a wide range of activities, places to eat, and quality of service however, I do think the Yacht club is the best in Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Yacht Club!”
Reviews.Author: LizzBrooklyn_NY
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Yacht Club 2/04 - 2/08. Magnificent resort. This was our second trip to a Disney Resort, having stayed at The Grand Floridian last year. The GF is truley opulent, and is the "RitzCarlton of Disney," but I prefer the Yacht Club, and beleive it offers a better all around vacation. I'll try to keep this short... 1. Location - A short, lovely walk of ferry to Epcot's back door. About 20 minutes to Magic Kingdom by bus, and 10 minutes to Downtown Disney. A 2 minute ferry to the Boardwalk. The GF is far more isolated. You can't walk to any of the attractions, and can only ferry to Magic Kingdom. The wait for buses is short, and pleasant. 2. Pool - The best. Amazingly, it was never crowded. Closes around 9pm. 3. Staff - Excellent. 4. Food - Pretty good, but for amazing food, ferry over to the Boardwalk, for dinner @ Spoodles, or The Flying Fish Cafe. Make reservations in advance. 5. Room - Beautiful, comfortable, and elegant. They look much better than the pictures. Large balconies. The most comfortable beds. There are very slight signs of wear, but they add to the charm. The bathroom in our room was poorly ventilated. 6. Atmosphere - Elegant, relaxed, inviting, tranquil, and fun. Very beautiful property. Far better in person. Pictures make it look "boring."

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with the YC”
Reviews.Author: mickeyrm
Reviews.Content: I arrived with high expectaions and left with regret. The Disney experiece ended when we left the lobby. There were room service trays left for hours and sometimes days in the maze of hallways leading to our room. We were not given coffee cream or sugar , even after writing a note to request it. The tissue box in the bathroom was left unfilled for two days and was only replaced when we called the front desk. The shampoo and soaps were never replenished and a light that was reported buned out was never repaired during our entire stays. (5 days). I have had superior service at other Disney resorts but was extremely disappointed with my stay at the Yacht Club.

Reviews.Title: “Wow could you say LOCATION!?”
Reviews.Author: littlej888
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research to find a place to stay in WDW. Yacht Club had very little negative reviews compared to others so I scheduled my trip (12/12/07-12/15/07)so I could stay there. I also liked that it said Epcot was walking distance or by boat (MGM too by boat). AND since besides Disney, we love the beach so why not have the best of both worlds? This resort exceeded our expectations. The theme was great, the shuttle/boat service A+. The pools were neat (we rented rafts $3 for an hour or $10 for the day one afternoon when we decided to sit by pool and do park later). But unfortunatley the pools close early so if you get back from the park you can't go in the pools or even the hot tub. We did get ice cream at Beaches and Cream and sat by the pool and on the beach area at nite, B&C is open until 11pm. The place was clean, rooms nice (though it could be a long walk from lobby to room so bring whatever you need for a few hours if you go out or by the pool). The place wasn't overrun by kids, there was a nice mix of kids and adults. I would recommend it for couples too. The pools are great for the kids, a waterslide, one pool is all sand and they could play in the sand...just watch the ducks, they like to swim in the pool. There is also a 'quiet' pool secluded in another area of the resort. The layout is nice, the Beach Club resort is next door, and the Boardwalk resort is across the lake (we walked around it one nite, very nice), Swan/Dolphin to the other side. We dont mind walking but we heard different opinions about how far Epcot is so we decided to take the boat there for the first time. Picked us up at the lighthouse, picked up people at the Boardwalk and went under this little bridge and boat stopped...we were like, huh? why are we stopped? Well, to our surprise it WAS EPCOT! We were cracking up, how close it was! We could've walked there in 5 minutes! So rest of trip, it was walk to and from Epcot. It's literally next door to the Beach Club. SOOO convenient!!! I really enjoyed this resort and the decor (Xmas too) and would definately return again. No complaints about the staff, they were great. I'm not sure about 'extras' such as what they do if you are celebrating something. We didn't 'get' anything extra that you couldn't get at a typical hotel so I don't know if that would put people off (maybe they do more if you have kids with you) but it didn't bother us one bit because the location and ammenities were enough to fully satisfy us. If you are looking for a beautiful deluxe resort that's a bit low key this is it! Note: Disney Magical Express - DO IT! You hardly have to deal w/your luggage even when you leave! They have curbside check-in of your luggage AT the resort(til 1pm I think)- they take the luggage and print your boarding pass, and they will hold your carryons in the lobby if you have a later flight and are going out for the day.

Reviews.Title: “For convenience to epcot/mgm, this is your best bet!”
Reviews.Author: skateycat
Reviews.Content: For the best bet in convenience to Epcot and MGM theme park (and I mean both within easy walking distance) this is your place! Staff is friendly, pools are available for both kids and quiet areas for adults. Movies on the beach at night, nightlife on the boardwalk with lots of family fun. Stayed here for a Christmas trip with my 18-yr old niece and 19-yr old stepdaughter. They loved it. It was also convenient to take the bus to other disney areas such as magic kingdom and animal kingdom as well as downtown disney. This is definitely worth the money, especially with small kids. you can walk to the park and back if they get "cranky". also, babysitting is available until midnight. restaurants are wonderful with lots of food choices. oh, check out the pool bar also...great drinks and treats!

Reviews.Title: “A swing and a miss”
Reviews.Author: JBCR_Travel
Reviews.Content: A "Deluxe Disney Resort" implies all the best that Disney has to offer. In my case either my expectations were too high or I caught them during a bad three day stretch. Here are the highs and the lows of the visit: HIghs - 1) Location - easy access to EPCOT and Boardwalk. Relatively easy access to the other parks (MK, AK and MGM). 2) Check-in - front desk was efficient (connecting rooms, tickets, etc.) 3) Pool Facility - everything you read about the pool (assuming good reviews) is correct. The kids and even adults will love it. 4) Gym - well equipped and should meet nearly all individual's requirements. 5) Bathroom layout - we had two connecting roooms and it was nice that the sinks (2 in each room) and the shower/toilet were separate (allowing all 6 of us to get ready in the morning with limited issue). Lows - 1) Arrival bellhop service (arrived at approximately 5:30pm on a Tuesday) - a small nit, but important when traveling with 4 young children. We arrived in the taxi/van with five (5) large bags (Disney and Universal vacation) and my oldest son had to retrieve a luggage cart for me which we loaded and pushed to the front desk. At that point I was instructed that it was "required" that the bellhop take my luggage to the room (seems like we did the difficult part). 2) Bedding - think Fairfield Inn, think your local hospital, now you know what to expect. 3) Breakfast - we like oatmeal, yogurt and granola, etc. (not big breakfast buffets). The Concierge informed us that was only available at the Beach Club MarketPlace (yes we walked there each morning from the Yacht Club). 4) Overall room - updated about 5 to 7 years ago (my guess). The decorations were cute (nice for the kids), but the bathroom was circa late 90's (faux marble, Home Depot bargain basement fixtures, etc.) 5) Concierge service - big surprise here. I assumed Disney standard service (again I assume I caught the entire staff on a down bio-rhythm day). Poor suggestion for dinner one evening (avoid the Big Creek Restaurant on the Boardwalk), difficult directions for a few locations and a hard time assisting me with a reservation (character event) that WDW Reservations had made for me (and already hit my credit card). The net is that given the overwhelming number of positive reviews I have to believe I caught them not at their best. As a matter of fact a big driver behind my family staying here were the reviews I read on this site. However, some of my issues are not personnel related, but rather infrastructure related thus I felt that it was relevant to future travellers. One final note: our experience at the Royal Pacific Hotel at Universal was excellent (especially the "fastpass" your room key provides for many of the rides).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not a good value.”
Reviews.Author: briny319
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 days and found the room comparable to a $150 Marriott or Hilton. Our nightly rate was over $300 so we paid twice as much just to be on disney property, which was worth it to go to Epcot but not the Magic Kingdom. Epcot was a 5 minute walk which was great. But the magic kingdom required a bus ride and we ended up waiting 45mins for one bus. We also stayed at the beach club which we enjoyed a little more but next time I think we will stay at a magic kingdom resort or off site.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: jgreenCincinnati
Reviews.Content: Attended a conference at this hotel. Room 3007 is approximately 10 minutes from the elevators through a maze of corridors. Found a stairwell down to the boardwalk at my end of the hall which was open to the public as it had a room key swipe on the outsided but unfortunately was not cleaned during the 4 days I stayed there. Beer cans stuffed in the railings throughout. Spills not mopped - generally unkept.. I dropped something from the sink on my last day and when I bent down to retrieve it found someone else's wash bag under neath which tells me they did not vacuum or even look under there. No creamer or sugar the entire stay without asking to be replenished. No wash cloths, no shampoo or conditioner replenished. Had a small birthday muffin on the desk which was eaten when I returned to my room! Upon check out the girl was somewhat surley or just tired gave me an envelope with some one elses room number and argues that it was mine! Did not open the envelope or review my bill at all. Expect more attention to detail from a Disney Property. Tried to go on line to follow up with the General Manager - impossible to follow up directly with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: audaciousred
Reviews.Content: I've always stayed at moderate resorts at Disney, but after staying at the Yacht Club, I'm sold on Deluxe resorts. The location was perfect. The resort is within walking distance to MGM and Epccot. You can also take the boats to those parks. The busses stopped at our resort and also at the Beach club. The pool is adorable and the workout facilities are perfect. We had the character breakfast at the Cape May restaurant at the Beach Club - average. The rooms were huge, the bathrooms a great size and the waterview room we had a beautiful view of the boardwalk. I would recommend this hotel to everyone!!

Reviews.Title: “one of the best”
Reviews.Author: kellyfromohio
Reviews.Content: Wow! What an extraordinary resort. Just recently stayed at the YC w/husband and two kids (ages 9 and 13) and had a wonderful time. This being the Disney's "Year of A Million Dreams" we were so surprised to find out during check-in that our family had been selected. We were upgraded from the waterview accomodations we had reserved and placed on the concierge floor. We have stayed at several other Disney resorts (Poly, AK, BC, and PO...see my reviews) but have never stayed on the concierge level. I will say that this is a great service for those who have the time to enjoy the amenties, but I still don't feel that it is worth the additional price that you must pay. My kids would beg to differ, however, since they completely enjoyed the cookies, snacks, and all the pop they could drink! The main amenity of concierge at Disney is the free food/beverage offerings throughout the day, including continental breakfast (doughnuts, fresh fruit, bagels, coffee, milk, juice, cereal), afternoon snacks (cookies, pretzels, nuts, pop, and water), dinnertime snacks (pasta, cheeses, breads, beer, wine) and evening cordials (pastries, finger desserts, brandy, and liquers). If you are a busy family or are on the Disney dining plan, it is not always convenient to take advantage of these services. However, since we have been to disney over seven times in the past, we thoroughly enjoyed all that these amenties. The Yacht Club is a spectacular resort located right outside Epcot (within walking distance), across from the Boardwalk, and near MGM. It is themed to the tee (as are ALL the Disney resorts) and is now one of our favorites. I would suggest this resort for families w/older children and/or adults looking to get away. The swimming pool complex, called Stormalong Bay, is one of the most extravagant of all the disney properties. It is very large and sprawling (see my review of the Beach Club for detail) and has THE best waterslide of all the properties. The pool itself is a "sand bottom" pool (yes, sand!!!) and includes a very large, long waterslide which begins at the top of a beached pirate ship. It also has a lazy river, whirlpool (which is a lot of fun), two hot tubs, and a complete sandy kiddie area with zero depth entrance and plenty of lounge chairs. The resort itself is somewhat sprawling, with long hallways, five floors, and a grand lobby. It has two dining rooms, the Yacht Club Galley for a casual breakfast, lunch or dinner, or the Yachtsman Steakhouse, which is one of Disney's premier restaurants. We ate lunch at the Galley, and I personally would not recommend it to anyone. The food was somewhat drab and tasteless and definitely overpriced. We did not eat at the Yachtsman Steakhouse, but I have heard only good reviews of it, and I would highly recommend it for an above average dining experience in a classy atmosphere. There is also a quick service dining counter at the pool called Hurricane Hannah's which is good for the regular burger and fries meal. There is also a fifties-style ice cream parlor on site called Beaches and Cream which serves some of the best ice cream at Disney along with the traditional burgers and such. For those of you on the disney dining plan, this place is considered a sit-down meal (not counter service). In order to get dei sandwiches and snacks, you must walk over to the Beach Club (which is attached to the YC). There you will find a store which serves cold sandwiches, snacks, breakfast choices, and drinks. The Yacht Club and Beach Club resorts are attached to one another, therefore they share many amenties. The rooms are similar, except for theming; however, our family enjoyed the YC much more than the BC. The CM's were extremely friendly and helpful and I liked the location better. We were very comfortable there and never had a problem with transportation or anything else. As I stated earlier, you can walk to Epcot (or take a ferry boat), take a boat to MGM, and bus to MK, AK, or Downtown Disney. This resort is one of the best at Disney, and I would recommend it to anyone. Please feel free to email me with any questions regarding the YC or any of the other great resorts at Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, convenient”
Reviews.Author: bobreb2
Reviews.Content: Disney, generally speaking, is a money sucking experience. Everything is shockinly, continuously, expensive. Still, if you have to be bleeding money, doing so at the Yacht Club is as painless a passing as possible. The pool is excellent as are the restaurants. The drinks are a little slow by the water, and there's not quite enough shade, but if I have to suffer DW again, I'll make my way to the Yacht Club to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Yacht Club exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: Jason Koulouras
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 night stay at the Yacht Club in early October. I had just finished a combo 4 nights at Contemporary Resort and 2 nights at Old Key West Resort for a conference and was looking forward to vacation time. I arrived in the early afternoon. Check-in was very friendly, informative and efficient - compliments to the front desk staff. I was assigned room #1001 - by the way, when I check in by myself at Disney, I consistently seem to get the rooms furthest away from everything which is ok since I enjoy the walk and quiet that these rooms afford. Room #1001 was at the very end or start of the hotel (depends on perspective) - it is on the ground floor and is the first room as you walk by the hotel coming from the Boardwalk or Swan/Dolphin and would be the last room if you are coming from the Beach Club resort. The room was amazing - as a corner room, it had a large hallway which is great for staging kids clothes and shoes etc. both inbound and outbound, it had large windows on the outside wall overlooking a nice grassed area, trees and a waterway, and had a nice small patio with sliding doors directly overlooking the Boardwalk across the water. A great spot for an early morning breakfast and for reading books and watching the Disney marathoners run by one morning. The interior is well decorated in a nice subdued nautical theme that we did not find dated. There are 2 sinks in a dressing area and the commode and shower/tub are in a small room with a door. The closet is a decent size and there is a fair amount of drawer space including a separate highboy piece of furniture. There are 2 queen beds and a comfortable seating chair with ottoman, a nice work area, and a neat portable table. The room has a half fridge (bar fridge). The beds were very comfortable - the one thing I will point out is that Disney could frankly use a linen upgrade at the Deluxe and DVC properties - they are below the standard I would expect at higher end properties. The staff were very pleasant right from the store staff to the cleaning staff, engineering, front desk, greeters/managers and the concierge/reservations desk was very helpful as well. Stormalong Bay was great as always with pool games, friendly lifeguards, lots of space and the kids loved the sand in the pool. They definitely need more wait staff to take orders and serve food as there seemed to be only one person on duty and she was very busy! The resort offered 7am yoga on the beach overlooking the boardwalk (the class was very good) and also offered movies on the beach when the weather was good. We have stayed at a number of Disney properties and this is the best stay we have had yet and our expectations were exceeded significantly on this stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Yacht Club!”
Reviews.Author: connied76
Reviews.Content: We travel to Disney often and after a slight misstep in August at Grand Floridian (too stuffy for us), we had a wonderful experience at the Yacht Club. It was laid-back elegance with superb service. The hotel was very pretty with gorgeous wood floors and inviting public areas. The landscaping was lovely and the areas of beach, gardens and boardwalk all gave a different experience to the resort. The pool was great- big and spread out so doesn't feel crowded. Nice bars and restaurants. The service was great- every CM had a smile and pleasant word. they were knowledgeable and aimed to please at every turn. beds were comfortable, amenities great and abundant and mousekeeping was prompt and really efficient. Beds were comfortable and the room spacious. The decor could use a little updating, however. It was so nice to be able to walk right into Epcot or MGM. This is our new favorite Disney hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Flavioca
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel with my husband and my 5 years old son for 3 nights and it was great. The service is above average. The hotel is very calm, the pool is great and you really wonÂ´t need a car if you are in a short trip. The transportation to the Disney parks was very practical. We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: nstern00
Reviews.Content: If you love Disney, you'll love this. But for me, at this price, I'm expecting an upscale hotel with the finest amenities and gracious service. In spite of unceasing cheerfulness among the staff, we encountered many problems including room keys that didn't work, intrusive lights from the hallway at night, and an uncomfortable bed. The prices are high, the food mediocre, and the decor a bit dated.

Reviews.Title: “Mousekeeping & a bit of damp”
Reviews.Author: poe_eoghan
Reviews.Content: Overall the Yacht Club is a fantastic hotel in a gorgeous setting with wonderful staff. I'm gobsmacked at just how close it is to Epcot & MGM. The holiday was outstanding. However, I'm now gonna point out all the niggly bits, not to put people off but to prep them for their stay. 1) The pool is fantastic & a good craic but not all it's hyped up to be. Bare this in mind & you'll love it. It's great but does not compete with Typhoon Lagoon & it's 'Lazy River' is 8 foot deep at one point. WHY!? 2) Maids are wonderfully friendly but had to be reminded to use a Dyson. I discovered a patch of damp in the corner of the room & several cherry pips that were definitely not mine! Neither ruined our stay but you expect better from this sort of establishment. 3) The Yacht Club has a few basic food rations in it's store; the Beach Club end has the good food. But, even then, it doesn't have the sort of counter service available at somewhere like Pop Century. The Yachtsman Steakhouse was devine but not eaxctly for on the go food. The same can be said about the Yacht Galley. We had the breakfast buffet which had a wonderful variety ... but was let down by a few dirty utensils. 4) Altho, the Beach Club is aimed more for families, the swimming pool is actually slap bang right outside the Yacht C lub too; so access is never a problem. 5) If you have a balcony facing the lake, rmbr you have no privacy out there. If you have a balcony facing the Yacht Club pool there isn't much privacy if someone else is out on their balcony at the same time. You have to kind of take turns. Also, the staff run their trolleys round underneath those balconies every morning, which is noisy & again hinders your privacy. Get used to workmen seeing you in your jammies or stay inside. 6) Conventions go on intermittently in the nearby convention centre & most of the people stay on the Yacht Club side. For the most part this wont bother you, unless you get the odd drunken businessman conducting a loud phonecall outside your room in the early hours of the morning. Normally this can be resolved by opening the door & sticking your tongue out at him. I've made it sound horrendous, I know, but overall the place is warm & friendly, very cosey & the aesthetics are outstanding. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, esapecially couples without children .

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: woody2662
Reviews.Content: My son, one of his friends and I stayed here in August 2007. Although we have been to Disney World several times, this was the first time we stayed at the Yacht Club. My sister-in-law gave the trip to my son as a present and she booked us into the concierge level. The check in was very easy and we didn't have to go to the front desk at all. The friendliness of the staff varied. None were rude and all were friendly but a few went beyond the just being polite level and knew my son's name by the time we left. The room was nice and clean. We looked down into the courtyard and could see the waterway from the balcony. It was a good size for me and two early teen boys. I liked the convenince to both Epcot and MGM. Being able to get there without having to wait for the Disney Bus was a big benefit. The Yacht and Beach Clubs share the nicest hotel pool on the Disney property. The Lazy River is the deepest one I have been to anywhere. I am 6' and about half of it was over my head. The pool has sand for the bottom. There are at least 3 hot tubs and the wrecked ship slide is really fun. We ate dinner at the Yachtsman Steakhouse one night. It was expensive but the food was very good. Beaches and Creak is also a good place to go for a light meal or ice cream. We all thought the hotel was nice and had an enjoyable trip. I know we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “By far the BEST Disney resort.”
Reviews.Author: dreashere
Reviews.Content: The group I traveled with stayed here in Aug 2006. We were there for the Disney travel agent training program. The first thing that we all agreed was the best benefit to staying here was LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION. In my opinion it has the best location of any of the parks. You are within a short boat ride to both Epcot and MGM. The other biggest benefit for really everyone(but esp for families with kids) would be the awesome pool area. One of the pools is even a sand bottom pool which is a nice little touch. We looked at a bunch of hotels and this one absolutely has THE BEST pool area of any Disney hotel So if you are pool people then this is the place for you. Also the rooms are a really good size. And to be fair we did look at other deluxe hotel rooms (Animal Kingdom, Polynesian, Grand Floridian, etc) but these rooms were the biggest in size. Also the hotel had just received brand new bedding so the beds were the most comfortable I have ever slept in (and to find a group of 12 that all agrees on bedding would be impossible.) However, the bathroom was a little smaller than we liked, but not a huge deal. Nice sized balcony with small table and 2 chairs. But PLEASE REMEMBER....the hotel is big so make sure to request a room with whomever you book it through to get a room that is not in any of the wings. Because if you do, then be prepared for a long walk down lots of hallways! Also check out Beaches and Cream which is between the Yacht / Beach club. Also Cape May's is a must for a character breakfast. It's not just the kids that like it! Also the buffet breakfast served was very delicious. So overall, this hotel to me is by far THE place to choose when staying at a Disney resort.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Best!!! Loved the Yacht Club”
Reviews.Author: Lovestitch
Reviews.Content: I too am a Travel Agent as well as a Master Disney Specialist and I was lucky enough to get to stay at this property in Jan of 2006 when I attended the Disney College of Knowledge graduate program. We were there for 5 days...I fell in love with this resort. The setting is wonderful, so relaxing..the food was incedible, we ate at the Yachtsman Steakhouse one evening and it was superb. Best filet mignon I have ever experenced. Definitely for grown ups..Very nice place to celebrate an anniversary or to arrange for a dinner date with your hubby or wife to reconnect. Disney has terrific child care at the Never-Never club located at the Polynesian, usually for about 11.00 an hour and if you have drop your child off between 6 & 8 they will be fed dinner, this gives the adults a chance to be well, adults again and have an evening out with out the little guys... Back to the Yacht Club...the rooms were spacious, extremely clean, house keeping was on the job and the room sparkled when they were done...loved the classic disney cartoons on the televison in the evenings and tto sit out on the balcony at night. ..we would be up and out of our rooms at say oh, 8am, and then not back again until sometimes 930-10p at night..to come into my room, change clothes, put on a pot of decafinated coffee and sit outside on the balcony at night was absolute heaven...the pool area was incredible..we stayed at the Polynesian in June that year and there is just no comparison, the Yacht Club has to be Disney's best resort. Bear in mind, the Dolphin and the Swan resorts are not actually owned and operated by Disney...they are NOT Disney Properties, keep this in mind should you decide to go to WDW and would like to be able to benefit from the benefits offered to guests who stay on property, such as the extra magic hours, the disney dining plan..(one of the best values out there from WDW)...and the Disney Transportation system.... For a truly magical and comfortable stay, I recommend Disney's Yacht Club, we are staying at this resort again when we go down to WDW this coming October for Mickey's Not So Scary and Epcot's food and Wine Fest...Great time of the year to go too... Overall the Yacht Club beat the Polynesian hands down...I will stay at no other Disney Resort....

Reviews.Title: “Great pool”
Reviews.Author: rosey1Tampa
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our daughters 5th birthday weekend. We parked our car and didnt move it for three days. Great transportaion is just outside the door. We loved the pools and slides. Walked into most restaurants. We toasted marshmellows at a camp fire, walked into Epcot for fireworks and then came back and watched a movie on the beach. Great day. Ice machine was broken on our floor, and we shared a balcony with thre other rooms. That was the only negative.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: glattonfolly
Reviews.Content: After a less than fabulous stay at the Polynesian five years ago, we decided to try the Yacht Club, which I had stayed at many years ago. It was a great decision. We were on the club level, with a water view room. Our room was directly above the main lobby doors to the boardwalk on the pool side of the building. Could not have been a better location and view for us. Our room was ready upon our 2 pm check-in, and the desk staff were friendly and efficient.The Concierge staff was cheerful and helpful at all times. The food and drink in the club lounge was welcome. Each day the room was cleaned early, and was spotless and crisp when we arrived after lunch for some pool time. Really our only issue had little to do with the hotel. The room next store had two adults and four young children. Between screaming toddlers and adults at 7:15 in the AM, we wondered why they would subject themselves to such an experience. However, previous reviews had talked about the thin walls at the Yacht Club, and I must admit that most of the turmoil stayed in their room, which was good, and made this only a minor annoyance. We had a restful trip and an excellent stay, kudos to The Yacht Club for exceeding our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: thincats
Reviews.Content: This hotel goes out of its way to make you feel good. Upon arrival my son (8) was stopped and told that Mickey had left him some presents (stickers, magazine, key ring) what a great start. We had paid for a water view room, but the view was around a corner so we asked to change which they did no problem. We did not realise how far away the car rental place was, "get a taxi, bring us the bill" which we did and were reimbursed. What more can you ask. The room was spotless, the bed so comfy, all the staff really friendly. Great stay would recommend to anyone and I am a fusspot.

Reviews.Title: “Great-even during a hurricane”
Reviews.Author: skadberg
Reviews.Content: We love the Yacht & Beach Club, and here is why: -we love being able to walk down the beach to Epcot -we love hoping on a boat to MGM or Epcot -we love taking the tram from Epcot to the Magic Kingdom (and so did our son) -we love all the water views -we love watching the Epcot fireworks each night from the beach or from the balcomy in our room -we love the Disney staff, so friendly and helpful -we love a place that is soooooo kid friendly -we love that in the middle of a hurricane and one of the few times that the parks have actually closed that the hotel went out of their way to : 1. Keep us informed 2. Help us book an extra night so we wouldn't get stuck at the airport 3. Had characters and extra staff in the lobby with tons of free activities to help parents keep their kids entertained 4. Made sure that the restuarant didn't run out of food! It's a great place. We've stayed 3 times.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: love2roadtrip
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that am a huge Disney fan and have been 8 times ad will go many more (not to Yacht Club though). This trip left my family and I feeling like we had been cheated by Disney. We had problems as soon as we booked the hotel through WDW Reservations and received our confirmation. We realized they way overcharged us. When I called to get this taken care of, I literally had to argue with them to get it fixed. I did later receive a call from Disney apologizing. The greeting we received when we pulled up to the property was "wanna valet park?". Not "welcome", "have a magical day", etc. Check in took almost 30 minutes, not in line, just with me face to face with the front desk clerk and they were not even busy. He had no idea what he was doing and no one seemed willing to help out. I asked if I could pay for an upgrade to a waterview and he told me that he did not know how to do that and proceeded to check me in as if I never asked. I insisted that he look into this and once he did find that he could do that, he told me to look on the rate card to figure the price difference. I was stunned. Once we got into our room we were happy to find that we had a nice room, not luxurious by any means but it was nice. 45 minutes and two phone calls later we finally received our bags. The entire stay was much like this with filthy dirty towels (very clearly at least one of our towels had not been washed), broken coffeee maker, non-responsive and at times downright rude staff members, mediocre food and poor housekeeping. I did complain to a member of management twice and she was extremely nice and sent two little goody baskets to our children. But that was not enough to give us back our excitement or our dream vacation. We left feeling like we had not been on vacation and feeling very jipped by Disney. We stayed at Grand Floridian two years prior and could not believe that these two hotels were both run by the same company....like night and day! On a positive note, the beds were very comfortable and the main pool is the best pool I have seen in my life! Also, being able to walk to Epcot was great.

Reviews.Title: “a great stay”
Reviews.Author: sailor181
Reviews.Content: We loved it! The Yacht Club is so amazing. The location is so convenient to Epcot and MGM - it was great to just be able to walk from the hotel to these parks! So I think we ended up saving alot of time that we would normally be using up waiting for the Disney buses. Having stayed at various other Disney Reosrts (AKL, Coronado, POR, ASMusic, Wilderness Lodge, etc.) I think the Yacht Club is our new favorite. Our room was located on the ground floor, and was the last room at the end of the hallway facing the quiet pool. At first I was disappointed that we were on the ground floor, as I normally prefer to be as high up as possible, but this turned out to be wonderful. We could just walk out the door at the end of the hall and we were out on the boardwalk. Our patio was roomy and airy, yet private as it was surrounded by bushes. I would definately request the ground floor again. As usual with Disney, the front desk staff were friendly and helpful. The only thing that I didn't really like was that the shop with the quick food and refillable mug station was way over in the Beach Club, but......hey, it was a nice walk anyways. Would certainly stay here again on our next visit to Disney! Yes, it costs a bit but it is well worth it for the location, no doubt about it.

Reviews.Title: “Disney's Yacht Club Great”
Reviews.Author: VLR
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Disney the first of June. Our stay at the Yacht Club was very nice. Check-in very smooth. The meal plan was described coherently for all of us. We had 9 in our group ranging in age from 3-69. No problems. Ask for a room near the main area of the hotel. We were on the second floor and could actually use the beautiful staircase in the lobby to come and go from our rooms. Yet, we were far enough removed to have peaceful experience. I'm sure rooms at the end of the wings are quite a hike. Hotel was clean. Rooms were good size, but not huge. The pool was great. Restaurants were just ok, but good enough. We especially like the proximity to Epcot and MGM. Great. We payed a premium for a water view. We looked out over dock and the wedding gazebo. Very nice. But if you don't care, you can save about $100 each day. The staff was helpful. Especially since our son had to be taken to the emergency room. A hotel employee (female) walked our 15-year-old daughter back to her room, as my husband and I were the only ones allowed on the ambulance. Actually this was a the Beach Club shuttle stop. But both staffs were nice. She could not get into her room and they kept re-keying it. Finally they got engineering to totally replace the key box mechanism. So we all had an eventful day. Because we missed one whole day of our park hopper passes, they comped us 4 free park passes to be used anytime in the future. Overall, a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Disney Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: H.F.
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 night stay at this absolutely BEAUTIFUL RESORT! We are Florida residents, so we have been to Disney several times and have stayed on Disney properties a number of times. This was our first time at the Yacht Club. We were definitely impressed! They share property with Disney's Beach Club, which is basically set up the same just a different theme. The rooms were very spacious, extremely clean and had very nice furniture. Beautifully decorated with nautical fixtures etc. This hotel, in true Disney Fasion was so well maintained and the grounds were so well manicured it just added to the "magic" Disney has to offer. The 3 acre pool was AMAZING! Sand bottom pool! So comfy on your toes, and a great thrill for our daughter. The only thing we disliked about the pool area was that they did not have enough waitresses coming around to order drinks and food. They have a pool Bar and Grill and also a 50's themed soda shop that you can order delicous ice cream and typical soda shop food. They also have a Deli set up in the gift shop of The Beach Club side of the hotel that made delicous salads at lunch and great quick breakfast items. Also, they offered great bakery items, sandwiches and all sorts of fruit and snacks. This came in handy when you didn't want to sit down at the bigger restaurants. Cape May offered Character breakfast which our daughter loved! This was great to have right in the hotel! No waiting in the hot sun to meet Minnie or Goofy at a theme park. Just walk downstairs, get a table and they are all there! We didn't even make reservations! The servcice is remarkable. EVERYONE IS HAPPY AT THIS PROPERTY! TRUE DISNEY MAGIC! There are so many things we notice at a Disney property that you won't find anywhere else in Orlando, like : music in the walkways and bushes, buses that take you from your door to the theme parks (nothing, I mean nothing is better than leaving Magic Kingdom and getting right on a bus, no monorail, no tram, no boat to get you to your car which you then have to drive at least 25 -30 minutes back to your hotel) The absoultely clean and updated resorts,( they were painting baseboards in our hallway the day we checked in, and believe me they didn't even look dirty! )Being able to use your room key to cahrge anything you like at any disney theme park! That comes in handy! Oh, and also the most important, the employees are trained to make sure your stay is nothing less than MAGICAL! It is worth every extra dollar you pay to stay on Disney's property even if you can't fit this "Class" of hotel into your budget. The next step down would be on of their moderate resorts and we reccomend Coronado Springs. But if it is full service you are looking for then the Yacht Club is it! All the luxury, all the fun and all that DISNEY MAGIC!!

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite WDW Hotel”
Reviews.Author: scottca075
Reviews.Content: I could go to the Yacht Club, never visit any of the Disney Parks and be perfectly happy at this hotel. The setting is elegant and the rooms are great. The pool is almost a mini-water park and they have other pool areas if you want to avoid too many kids. I have stayed at many other WDW hotels, but this is where I come most often (my second choice would be the Wilderness Lodge, third Polynesian and fourth Grand Floridian). I love the convenience of walking in the back door of Epcot and being close to all those excellent restaurants as well as the in-house restaurants of the Yacht Club & Beach Club. And I do prefer the Yacht Club side to the Beach Club side. The first time I stayed here, I chose the Beach Club side because I thought it would suit my laid back California casualness and I was worried the Yacht Club would feel stuffy. I actually found the Yacht Club to perfectly suit my tastes and have stayed here ever since.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Quiet (and Almost) No Kid Zone”
Reviews.Author: VaBelle35
Reviews.Content: This resort exceeded my expectations. Upon arrival, I was told I had been upgraded from the standard view room I had requested to a water view room. I thought that only happened on the Travel Channel! I had read in the Unofficial Guide to WDW that the Yacht Club Resort takes a liberal view of the water view room (it could be anything from a view of a garden hose to the lake). I had a beautiful view of the entire Boardwalk (room 4061). I had also read that this hotel was rated low for noise and lighting issues and I have to disagree. I had no problem with noise (although I do sleep with a white noise machine) as I was right next to an elevator and the ice maker. As for lighting, this is one of the best hotels Iâ€™ve been in in years where I can put on my makeup and actually see what Iâ€™m doing, so Iâ€™m not sure what the issue was with lighting. This is a great mid-level resort hotel. Itâ€™s not as plush as some of the resorts Iâ€™ve visited (like the Bellagio or the Gaylord Properties), but the point of Disney is the parks, not necessarily the hotels. This hotel was clean and well maintained (no visible wear and tear). The desks were always well staffed and there was always someone available for questions and help. I asked for extra pillows and they were in my room when I returned from the park. The hotel is well organized. There are two resorts, the Beach Club side and the Yacht Club side. The restaurants are all in one area, in the middle between the Yacht Club and the Beach Club and most of the walk between resorts is indoors. The Yacht Club side is mainly the quiet side, this is where conventioneers, singles and older guests and families with older children stay. In the lobby, just inside the front doors, there is a basket of face towels. I think this is such a great idea because when it is so hot and humid, you really need a towel. Itâ€™s great to grab them on the way out to the parks and stick them in your bag. They also have wash cloths in every lobby bathroom, again a nice touch because you really need them when itâ€™s hot. The Room I had a king-sized bed and I felt the room was rather large. There are two chests of drawers, one with the tv on it and the mini-fridge. There is a kitchen counter area with a coffee pot and a small sink. There is also a love seat (which I assume is a fold out bed) and a chair with an ottoman. The curtains, bedspread, linens were all clean and well maintained. The furniture was in good repair. All the rooms have a balcony with 2 chairs and a small table, there are privacy walls on each side. The curtains did a nice job of keeping out the light from the Boardwalk across the way. There are two small closets, one with extra pillows and a blanket. One with the iron and ironing board. The bathroom is a little small and hard to maneuver the door around the toilet if you are not standing in just the right place. I was surprised I only got one face towel every day. I got 4 bath towels, but each day I only had one face towel. I assume because I was just one person. I didnâ€™t bother to ask for another one (just stole one out of the basket on the way in each night ;o). The mattress and pillows were very comfortable. The Concierge This desk is always well staffed. At one point the line was getting long and 2 managers from other departments were walking through the lobby stopped to work the line and help out. I thought this was a really nice touch as I had seen both of these employees walk by twice and thought it was odd that they didnâ€™t help out. And then they did. One down side, you can't call the Concierge Desk. You have to go in person, or you have to speak to a different department. I'm not sure why that is. The Pools The pool on the Yacht Club side is small and has a separate hot tub. No children go in this pool (it's boring compared to the Beach Club pool), so it is very private and quiet. There were never more than 4 or 5 people in this pool. It is open 24 hours and has no life guard. The sign says itâ€™s open until midnight, but you can go in any time according to the Concierge. I guess as long as you arenâ€™t making a lot of noise, waking up the guests who face the pool, you can go in at any time. Transportation to Parks I had no problem getting to and from the parks. The boat to and from Epcot and MGM were efficient and I never had to wait more than a few minutes. The same with the bus to the Magic Kingdom. I rarely waited more than 10 minutes. Restaurants Yacht Club Galley Restaurant Breakfast Buffet â€“ Itâ€™s $15.99 during the week (it may be more on the weekends). This is the quiet restaurant with either older adults, families with teenagers or conventioneers. The food is standard breakfast buffet fare. The earlier you go, the better it is. At 10:30 the pancakes and waffles were getting hard and crusty, the eggs were drying out. There is an oatmeal/grits area with fixings; a dessert area with blintzes and bread pudding, standard pastries and breads. The bagels were packaged and small, not that great. If you are picky about your breakfast, you may want to order al a carte from the menu and skip the buffet. Lunch â€“ I didnâ€™t feel the lunch menu gave you a lot of choices. I had a hard time deciding, but what I chose actually ended up being very good and I had planned to go again and order the same thing another day but didnâ€™t have time. I had the Caesar Salad (nothing fancy/special) ($5.49) and the Tomato Mozzarella Sandwich (really great, fresh mozzarella, really ripe tomatoes) ($9.99). Again, it was very quiet, mostly older adults. Cape May CafÃ© â€“ This is the restaurant on the Beach Club side of the resort. It has a character breakfast every morning. I saw Minnie Mouse and Goofy one morning, Chip and Dale on another. Itâ€™s always packed, so make your reservations when you book your room to make sure you get your seating. Boardwalk Bakery â€“ For a change of pace for breakfast, I took the boat over to the Boardwalk and ordered the Egg Bacon Panini ($5.79-pre-cooked, just put on the Panini maker to heat up and make the grill marks in the bread â€“ no that great, kind of dry) and a cup of tea (they had a nice selection on Twinings). Beach Club Market Place â€“ A must visit at the resort. A great place for a quick breakfast or lunch. They have breakfast muffins/breads and make egg sandwiches on croissants ($4.79). The eggs are pre-made and if you donâ€™t get there early, they are pretty old and dried out by late morning. The baked goods were okay ($2.59). They have a nice selection on Twinings tea ($2.00 per large cup) and coffee, lots of frozen foods, snacks and stuff you can take back to your room or villa. Itâ€™s busy and the lines can be long, so add extra time if you are in a hurry. Beaches & Cream -- This is a fun little (and I do mean little) place on the Beach Club side of the resort. There is a small sit down side that always has a wait where you can order limited food and ice cream. There is also a take out side for just ice cream. Your ice cream choices are limited (4 flavors) but itâ€™s a fun, lively place and a nice way to end the evening or take a break from the pool. Room Service â€“ I always order room service on my last day of a trip. Here I ordered the bagel and smoked salmon (with all the standard fixings). For $11.99, I was surprised at the amount of smoked salmon you got. It was at least 3/4 lb if not more. The bagel was large, not the same packaged bagels you get on the breakfast buffet, but not a great NY bagel either. I really enjoyed it, though. I used the order form that you put on the door. I requested delivery between 9-9:30 am. It came just before 9:30, and he called to say he was on his way. The presentation of room service (or private dining as they call it) is nice. They pull out the dining table from under the desk, put a white table cloth on it and set up the food and unwrap everything. I really wasnâ€™t interested in a long involved story/conversation and being entertained by the steward and eventually had to hurry him along so I could eat and get on with my morning. But he was very nice and efficient. I will definitely stay here again and recommend it to everyone. This resort was recommended to me by a friend and I'm glad I trusted her judgment.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: jgrnnc
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Yacht Club! The staff was very friendly, the rooms immaculate, the beds were SO comfortable. and it was calm and quiet without being stuffy or formal. Our son was celebrating a birthday there and I ordered a cake at the concierge desk--shortly after room service delivered the cake, two wonderful folks from the concierge desk arrived at our door with balloons and an autographed card from "The Big Guy," (Mickey). What a neat surprise! It was just awesome--my son says it was his best birthday ever. Earlier that evening, as we browsed in the shop off the lobby, a super friendly guy came in saying, "I feel a magical moment coming on!" He went on to ask my son to sign their autograph book and presented him with a magical moments certificate and two special Disney pins--one to keep and one to give away. The pool was just beautiful, so much fun--the sandy bottom was amazing! Our room was straight out from the lighthouse--a BEAUTIFUL view of the lake, and the Boardwalk. So easy to get to Epcot--a short walk or just ride on the ferry, a quick jaunt to MGM by boat. It does take 20-30 minutes to get to Animal Kingdom--an awesome park, by the way. Usually it only took about 20 minutes to get to Magic Kingdom, but the last night we were there, we ended up with a new bus driver who turned in to the exit for the buses at Magic Kingdom. This caused some problems for other buses, too. We ended up on the bus for an hour because at one stop two motorized wheelchairs were loaded and it took him a while to get them on. A little frustrating--but we made it in time for the fireworks! All in all, it was a perfect week. Great for our family of five with kids ranging in age from 11-20. I would love to go back and HIGHLY recommend the Yacht Club!

Reviews.Title: “absolutely a deluxe property! wonderful..”
Reviews.Author: justplaingoofy
Reviews.Content: First I should mention that I am a travel agent and was traveling to Disney (and Universal) to inspect the properties and gain more info.on this destination. I should also mention that we have either been to or stayed at all of Disneys properties. We stayed 4 nights at Yacht Club and 3 nights at Universal Hard Rock (also has a seperate review). We stayed in a "standard" room. No upgrades or special treatment for those of you wondering. I picked the Yacht Club because of the location. We would have booked Beach Club (next door) but they do not have many full size balconies where Yacht Club offers full balconies. We like the balconies incase one of us wants to sleep in the other can go outside w/ a cup of coffee & book. Also, if you are traveling w/ children its a nice little spot to get away. Location: Perfect. close proximity to MGM & Epcot. Check in: Was a breeze. Our room was not quite ready so they held our bags, gave us our passes and room keys and off we went to a park. Yacht Club gave us a business card with a phone number to call later in the day to check to see if our room was ready. When the room is ready they will tell you your room number so you can bypass going back to the check in counter. Rooms: very clean, our room was on the smaller side but that could have been to the location. Other rooms I viewed looked a bit larger. (We were just 2 adults so the smaller room was fine) Transportation: as other members have posted it can be time consuming to take the boat. To get to MGM the boat started at Boardwalk, Yacht Club, Dolphin/Swan then MGM. To get to Epcot the boat started at Dolphin/Swan, Yacht Club, Boardwalk then Epcot. If you are tired and looking for a relaxing trip I'd take the boat. If you are looking at saving time than walk. We decided to walk back to MGM one night almost as the boat was pulling up and we beat the boat back to Yacht Club. Housekeeping was wonderful. The room was VERY clean. We did leave some money every day but they seemed to take pride in their work. food--yummy!!! We always book Cape May character breakfast buffet. The character to guest ratio seems pretty high and food was great. Another not to be missed was Beaches & Cream...ohh now I want to go back for more! Pool- This pool in my opinion is the best in all of the Disney properties. Storm a long Bay has a small lazy river, large pool, great big slide, and the bottom of the pool is all sand which makes this much fun for children to build sandcastles, etc. Because the pool is so popular Yacht/Beach club now is requiring guests to show their resort Id cards and they get a bracelet so that they can make sure the guests using the pool are Beach/Yacht club guests. I believe a Cast Mate said that the resort capacity is 1,400 guests and the pool capacity is 1,200 guests which is why you have to show your resort id. If guests from other resorts come over to use the pool and it is at capacity guests staying at Beach/Yacht club would not be able to use their own pool. If you are considering staying at one of Disneys Epcot resorts I would recommend this property or the Beach Club over the Swan/Dolphin, and Boardwalk. I say this because they are all in the same area, but the pool is the best. Disney does not allow "pool hopping" you must use the pool at the resort to which you are staying. A little off topic here, but if you are a resort guest and going to Disney theme parks you are eligible for Extra Magic hours. Which means that almost daily one park is either open 1hr before "posted" park opening, or open 3hrs after "posted" park closing. (they enforce this in the evening w/ bracelets). Morning extra magic hours (as usual) are wonderful. Evening extra magic hours is like feeding time at the zoo. For us, the lines were longer during evening extra magic hours than during the day. Concierge desk was very accomodating. Helpful & with a smile. I would not hesitate to recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with issues...Not worth the extra $$$...”
Reviews.Author: Vsgirl8600
Reviews.Content: My husband, two daughters and myself just returned today from a 3 night stay at Disney's Yacht Club. This is our 3rd trip to Disney but our first stay at the Yacht Club. Unfortunately, it will probably be our last stay at the Yacht Club. While the hotel itself is beautiful, staff is friendly and rooms are clean ... the transportation leaves a lot to be desired. If you go to Epcot or MGM, be prepared for a 40+ minute boat ride. They do not offer bus service from the resort to either of those places. The boats are slow getting there. And if it's raining, you still have to stand on the pier while waiting for your boat to arrive. We find it much easier to hop on a bus and be there in a matter of minutes. We missed the "food court" that the moderate hotels offer. On our last night, after arriving back from Magic Kingdom's "extra magic hours", around 1am we were hungry. The only thing available was the limited 24 hour room service menu. We asked for 4 bowls for our pint of ice cream and we received one bowl and no spoons. Needless to say, we went to bed that night hungry and very disppointed. It was like a ghost town at the resort by midnight. As mentioned above, the grounds are beautiful and well kept. The staff is great. The pools are a lot of fun too. Our rooms were always cleaned in a timely fashion. We do leave a daily tip for maid service so maybe that helped. We don't feel it was worth the extra money. We feel like we wasted so much time waiting for the boats and then making numerous stops before we reached our desitnation. Next time we will be going back to our other favorite Disney resort. It's a more reasonable price for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “ok if you like big”
Reviews.Author: akupupule
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in May 07. The rooms were excellent, with very comfortable mattresses. Central heat/ AC was very quiet, and everything was very clean. The in-room coffee maker had a horrible plastic taste to the coffee, so we used our own cup water heater and our own coffee. Beware there are no vcr/dvds in the room, nor movie channels on the tv. Disney does not want you in the rooms, but out spending money in the parks. The hotel and grounds are up to Disney standards, with clean grounds and great service from all of the staff. There are a lot of families and young children here and the main pool was full of children. There is a "hidden" adult pool on the back of the hotel near the tennis courts. The bar off the main lobby was good, but always very busy in the evenings. The hotel is huge and negotiating the miriad hallways is time consuming and sometimes confusing. There is only one bank of elevators for each side of the hotel. Our room was on the backside of the hotel near the tennis courts and was relatively quiet, although we could occasionally hear people in the room above dropping things on the floor. All in all, I would rate this hotel above average and probably a decent value, especially for the location (walk or water taxi to Epcot and MGM).However, my personal preference is for a smaller, more intimate experience. There are countless dining options in the Orlando area, and my experiences with the Disney restaurants has been only average. Dining options outside the park could include Cafe Tu Tu Tangos, Seasons 52, Manuels, Roys, etc. .

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: jtrain75
Reviews.Content: You will not be dissappointed if you stay here. If you look at the big picture, it's the best place to stay. I've stayed at several other resorts, and this is the only one that we keep coming back too. The hotel is beautifully decorated, staff is always helpful and friendly, and the rooms are always clean and fresh. Both times we stayed at side over looking the lake with the light house. If you choose to stay on this side, be prepared to hear the horn from the boats transporting guests back and forth from MGM and Epcot. At first it was annoying, but now everytime I hear a horn with the same tone, it takes me back to the Yacht Club. Now for the perks. It has the ONLY private pool in Disney. It also has Storm Along Bay which is a fresh water pool with sand on the bottom!!! A must see. The Yachtman's Steak House is a phenomenal place to get a steak, and the 'Goofy Bread' at the Yacht Club Gallery will be a favorite. Walk along to the arcade or grab a dessert at Beaches and Cream. Awesome, awesome place for sweets. There is a short walk to Epcot and you enter right near France, or take a boat ride to MGM. At night, hang out on the beach area and watch the fireworks over Epcot. Right across the lake is the Boardwalk which has some shops, the ESPN bar and some places to eat. You will not be dissappointed!!!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the Yacht Club - Go Concierge Level!”
Reviews.Author: Disneyfan15
Reviews.Content: My husband, 3 year old daughter & I just returned from staying at the Yacht Club on the Concierge level. Yes, it's a bit expensive, but worth every penny! We booked our trip 2 weeks before visiting during the peak Easter break time & got fabulous reservations for all the places we wanted to eat with no problems at all. We even got into Cinderella's castle for breakfast (which you normally have to book months in advance). Check in was flawless, the staff was very attentive & we loved getting a quick bite before heading to the parks early. We'd return around 5:00 & have a nice 'snack' before eating a late dinner. They had soup every night, the BEST peanut butter & jelly sandwiches, vegetables, cheese & crackers. It was nice to come back for that afternoon break & then return for another round at the park later in the evening. We found our room very clean & quiet too. Our room overlooked Stormalong Bay (pool area) which closed at 9:00 p.m. and we could watch Epcot's fireworks from our balcony too. The transportation to all of the parks was very efficient & we had no problems at all. I also suggest if you have a young child to book the character breakfast at Cape May restaurant located at the Beach Club (which is attached to the Yacht Club) on your departure day. The breakfast was GREAT. They had really good food & you get to dine with Minnie, Goofy, Chip & Dale. We did several character breakfasts & this was the loudest but not unbearable. We loved the Yacht Club & have already suggested it to several friends. Spend the extra money & book on the concierge level. You won't be dissapointed!

Reviews.Title: “Lively Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelinBuddy
Reviews.Content: Disney's Yacht Club Resort sits across from the Boardwalk, a fun place for families and nice setting for a romantic evening walk for couples. Guests can take a boat ride or a 10-20 minute walk to the Epcot Center (guests can enter from the back of the park without having to stand in a looong line, a definitely PLUS) or the MGM studios. There are several activities around the Boardwalk: rent a bike, rent a boat, bass fish, play carnival-like games, go to the ESPN zone or the Piano bar, etc. The actual hotel was slightly above average. On our first day, it took us nearly 10 minutes to walk from the lobby to our room! Our room was at the very end of the building but to our surprise it had a wonderful view of the Boardwalk, especially at night. Later we found a shortcut to our room. The room itself was clean and spacious, but it could use an upgrade. The steak house at the hotel came highly recommended but it definitely was no Ruth Cris. Take a short walk on the Boardwalk to a restaurant called Spoodles, good food at a good price. The best thing about the hotel, besides the location, is the pool (see picture). Disney's Yacht Club is a versatile, hotel for EVERYONE (couples to families) and its in a lively, accessible location where guests can just relax or keep busy.

Reviews.Title: “For the Price, I expected More... I will go back to renting Homes”
Reviews.Author: LLC
Reviews.Content: We travel to the Orlando Area often. We typically stay in a rental home (about 10 minutes from the parks), but we thought we would "splurge" and stay on-site somewhere nice... First, I will say, I read all the reviews before deciding to go. I was a bit nervous, but the rating really says it all... It was average. Probably would have better if just my husband and I/ Unlike other guests experiences, everyone was very nice and helpful. The room was alright, a bit of a disappointment on decoration. It was small for our family and I really missed having separate bedrooms. While the kids LOVED the pool and my husband and I enjoyed being able to get to walk to EPCOT and just a short hop to MGM. We found that we really enjoyed staying at rental homes much more. The kids even asked why we didn't stay at a rental home. The funny thing is, if we were headed to Magic Kingdom, it actually took longer riding the bus system then it did to drive from the rental home. We also really missed having the full kitchen for the kids. I saw lots of comments about filling the refrig in the room. I am glad I did, because it was important. I know we could have rented a villa for close to a $1000/night, but that is hard to justify when we can rent a home for the entire week for the same price. While I am glad that we stayed on site, I can check that off our list of "done that" and next time we go, I renting a home again. It just makes for a nicer stay. SEPARATE bedrooms, full kitchen, 10 minutes to the parks, pool in the backyard (I think the kids will miss the waterslide though), toys, DVD player and more. At least for our family, it just makes more sense... We rented our home through www.OnlyOrlando.com

Reviews.Title: “Bring your earplugs !”
Reviews.Author: snaggletooth
Reviews.Content: ROOM : "....You could hear a pin drop" Not "so quiet you could hear a pin drop. " BUT "Walls so thin you could hear a pin drop.........in the next room. " I am totally serious. We could hear EVERYTHING from the floor above, from the hallway, from the next room. etc etc etc 6:30 AM, we were awakened by the sounds of the person upstairs urinating. The wake up call for the next room woke us up every morning. The screaming toddler in the next room went on for 1 hour every morning. I think you get the point. Unless you are wearing earplugs, don't plan on a peaceful night's sleep. The beds were comfortable. The room was clean but a bit worn. The bathroom was somewhat small, and the towels were really old , worn and harsh. They reminded me of towels at a motel 6. Maid service was below average. She left a bag of garbage on our bed one day. CHECK IN, CHECK OUT : We used the Disney magical express for our luggage and we have to say that this was the bext thing ever!!!! We checked our bags at the airport, and they appeared in our room a few hours after arrival. Also, the airport check-in service was wonderful too. It was nice not having to deal with luggage. I highly recommend this service. The front desk staff were friendly, and fairly quick with the check-in process. In general, all of the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful. FOOD : We only ate at the hotel for breakfast, and one lunch. The breakfast bar in the lobby was very convenient and not too expensive. The restaurant ( yacht club galley ) was poor however. The service was really really slow, even though we ate lunch at about 2 PM and there were only about a dozen people in the restaurant. The wait staff seemed confused regarding responsibilities of who was taking care of which tables and we sat with empty water glasses for ages, while waiting an eternity for our food. The fish and chips were really greasy, and our waitress recommend them as he favorite item on the menu, so either she likes her fish really greasy, or the other things were even worse. The place also seemed really worn and dirty. We did not use the pool at all so have no comment. We walked to EPCOT and the Boardwalk. Both trips were really easy and took about 5 minutes, so I would not recommend taking the water taxi since you will end up waiting a long time for a very short ride As I will be returning to this hotel next year for another conference I will definately request a top floor room, and definately not one with an adjoining room. I will also pack earplugs just in case!

Reviews.Title: “Jan 2007 family of 4 stay”
Reviews.Author: matttristan
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Yacht Club in mid January of 2007. The pools are great for kids, however the hours the pools open in the morning could be earlier. It was nice that they provided buckets and shovels for the kids to play in the sand. The boat that provide transportation to the boardwalk, epcot, and MGM are an added bonus. The biggest complaint is the quality of food you receive for the amount you pay. For an example: My son (3) went to the character breakfast which was a buffett style. Cost $20 for myself and $12 for my son. We had scrabble eggs, bacon, and cereal. I never had bad scrabble eggs till I ate their. The food is bearly edible at all locations on the resort including the "5 star" steakhouse. By no means is the steakhouse 5 stars dont waste your money eating on the resort including the boardwalk. The only other complaint is that the rooms are small and the service of turn downs and cleaing your room was horrible. Some days they didnt show up till after 12 to clean your room. For example one day we called at 9 am to have someone clean our room why we went to Epcot we came back at noon it still was not done, we called the hotel manager an was told the crew was on lunch break. Having a 3 year old and 1 yr old with you you have to time your events around naps, lunch and to be out of the room so the crew has the space to clean. When I called an complained about the service the hotel manager bascailly said he would address it, no apology, no special threatment. For the price the hotel met my expectations however was expected to leave having them exceeded. I would go back to the hotel its much better then the other resorts I have stayed at through Disney. Also bring allot of singles as ever employee in the resort expect tips for even speaking to you it seemed and they let you know it. For example: My son was sick the first day we got their and my wife was with him in our room while I was out with our daugter. The luggage folks dropped off the luggage while my son was in the middle of being "sick" the guy that dropped the luggage off actually waited for my son to satop being sick so that the my wife could address him and give him his $5 tip. That was my biggest issue is that everyone their wanted a tip for ever little thing and let you know it. That needs to be addressed by Disney. You get exactly what you pay for with Disney now, no extra perks it seems no "special threatment" your simply another guest that dont make you feel "special"

Reviews.Title: “Loved Yacht Club Concierge!”
Reviews.Author: Teece
Reviews.Content: Our family of five stayed on the concierge level at the Yacht Club from 11/17/06 through 11/25/06. It was our first stay, so we couldn't compare it to a previous visit, but we were very impressed with this hotel! The staff was very helpful, and several employees approached US to see if we needed help or had questions. We found the concierge lounge to be well-stocked and maintained. The room was also nicely furnished and very comfortable. The beds were incredibly comfortable!
