Mousekeeping did a good job, and we would come back to our room to discover the stuffed animals arranged in cute ways. We also liked being able to stop at the desk of one of the two employees who were on hand until 10 pm to help us make reservations, check the weather forecast, or answer general questions. The pool, Stormalong Bay, was the best one we've seen at a hotel, even ones in Las Vegas. There is a long, high slide that our kids loved. There was also a lazy river to float down, and a small whirpool that kept us going in circles! At least two employees were on hand to entertain the kids. My 8-year-old daughter raced rubber duckies with some other kids, and when she won was awarded a Magical Moment Certificate signed by Mickey Mouse! She was thrilled. We also saw games of water volleyball and Marco Polo going on. We would not hesitate to recommend this hotel. It is pricey, but we thought it was well-worth the money. Being within walking distance of Epcot and Disney-MGM was a real bonus. It's also a good place for runners - the loop around the water is 0.8 miles and is not crowded at all in the mornings.

Reviews.Title: “Yacht Club needs to find true north again”
Reviews.Author: TVJ
Reviews.Content: Traditionally the Yacht Club has been our favorite resort both in terms of accomodations, location, and amenties. Although the staff remains true and helpful the services in general has fallen to to the wayside. Our concierge level stay was VERY disappointing. Gone are the days of someone asking you if you need anything, how your day was, etc... You are completely on your own with frozen PB&J sandwiches, stale crakers, what appears to be some sort of left over hot apetizer, and dirty wine glasses. Gone is the attention to detail, peanut butter on celery with raisisns (ant on a log) for the kids, juice boxes, and fresh cookies. We plan on trying another Disney resort conceirge level for our Christmas stay and hope to find a differnet level of service. Turndown service was exactly that and nothing more, beds turned down but trash not emptied, towels not replaced, and right during the time (6:30) we were always getting ready to go to dinner. The ri\Rtz it is not but nor do they seem to be trying to achieve any higher level of deft service. Our advice, stock your frig and stay in a regular room.

Reviews.Title: “A Magical Stay”
Reviews.Author: Island_Gen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our honeymoon and I am glad we did. Everything about the property is wonderful, first-class all the way. Everyone that works here is simply helpful as can be and they all seem happy all of the time. The property is lovely and clean and has any amenity one could ever want or need: great pool, gym, salon, lake, restaurants, bars, shops, etc. The food at the restaurants is awesome. And, you are close to anything and everything there is to do in Disney and in Orlando itself. Plus, the hotel will transport you if you would like to any Disney property fo no exptra charge. Staying at teh Yacht Club is not cheap, but if you are willing to shell out about $300 a night is is definately well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A bit off course...”
Reviews.Author: RueStPeter718
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at Disney's Yacht Club. We feel very neutral about the place--neither hated it nor loved it. It was fine. But it was just that--"fine". There was nothing to die for, and nothing we couldn't live without. I grew up in FL and have been going to Disney since about 2 months after the gates first opened at Magic Kingdom (remember E tickets??). During these years, I've been lucky enough to experience many of Disney's various lodging offerings. As a child, we camped every year at Fort Wilderness; I spent my honeymoon at the then Dixie Landings (now Port Orleans Riverside); last Mother's Day was spent at Boardwalk Villas, and so on. I must agree with so many reviewers who have felt a loss of the 'magic'. (If you've not read reviews of the Beach Club, I encourage you to do so. These two properties share quite a few services.) Check in was fine. The room was fine: the bed was comfy and the room clean (both OH, so important). Yes, the bathroom itself was tiny...but the marble surround lovely, and the seperate vanity area helpful. The fridge was nice, as was the balcony. Speaking of--as a personal preference, we reserved a standard view; we've never had any issues with same. At this resort, however, the parking lot noise (which included a Disney Bus laying on it's horn repeatedly at 8 a.m. when a gate failed to lift) was palpable even with the balcony door closed and drapes drawn. Finally, we could hear clearly at about 2 a.m. one morning that our neighbor "couldn't care less". In short, it was a nice-enough, Marriott quality room. It was "fine". What IS exceptional about the Yacht Club: its proximity to EPCOT and pool area for younger kids. But they say "it's the little things", and I suppose that's how we felt. At 300 smackers in the off-season, even some tiny extra touches would seem both appropriate and appreciated. A small basket in your room at check-in with a loofah and sea salts to soak? Perhaps a small box of salt water taffy with a note signed by Mickey or Ariel? Either of these would cost Disney what--two or three bucks? Some small, non-essential something--ANYTHING--which would add to the 'magic' and say, "Hey, thanks for dropping your dough at a Deluxe". Simply put, we feel as though we spent a fairly large chunk of change for a decent hotel with a great location, and have yet to decide if that reasons out. We currently have a reservation for the Yacht Club in the near future. At this point, however, we are VERY tempted to revisit the moderate resorts. One still enjoys many of the same perks, but at half the cost. It may be worth a try to at least to see if it is myself--or Disney--who has changed so much.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Room, Great View, Amazing Pool”
Reviews.Author: pvbmom
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Yacht Club. It could not have been a better family vacation. I did not give 5 stars because the service at the pool side restaurant was very slow and careless each day. You also have to walk over to the Beach Club for a lot of things, however the resort was amazing. The rest of the staff was incredible. We had a fabulous view and a wonderful balcony. We would go back again and again. The food was most expensive, hey it is Disney. There is a fridge in the room, so I would bring more of my own food next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort, Loved it....Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: cliff1788
Reviews.Content: Based on prior reviews I was skeptical about the condition and service at the Resort. We were pleasantly surprised that the Resort was meticulously maintained and very clean throughout. Check in could have been rough but the staff quickly escorted my family to the concierge area to check in. This may be because we arrived aboard the Magical Express and they knew to expect a crowd. The hotel staff was very friendly. In fact it always seemed like they were going out of the way to help in some way. This was our 3rd trip to Disney so we knew what to expect price wise on the food. All of the food in the restaurants was average to above average with a price range that is consistent with all Resorts across the country. Beaches and Cream is a must. The food is above average and the wait staff is exceptional. You have to have the ice cream!!! The pools at this resort are fabulous but let me warn you..We have 3 kids ages 8, 5 and 2. The 8 year old wanted to stay on the water slide. The 5 year old wanted to go round and round in the whirlpool...not hot tub..whirlpool!..and the 2 year old wanted to hang out in the sandy pool. 3 kids and 2 parents kind of caused a problem but the kids had to adjust. Somehow we managed to do it all and no tears were shed. The resort is an EASY walk to Epcot which makes it easy to enjoy everything that Epcot has to offer. And with all of the new stuff at Epcot (Soarin', Test Track, Mission Space, etc) the stock in this resort is sure to rise. Overall we thoroughly enjoyed the Yacht Club Resort. We felt it was money well spent. Last but not least..the resort is EXCEPTIONALLY quiet. The beds arethe most comfortable hotel beds we have ever experienced....HANDS DOWN. Overall I would rank this resort a little behind the Grand Floridian but light years ahead of the Swan and Dolphin!

Reviews.Title: “Spoiled Rotten by Disney”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Date: July 11, 2006 Reviewer: Trip Advisor Member, Camby, Indiana Our family spent our spring break at Disney World during the week of April 2nd. This trip surpassed all of our other Disney vacations. Upon check-in at Disney's Yacht Club, we were informed that we had been upgraded to the Concierge Level. The service couldn't have been better! Each cast member (from Concierge to Housekeeping) was delightful. The attention to detail and comfort was incredibly good. The Concierge staff always kept the lounge stocked with plenty of food and drink. If they didn't have what you wanted... they would get it. No request was unfulfilled. The cast members at the Concierge desk were extremely helpful in acquiring priority seating for us at any of the Disney restaurants. Their knowledge of daily events at the different parks was a huge help in planning our days. I can't complain about anything regarding our trip to the Yacht Club. We will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Yacht Club”
Reviews.Author: RNnyusa
Reviews.Content: We went 5/6/06 until 5/14/06, two 40 y/o females, no kids.The Yacht Club grounds are immaculately kept, not a piece of litter, you could eat your dinner off the boardwalk, flowers and plants are beautiful with not a bug in sight (except for cute families of ducks foraging in the shrubbery) ! We had a view of the quiet pool which was just that, quiet. In the mornings we ate breakfast out on our private terrace (each room has a private terrace) or at least we were separated from our neighbours by a divider. Our room had only one terrace chair, we could see two chairs on all of the other terraces. We called every day, for 3 days for a second chair which never arrived so we gave up calling and just took the writing-desk chair out. The rooms are very large, there was only two of us in the room tho'. The bathroom is small but it is what I am used to in my apartment, the double vanity is just outside the bathroom with plenty of light and mirrors. Our room was always clean, but like another reviewer wrote, no Disney towel-animals or anything cute at all. I thought it was because they knew we didn't have kids with us? We used the Galley for dinner once. The food was ok, typical Disney fare and the service was good. Glad we had the dining plan because meals are expensive, it looked like there were plenty of wealthy people staying there too, we saw folks all dressed up eating in the Yacht Club's Steakhouse and bar area. One evening we went to the arcade which was a lot of fun and Beaches and Cream looked popular with teenagers. The pool area was always very busy but very clean and well-kept, the guests all seemed like nice people. Hurricane Hannahs Grill at the poolside served great counter service burgers and wraps and great cocktails! It closed at 6pm. There is a fake beach area across from the pool area which was usually empty, we sat there a couple of times and enjoyed the peace and quiet. At the main pool, there is some shade under the trees and a couple of umbrellas if you can get one, but there's not much shade at the "beach." We didn't sit by the quiet-pool at all. There are plenty of towels to use for free at the pool areas, you get a wristband to wear when you enter. Staff were all helpful and friendly. Yes there were several stains on the carpet leading to our room, we used to check for new ones each day. I'd say about 7 stains from the lobby to our room on the 3rd floor, and room service trays were usually outside people's doors when we were going out in the morning only, we'd pass <5 each day, but the hotel does tell guests to either call to have the trays picked up from your room or to leave the trays outside the door for pick-up, so it is inevitable that used food-trays will be in the hallways unless Yacht Club changes this policy. Twice out of 4 times requested we didn't get the wake-up call (you program it yourself using the telephone). I can't say it was my fault because i did it right and got my confirmation message too. The gift shop on site sells lots of useful things and is open late , after 9pm anyway. The lobby is beautiful and the varnished floors are very shiny. Bus service by Disney transport was fair. I'd read that Yacht club's service is more frequent than others, but we still had to wait a few minutes at times, certainly the buses that came for us were empty, but on the way home from MK it seemed to take for ever because it stopped at other resorts and i fell asleep at least once on the way home. We used Mears transport once to go to SeaWorld and they picked us Yacht Clubbers up first, so we had the good seats. Room service was about $23-$40 for 2 for breakfast (e.g. coffee and tea with English muffin vs. with bacon, cereals and oj added). On our last day i discovered a store at the Boardwalk (across the lake from the Yacht Club) which sold some groceries like milk, bread jelly tea coffee etc. If i'd known sooner I'd have bought some and not bothere with room service. There is a coffee maker/hot water maker in the room with about 2 tea bags and some instant coffee supplied by the hotel, but no milk or cream of course unless you order room-service. The store on the Boardwalk is a big souvenir store, i don't remember the name but it is the only one there, and at the back are all the groceries. There is a large pristine gym on site with exercise room, weights and many machines. We rented the Sea Ray little speed boats which were very very slow, we rented for $24 1/2 hour which was long enough, we drove up to MGM area, under a bridge passing the Swan and Dolphin hotels. It was nice but slow like i said. Also for hire were pontoon boats and bicycle thingys for up to 8 people. You could walk left towards Epcot, about 10 mminutes, or right towards MGM, 25 mins. Across from the hotel is The Boardwalk which was fun to explore, so plenty of things to do that's for sure. you can also take the boat transport from the Yacht Club pier over to the Boardwalk, although it is quicker to walk, or else you can take the boat to MGM too. As it was my first time at WDW i would have preferred to stay closer to Magic Kingdom because we loved this park and also Animal Kingdom, transport to these parks is long from the Yacht Club.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just spent 8 days at this hotel, it was excellent to say the least. I was with my two young boys and my wife in a 5th flloor concierge room. We loved this place. The boys loved the pool area, the game room and beaches and cream. The location is the best in disney with the boardwalk and epcot a short walk away. The staff was always helpfull and went out of the way to make sure we were always happy. I could go on and on but i will keep this short. We travel a lot as a family and i assure you i will be back to the yacht club soon.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: PrincessWife
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days at this hotel. Checkin was fast, friendly & efficient. Walk to room was a little long especially at the end of the day. Room was big & roomy. Housekeeping was not quite up to Disney standards....no little washcloth animals, fingerprints on the glass doors at checkin and they were never cleaned or the new one either that our grandchildren made. We did have trouble most days negotiating around the dishes in the hall left from room service. The same dishes were there morning to night. What we LOVED about this hotel was location,location,location! It was so convienent to walk to Epcot or MGM. We also took the boat to MGM and many times did part of the day at Epcot & took the monorail to the Magic Kingdom. We loved having the Boardwalk right here too. We would go over there to eat or buy things to take back to the room at the store. If the room was cleaner & the room wasn't so far from the lobby this place would have been a perfect 10!

Reviews.Title: “Dad's review from a family of 6”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights before we bounced to Portofino at Universal. Our stay would have been acceptable at less than half what we payed. No way is this a deluxe resort. Recommend other Disney resorts with favorable reviews, or the Portofino. Proâ€™s: Proximity to EPCOT. Architecture Quiet Conâ€™s: Poor service- 2 hours for extra pillow. Never delivered crib. Rude staff- first morning at buffet was unpleasant, thanks wholly to wait staff Awful bed- busted springs in mattress, actually sticking through sheet Cleanliness- stained carpet, smelly bathroom Small- room proper OK, bathroom like a trailer water closet-TINY! EXPENSIVE- $$$

Reviews.Title: “This place was reallllly nice!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Yacht Club in early December, it was wonderful! The pool and the lagoon and the ferries! We also loved the fact that it was so close to Epcot! Ant the food at the conference center? Magnifico!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In Disney”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was is truly amazing, going last year was the 5th time I have been there. All the people that gave this resort a bad rating are truly mentaly impaired. This is a great resort, there is nothing bad about this place, I really feel sorry for the people that said they had a bad time.

Reviews.Title: “Improved!”
Reviews.Author: traveler1345
Reviews.Content: Throughout the years, we've been to Walt Disney World dozens of times. We've been to the Yacht Club twice, the first visit was two months after 9-11. We had an older room, which needed small updates. At the Yachtsman Steakhouse I had ordered a 6 ounce filet mignon, and was served a peppered 3 ounce breakfast steak. Service did not try to fix anything. Even my seven-year-old daughter had stated that the chicken was the best thing on the menu at the steakhouse! In October of 2005, we went back to the Yacht Club. The rooms had slightly been refurbished, which did make the room feel more worth the money. The Yachtsman Steakhouse was delicous, and service was very friendly. Though the Walt Disney World parks had been very crowded, we had a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disney Again & Again”
Reviews.Author: jacksondxmg
Reviews.Content: Just returned from yet another trip to Disney World. (4th time this year) The yacht club was nice but I just do not think that it is worth the price! It did not stand out to me. I really enjoyed previous stays at the Boardwalk and Saratoga Springs. Before that we stayed at Port Orleans Riverside and Carribean Beach. I would classify the Yacht Club as more Port Orleans than deluxe. (just my opinion) Next time I will spend the extra money and stay at the Contemporary Resort as is unmatched by any other Disney Property!!!! Note- As with any Disney Resort food can be hard to come by when you realize how hungry you actually are. Yacht Club did provide prompt room service at 1:15AM in the morning after a long night at The Magic Kingdom. Also- Be ready for long walks as you try to navigate your way around. I WILL NOT STAY HERE AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient. But pricey”
Reviews.Author: weiaze
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Yacht Club hotel on their executive floor on a business trip. The price was USD315 per night. I arrived at 7 am and had a mixed welcome. The doorman, who looked like a teenager still in high school, opened the door and immediately asked me if I wanted my bags taken to my room. As I was talking to the limo driver, I didn't respond immediately. The doorman lost interest and just left me! Maybe he thought my non-response meant no, but he interrrupted me in the middle of my conversation with the limo driver. As I dragged my suitcase into the hotel I caught sight of him chatting and laughing with his other high school looking colleagues. The check-in counter was deserted and I had to wait for about 5 minutes before someone showed up. I was attended to by a small, young looking chap but fortunately he was very efficient and courteous and tried his best to make me feel welcome. Because I was out of country and I did not inform my credit card company, my credit card was blocked initially. This guy told me to settle in and resolve the credit card issue at my leisure. He even seemed very apologetic to bother me about having to call my credit card company even though it was my fault for not informing my credit card company I was going abroad. Anyway, the executive floor was simple but nice. The corridors are long so it was quite a hike to my room. But the room was clean, spacious and pretty, if a little dated. It had a nice balcony but unfortunately it overlooked a rooftop covered with wood chips and steam vents and the convention center. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was decent sized. There were twin sinks outside the bathroom. The TV had lots of local channels as well as an annoying Disney channel that kept playing the same promotional programs over and over again. They had a private dining room on the executive floor where they served doughnuts, bananas, toast and cereal all day long. A note: when you step out of the elevator on the exec floor you immediately come face to face with two staff sitting at desks. It's a fairly awkward moment as they're literally in your face. I think it would have been better to place the desks not facing the elevator as now they just look awkwardly at you when you step into/out of the lift. The best thing about the hotel is that it is really convenient. Right in front of the hotel is a jetty where you can catch a boat to MGM studios or Epcot. It's a very cool way to arrive at the theme parks.

Reviews.Title: “Faded glory”
Reviews.Author: nys
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Yacht and Beach Club with family six times over the past five years. Initial stays were incredible. However, our stay in August '05 was a big disapointment. Expensive, as expected, but the place is not as well maintained as it once was. Our room over looked the pool with a private balcony, but the decor is really starting to show its age. Shabby carpet, faded spreads, and lumpy bed. Unusual for a Disney property. The pool and water slide are fabulous, but the bathrooms near the pool were dirty by noon and were't refreshed until the next day. Yuck by 5 p.m.! The restaurants on sight were a disaster. The Yachtsmans Steakhouse was EXORBITANTLY over priced $$$! Everything $30. +. Crazy with kids. The Yacht Club Galley, a mid price restaurant ($15. - $20.), was just AWFUL! We tried everything on the limited menu and none of it was edible. It all tasted like frozen food. The pool restaurant, Hurricane Hanna's, is just blah sandwiches, but expensive too. The resort is a long way, (mostly waiting for the bus) to the Magic Kingdom and MGM. Overall, other Disney resorts are a better choice until price here is lower and the furnishings are updated.

Reviews.Title: “Disney Magic”
Reviews.Author: falsesmall
Reviews.Content: Have been to several moderate and deluxe Disney resorts but first time at Yacht and Beach. Can't understand going to WDW and not staying at a Disney resort. The Yacht club is a perfect example as to why. Visually stunning resort across the lake and walking distance to the beautiful Boardwalk resort. Also walking distance to Epcot and MGM (also boat service here as walk is a bit long). Across a footpath from the Swan/Dolphin resort complex. Yacht and beach share a "pool" that is actually a mini water park called Stormalong Bay. Also the reort has "quiet pools" and jacuzzis if you need to get away from the din of the big pool. Access to many restaurants both at Yacht & Beach and Boardwalk including ESPN Zone, a Steakouse and seafood buffett. However no food court per se, very handy for small families and usually a Disney staple. Fabolous ice cream parlor and burger joint that is a must visit (Beaches & Cream), but be prepared to wait a bit as it it is very popular (remember no food court!). Rooms are nice but a bit small for a hotel of this class. However all have balconies that add to the space and charm.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful resort, for a steep price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Yacht Club for two nights when my company bought out most of the resort as part of a 20th anniversary celebration. It is one of the nicer Disney resorts I've stayed in, and lives up to the expectations of a Disney deluxe resort. My room was nicely decorated and extremely clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and was well prepared to deal with over 1000 people arriving and checking in at the same time. The resort's proximity to Epcot is a real convenience, and the boat ride to the studios might not be any faster than the busses (which were very efficient), but was a nice change. The only negative would probably be the price. If I had been the one paying for the stay, I probably would not have felt the hotel worth it - not that it wasn't a great place, but the moderate Disney resorts are almost as extravagant, for a lot less money.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about this hotel...Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: PAP179
Reviews.Content: I have been to the Disney resort about 15 times and I must say that this is my favorite spot (& the adjacent Beach Club Resort). It is in a perfect location - walking distance to Epcot, the Boardwalk, and a short boat ride to MGM Studios. The pool is wonderful, Beaches & Cream is the best ice cream shoppe, & Cape May breakfast buffet leaves out nothing! I would (and will) stay here over and over again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a water view room and had a small private balcony that overlooked the bay area and the Epcot fireworks! Room was fair sized for 5 of us, and cleanliness was no problem. I did find the walk to our room annoying as we were in a wing that required a loooong windy journey down the hallways, and the lighting seemed too dim. The pool area is shared with the Beach Club (and yes there is a beach) it is the best pool area on property! 3 Acres of lazy rivers, pools(heated) whirlpools, jaccuzis, a huge water slide all very well themed-very nice. (a bit of a walk from the Yacht club if you swim stay at the Beach Club which is attatched to Yacht club and has the pool area directly behind it) This is an adult oriented resort-LOTS of business people walking around with cell phones- which is kind of annoying when you're on vacation! (there's a huge convention center there) Housekeeping made little bunnies and puppies out of the towels with little eyes and everything-a nice touch for the kids! Directly behind our room was dock for water taxi that takes you to Epcot and/or MGM studios-very convienient and a lovely ride too!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice place, but with some minor complaints”
Reviews.Author: greenespace
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Yacht Club for a conference my company was holding. The hotel is quite nice- upon entry, you're greeted by a dramatic entry way and beautiful lobby, matched with above average service from the staff. My room was nice and the view exceptional- a beautiful lake and evening fireworks are something you don't get at home every night, that's for sure. Rooms were nicer than they appeared in the pictures, which is a little unusual- usually it's the other way around. My only complaint came from the room having walls that are too thin. While trying to sleep, I could hear one neighbor snoring and another talking about their day- perfectly. It made me hesitant to make business calls or calls to my wife from the room, knowing that they could be heard so easily. In addition, the conference area was in a location that required you to go outside the hotel to get to. Not a problem unless it rains... which it did. We also got some of the coldest weather of the season, which made it a bit tough transferring materials back and forth. Good points included a friendly staff, excellent food at the conference, and an air of magic that pervades the entire Disney experience. The other good news is that the place wasn't overrun with children running and screaming, which you will find at some of the Disney locations. I'd recommend it for adults who are staying at Disney who want a more adult experience but want to stay on the grounds. It is quite pricey though- not for the budget conscious.

Reviews.Title: “WOnderful Location!”
Reviews.Author: willysgrandma
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for four nights at the Disney Yacht Club Resort. As with all Disney premium properties, this hotel provided steller service and a great room. Our room was spotless and located with a "canal" outside the balconey. We were conveniently located near the bridge to walk over to the Boardwalk. The location was nice and quiet and it was great to take a walk over the bridge for entertainment at night. This location is one of the few in Disney that has a boat that goes to both Epcot and MGM Studios. Boat service was frequent. There was a lovely pool area and some outdoor snack bars. My only issue was the distance from the lobby to the room. We had a difficult time getting to our room - it was a maze of hallways as we were located the furthest from the lobby. We finally discovered it was easier to walk from our room outside and use the walkway and boardwalk to get to the hotel lobby - but this was inconvenient in the rain. The hotel also provide a lundormat so that you can wash your clothes and thus pack less. All in all, if you'd like a quiet place to stay, this and the Beach Club resort are perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Wonderful Property”
Reviews.Author: Keystone_Traveler
Reviews.Content: This was our family's first trip to Walt Disney World. We certainly debated over where to stay; however, choosing the Yacht Club Resort was a great choice, and one we would definitely make a second time. Please note, we stayed during the off-season; the hotel was pleasantly not crowded. (If your schedule allows it, we highly recommend visiting WDW in the off-season. We could not imagine dealing with crowds during the busy seasons). Our waterview room (No. 4063) gave us a full panaromic view of the Disney Boardwalk area, Epcot (Spaceship Earth, Eifel Tower, etc.), and views of the neighboring resorts (Beach Club, Boardwalk and Swan/Dolphin). The Illuminations Laser/Light show at Epcot could be seen each night from our balcony. While we did not spend a lot of time at the resort, the beautiful morning and evening views from the balcony made it a very memorable part of our trip, and definitely worth the extra expense. Stormalong Bay was a big hit with our two teenage boys. Housekeeping was good; mattresses/pillows were very comfortable; decor was pleasant; service/attitude from all employees was excellent; car valets were extremely prompt and knowledgeable. The location is absolutely excellent. It allows one to walk to Epcot (via International Gateway); walk or boat to MGM-Disney; jog/walk around the Boardwalk (0.8 mile roundtrip) for a little excercise; go out for breakfast, dinner, ice cream, or late night drink at one of the great Boardwalk restaurants or bars. We walked through all five Epcot Area resort grounds and lobbies, and voted Yacht Club number One for us. During our visit (first week in February), Beach Club seemed overun with young families/young kids; however, it was a very nice sister resort to Yacht Club and shared much of the same great atmosphere; Swan/Dolphin are nice, but seemed too much like city high-rise hotels; Boardwalk was our No. 2 choice; however, depending on what room you get, it might be a bit noisy. We're sure that the views from Swan/Dolphin are great; but, we felt having a waterview room with a balcony at the Yacht Club had more atmosphere and did a better job in creating a WOW factor.

HotelInfo.Name: Disney's Yacht Club Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 1700 Epcot Resorts Boulevard, Orlando, FL 32830
